Cross - system has crossed a percentage of the orders and allows market to rspond prior to crossing remaining portion

Identifies an event related to the mass trading status.
Denotes the reason for the Opening Delay or Trading halt of a group of securities.

fielddef.item: Not available for trading (end of session)
Pre-cross - system is in a pre-cross state allowing market to respond to either side of cross
Cross - system has crossed a percentage of the orders and allows market to rspond prior to crossing remaining portion

Describes a sub-class for a given class of service defined by MDFeedType (1022)
Denotes the reason for the Opening Delay or Trading Halt.
Used to represent the trade ID for each side of the trade assigned by an intermediary.
Used to capture the original trade id for each side of a trade undergoing novation to a standardized model.

fielddef.name: DifferentialPrice
fielddef.descr: Used to specify the differential price when reporting the individual leg of a spread trade. Both leg price and differential price may be provided on such a report. Note that MultiLegReportingType(442) will be set to 2 (Individual leg of a multi-leg security) in this case. Also used in pricing Trade at Settlement (TAS) and Trade At Marker (TAM) contracts for which the value is the negotiated currency offset either at settlement (TAS) or at time specified in the product definition (TAM). The final contract price is specified in LastPx(31).

descr.p: Used to indicate the status of the trade submission (not the trade report)

Default currency in which the price is quoted. Defined at the instrument level. Used in place of Currency (tag 15) to express the currency of a product when the former is implemented as the FX dealt currency.

Default currency in which the price is quoted. Defined at the instrument level. Used in place of Currency (tag 15) to express the currency of a product when the former is implemented as the FX dealt currency.

Default currency in which the price is quoted. Defined at the instrument level. Used in place of Currency (tag 15) to express the currency of a product when the former is implemented as the FX dealt currency.

Default currency in which the price is quoted. Defined at the instrument level. Used in place of Currency (tag 15) to express the currency of a product when the former is implemented as the FX dealt currency.
Number of Security Classifications.
Allows classification of instruments according to a set of high level reasons. Classification reasons describe the classes in which the instrument participates.
Specifies the product classification value which further details the manner in which the instrument participates in the class.
Specifies the reason for an amount type when reported on a position. Useful when multiple instances of the same amount type are reported.
Number of TrdInstrmtLegPosAmt values.
Leg position amount.
Type of leg position amount.
Leg position currency.
Specifies the reason for an amount type when reported on a position. Useful when multiple instances of the same amount type are reported.

Type of quantity specified in LegQty field. LegContractMultiplier (614) is required when LegQtyType = 1 (Contracts). LegUnitOfMeasure (tag 999) and LegTimeUnit (tag 1001) are required when LegQtyType = 2 (Units of Measure per Time Unit). LegQtyType can be different for each leg.
Used to calculate the present value of an amount to be paid in the future.

Contains the IndividualAllocId (tag 467) value of the allocation that is being offset as a result of a new allocation. This would be an optional field that would only be populated in the case of an allocation of an allocation (as well as any subsequent allocations). This wouldn't be populated for an initial allocation since an allocation id is not supplied on default (initial) allocations.
Represents the product group of a leg.This is useful in conveying multi-leg instruments where the legs may participate in separate security groups.
Risk adjusted price used to calculate variation margin on a position.
Alternate clearing price
Alternate clearing price for the side being reported.

Price Differential between the front and back leg of a spread or complex instrument.
Represents the total number of simple instruments that make up a multi-legged security. Complex spread instruments may be constructed of legs which themselves are multi-leg instruments.

Used to convey the initially requested display quantity specified in DisplayQty(1138) on order entry and modification messages in ExecutionReport message. Applicable only in ExecutionReport message where DisplayQty(1138) is the currently displayed quantity and the requested display quantity of the order also needs to be conveyed. The values of the two fields are different as soon as the order is partially filled and also after a refresh of the order whenever DisplayMethod(1084) is not 1=Initial.

valblockdef.item: Investment program (generalized fund for major investors)
Specialized account (specialized fund setup for a particular account or group of accounts.)

valblockdef.name: DayCount
valblockdef.item: 1/1 (If parties specify the Day Count Fraction to be 1/1 then in calculating the applicable amount, 1 is simply input into the calculation as the relevant Day Count Fraction.)

30/360 (30U/360 or Bond Basis) (Mainly used in the US with the following date adjustment rules: (1) If the investment is End-Of-Month and Date1 is the last day of February and Date2 is the last day of February, then change Date2 to 30; (2) If the investment is End-Of-Month and Date1 is the last day of February, then change Date1 to 30; (3) If Date2 is 31 and Date1 is 30 or 31, then change Date2 to 30; (4) If Date1 is 31, then change Date1 to 30.)
30/360 (SIA) (A variant of "30/360" - when Date1 and Date2 are both Feb. 28th or 29th convert them to 30th using the same logic in the conversion of 31st to 30th.)

30/360M (Commonly used day count convention for US mortgage backed securities. Feb 28th (or 29th in a leap year) is always considered as a 30th for a start date. As a comparison, in the regular 30/360 day count as used by most US agency and corporate bonds, a start date of Feb 28th (or 29th in a leap year) is still considered as the 28th (or 29th) day of a month of 30 days.)

30E/360 (Eurobond Basis) (Also known as 30/360.ISMA, 30S/360, or Special German. Date adjustment rules are: (1) If Date1 falls on the 31st, then change it to the 30th; (2) If Date2 falls on the 31st, then change it to the 30th.)

30E/360 (ISDA) (Date adjustment rules are: (1) if Date1 is the last day of the month, then change Date1 to 30; (2) if D2 is the last day of the month (unless Date2 is the maturity date and Date2 is in February), then change Date2 to 30.)
Act/360 (The actual number of days between Date1 and Date2, divided by 360.)
Act/365 (FIXED) (The actual number of days between Date1 and Date2, divided by 365.)

Act/Act (AFB) (The actual number of days between Date1 and Date2, the denominator is either 365 (if the calculation period does not contain the 29th February) or 366 (if the calculation period includes 29th February).)

Act/Act ICMA (The denominator is the actual number of days in the coupon period multiplied by the number of coupon periods in the year. Assumes that regular coupons alwaysfall on the same day of the month where possible.)
Act/Act (ICMA Ultimo) (The Act/Act (ICMA Ultimo) differs from Act/Act (ICMA) method only that it assumes that regular coupons always fall on the last day of the month.)

Act/Act ISDA (The denominator varies depending on whether a portion of the relevant calculation period falls within a leap year. For the portion of the calculation period falling in a leap year, the denominator is 366 and for the portion falling outside a leap year, the denominator is 365.)
BUS/252 (Used for Brazilian Real swaps which is based on business days instead of calendar days. The number of business days divied by 252)

30E+/360 (Variation on 30E/360. Date adjustment rules: (1) If Date1 falls on the 31st, then change it to the 30th; (2) If Date2 falls on the 31st, then change it to 1 and increase Month2 by one, i.e. next month)

Act/365L (The number of days in a period equal to the actual number of days. The number of days in a year is 365, or if the period ends in a leap year 366. Used for Sterling floating rate notes. May also be referred to as ISMA-Year.)
NL365 (The number of days in a period equal to the actual number of days, with the exception of leap days (29th February) which are ignored. The number of days in a year is 365, even in a leap year.)
NL360 (This is the same as Act/360, with the exception of leap days (29th February) which are ignored.)
Act/364 (The actual number of days between Date1 and Date2, divided by 364.)

valblockdef.name: EventQualifier
valblockdef.item: Retructuring - multiple holding obligations (In relation to a restructuring credit event, unless multiple holder obligation is not specified restructurings are limited to multiple holder obligations. A multiple holder obligation means an obligation that is held by more than three holders that are not affiliates of each other and where at least two thirds of the holders must agree to the event that constitutes the restructuring credit event. ISDA 2003 Term: Multiple Holder Obligation)

Restructuring - multiple credit event notices (Presence of this element and value set to 'true' indicates that Section 3.9 of the 2003 Credit Derivatives Definitions shall apply. Absence of this element indicates that Section 3.9 shall not apply. NOTE: Not allowed under ISDA Credit 1999)

valblockdef.name: CalculationAgent
valblockdef.item: As specified in the master agreement
As specified in the standard terms supplement

valblockdef.name: RateSource

valblockdef.name: DateRollConvention
valblockdef.item: The floating rate note convention or Eurodollar convention.
The International Money Market settlement date, i.e. the 3rd Wednesday of the month.

The 13-week and 26-week U.S. Treasury Bill auction dates.

fielddef.name: EncodedEventTextLen
fielddef.descr: Byte length of encoded (non-ASCII characters) EncodedEventText(868) field.

fielddef.name: EncodedEventText
fielddef.descr: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the EventText(868) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding (347) field. If used, the ASCII (English) representation should also be specified in the EventText(868) field.

fielddef.name: RegulatoryTradeID
fielddef.descr: Trade identifier required by government regulators or other regulatory organizations for regulatory reporting purposes. For example, unique swap identifer (USI) as required by the U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission.

descr.p: Identifies the event which caused origination of the identifier in Regulatory TradeID(1903)

fielddef.name: RegulatoryTradeIDSource
fielddef.descr: Identifies the reporting entity that originated the value in RegulatoryTradeID(1903). The reporting entitiy identifier may be assigned by a regulator.

fielddef.name: RegulatoryTradeIDType
fielddef.item: Cleared block trade (Assigned by the CCP to a bunched order/trade when it needs to be cleared with the standby clearing firm prior to post-trade allocation)
fielddef.descr: Specifies the type of trade identifier provided in RegulatoryTradeID(1903). Contextual hierarchy of events for the same trade or transaction maybe captured through use of the different RegulatoryTradeIDType(1906) values using multiple instances of the repeating group as needed for regulatory reporting.

fielddef.name: NoRegulatoryTradeIDs
fielddef.descr: Number of regulatory IDs in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: NoAllocRegulatoryTradeIDs
fielddef.descr: Number of regulatory IDs in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: AllocRegulatoryTradeID
fielddef.descr: Trade identifier required by government regulators or other regulatory organizations for regulatory reporting purposes. For example, unique swap identifer (USI) as required by the U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission.

fielddef.name: AllocRegulatoryTradeIDSource
fielddef.descr: Identifies the reporting entity that originated the value in AllocRegulatoryTradeID(1909). The reporting entity identifier may be assigned by a regulator.

fielddef.name: AllocRegulatoryTradeIDEvent
fielddef.descr: Identifies the event which caused the origination of the identifier in AllocRegulatoryTradeID(1909). When more than one event is the cause, use the higher enumeration value. For example, if the identifier is originated due to an allocated trade which was cleared and reported, use the enumeration value 2(Clearing).

fielddef.name: AllocRegulatoryTradeIDType
fielddef.descr: Specifies the type of trade identifier provided in AllocRegulatoryTradeID(1909), within the context of the hierarchy of trade events.

fielddef.name: ClearingIntention
fielddef.descr: Specifies the party's or parties' intention to clear the trade.

fielddef.name: TradeClearingInstruction
fielddef.item: Automatic posting mode (trade posting to the position account number specified)
Automatic give-up mode (trade give-up to the give-up destination number specified)

fielddef.name: BackloadedTradeIndicator
fielddef.descr: Indicates that the trade being reported occurred in the past and is still in effect or active.

descr.p: Specifies how a trade was confirmed.

fielddef.name: MandatoryClearingIndicator
fielddef.descr: An indication that the trade is flagged for mandatory clearing.

fielddef.name: MixedSwapIndicator
fielddef.descr: An indication that the trade is a mixed swap.

fielddef.name: OffMarketPriceIndicator

fielddef.name: VerificationMethod
fielddef.descr: Indication of how a trade was verified.

fielddef.name: ClearingRequirementException
fielddef.item: End-user exception (Elaboration: In the US, see CFTC Final Rule on End-User Exception to Clearing Requirements for Swaps Fact Sheet http://www.cftc.gov/ucm/groups/public/@newsroom/documents/file/eue_factsheet_final.pdf)

Inter-affiliate exception (Elaboration: In the US, see CFTC Final Rule - Clearing Exemption for Swaps Between Certain Affiliated Entities http://www.cftc.gov//ucm/groups/public/@lrfederalregister/documents/file/2013-07970a.pdf)

Treasury affiliate exception (Elaboration: In the US, see CFTC NoAction Letter 13-22 No Action Relief from the Clearing Requirement for Swaps Entered into by Eligible Treasury Affiliates http://www.cftc.gov/ucm/groups/public/@lrlettergeneral/documents/letter/13-22.pdf)

Cooperative exception (Elaboration: Clearing exception for certain swaps entered into by cooperatives. In the US, see Regulation 50.51(a) Definition of Exempt Cooperative: https://www.federalregister.gov/articles/2013/08/22/2013-19945/clearingexemption-for-certain-swaps-enteredinto-by-cooperatives)

descr.p: Specifies whether a party to a swap is using exception to a clearing requirement. In the US, one such clearing requirement is CFTC's rule pursuant to CEA Section 2(h)(1)

fielddef.name: IRSDirection
fielddef.descr: Used to specify whether the principal is paying or receiving the fixed rate in an interest rate swap.

fielddef.name: RegulatoryReportType
fielddef.item: Combination of RT, PET and confirmation

Post trade event RT reportable (Report of a regulated transaction continuation event that falls within the requirements for real-time reporting and public dissemination. If dissemination is to be suppressed due to an end user exception or to local regulatory rules that allow suppression of certain types of transactions, use TradePublishIndicator(1390) = 0 (Do not publish trade)
Volume Omission Trade Eligible for Subsequent Aggregated Enrichment
Full Details Trade of "Limited Details Trade"
Full Details of "Four Weeks Aggregation Trade"
Full Details in Aggregated Form of "Volume Omission Trade Eligible for Subsequent Aggregated Enrichment"
fielddef.descr: Type of regulatory report.

fielddef.name: VoluntaryRegulatoryReport
fielddef.descr: Used in conjunction with RegulatoryReportType(1934) to indicate whether the trade report is a voluntary regulatory report. If not specified, the default for a regulatory report is "N". When VoluntaryRegulatoryReport(1935)=Y it is recommended that one of the parties to the trade be identified as the voluntary reporting party through PartySubIDType(803) = 63 (Voluntary reporting entity).

fielddef.name: TradeCollateralization
fielddef.descr: Specifies how the trade is collateralized.

descr.p: Specifies the post-execution trade continuation or lifecycle event. Additional values may be used by mutual agreement of the counterparties.

fielddef.name: AssetClass
fielddef.descr: The broad asset category for assessing risk exposure.

descr.p: The subcategory description of the asset class.

tr.td:
13 = Metals
14 = Bullion
15 = Energy
16 = Commodity index
17 = Agricultural
18 = Environmental
19 = Freight

4 = Single name
5 = Credit index
6 = Index tranche
7 = Credit basket
8 = Total return

9 = Common
10 = Preferred
11 = Equity index
12 = Equity basket

fielddef.name: AssetType
fielddef.descr: Used to provide more specific description of the asset specified in AssetSubClass(1939). See https://www.fixtrading.org/codelists/AssetType for code list of applicable values. ISO 4721 Currency Code values are to be used when specific currency as an asset type is to be expressed. Other values may be used by mutual agreement of the counterparties.

fielddef.name: SwapClass
fielddef.descr: The classification or type of swap. Additional values may be used by mutual agreement of the counterparties.

fielddef.name: NthToDefault
fielddef.descr: The Nth reference obligation to default in a CDS reference basket. If specified without MthToDefault(1943) the default will trigger a CDS payout. If MthToDefault(1943) is also present then payout occurs between the Nth and Mth obligations to default.

fielddef.name: MthToDefault
fielddef.descr: The Mth reference obligation to default in a CDS reference basket. When NthToDefault(1942) and MthToDefault(1943) are represented then the CDS payout occurs between the Nth and Mth obligations to default.

fielddef.name: SettledEntityMatrixSource
fielddef.descr: Relevant settled entity matrix source.

fielddef.name: SettledEntityMatrixPublicationDate
fielddef.descr: Specifies the publication date of the applicable version of the matrix. If not specified, the Standard Terms Supplement defines rules for which version of the matrix is applicable.

fielddef.name: CouponType
fielddef.descr: Coupon type of the bond.

fielddef.name: TotalIssuedAmount
fielddef.descr: Specifies the total amount of the issue. Corresponds to the par value multiplied by the number of issued securities.

fielddef.name: CouponFrequencyPeriod
fielddef.descr: Time unit multiplier for the frequency of the bond's coupon payment.

fielddef.name: CouponFrequencyUnit
fielddef.descr: Time unit associated with the frequency of the bond's coupon payment.

fielddef.name: CouponDayCount
fielddef.descr: The day count convention used in interest calculations for a bond or an interest bearing security. Absence of this field for a bond or an interest bearing security transaction implies a "flat" trade, i.e. no accrued interest determined at time of the transaction.

fielddef.name: ConvertibleBondEquityID
fielddef.descr: Identifies the equity in which a convertible bond can be converted to.

fielddef.name: ConvertibleBondEquityIDSource
fielddef.descr: Identifies class or source of the ConvertibleBondEquityID(1951) value. 100+ are reserved for private security.

fielddef.name: ContractPriceRefMonth
fielddef.descr: Reference month if there is no applicable MaturityMonthYear(200) value for the contract or security.

fielddef.name: LienSeniority
fielddef.descr: Indicates the seniority level of the lien in a loan.

fielddef.name: LoanFacility
fielddef.descr: Specifies the type of loan when the credit default swap's reference obligation is a loan.

descr.p: Specifies the type of reference entity for first-to-default CDS basket contracts.

fielddef.name: IndexSeries
fielddef.descr: The series identifier of a credit default swap index.

fielddef.name: IndexAnnexVersion
fielddef.descr: The version of a credit default swap index annex.

fielddef.name: IndexAnnexDate
fielddef.descr: The date of a credit default swap index series annex.

fielddef.name: IndexAnnexSource
fielddef.descr: The source of a credit default swap series annex.

fielddef.name: AgreementVersion
fielddef.descr: The version of the master agreement

fielddef.name: MasterConfirmationDesc
fielddef.descr: The type of master confirmation executed between the parties. See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/master-confirmation-type for values.

fielddef.name: MasterConfirmationDate
fielddef.descr: Alternative to broker confirmation. The date of the confirmation executed between the parties and intended to govern all relevant transactions between those parties.

fielddef.name: MasterConfirmationAnnexDesc
fielddef.descr: The type of master confirmation annex executed between the parties. See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/master-confirmation-annex-type for values.

fielddef.name: MasterConfirmationAnnexDate
fielddef.descr: The date that an annex to the master confirmation was executed between the parties.

fielddef.name: BrokerConfirmationDesc
fielddef.descr: Describes the type of broker confirmation executed between the parites. Can be used as an alterative to MasterConfirmationDesc(1962). See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/broker-confirmation-type for values.

fielddef.name: CreditSupportAgreementDesc
fielddef.descr: The type of ISDA Credit Support Agreement. See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/credit-support-agreement-type for values.

fielddef.name: CreditSupportAgreementDate
fielddef.descr: The date of the ISDA Credit Support Agreement executed between the parties and intended to govern collateral arrangements for all OTC derivatives transactions between those parties.

fielddef.name: CreditSupportAgreementID
fielddef.descr: A common reference or unique identifier to identify the ISDA Credit Support Agreement executed between the parties.

fielddef.name: GoverningLaw
fielddef.descr: Identification of the law governing the transaction. See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/governing-law for values.

fielddef.name: NoSideRegulatoryTradeIDs
fielddef.descr: Number of regulatory IDs in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: SideRegulatoryTradeID
fielddef.descr: Trade identifier required by government regulators or other regulatory organziations for regulatory reporting purposes. For example, unique swap identifier (USI) as required by the U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission.

fielddef.name: SideRegulatoryTradeIDSource
fielddef.descr: Identifies the reporting entity that originated the value in SideRegulatoryTradeID(1972). The reporting entity identifier may be assigned by a regulator.

fielddef.name: SideRegulatoryTradeIDEvent
fielddef.descr: Identifies the event which caused origination of the identifier in SideRegulatoryTradeID(1972). When more than one event is the cause, use the higher enumeration value. For example, if the identifier is originated due to an allocated trade which was cleared and reported, use the enumeration value 2 (Clearing).

fielddef.name: SideRegulatoryTradeIDType
fielddef.descr: Specifies the type of trade identifier provided in SideRegulatoryTradeID(1972), within the context of the hierarchy of trade events.

fielddef.name: NoSecondaryAssetClasses
fielddef.descr: Number of secondary asset classes in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: SecondaryAssetClass
fielddef.descr: The broad asset category for assessing risk exposure for a multi-asset trade.

fielddef.name: SecondaryAssetSubClass
fielddef.descr: An indication of the general description of the asset class.

fielddef.name: SecondaryAssetType
fielddef.descr: Used to provide more specific description of the asset specified in SecondaryAssetSubClass(1978). See https://www.fixtrading.org/codelists/AssetType for code list of applicable values. ISO 4721 Currency Code values are to be used when specific currency as an asset type is to be expressed. Other values may be used by mutual agreement of the counterparties.

fielddef.name: BlockTrdAllocIndicator
fielddef.descr: Indication that a block trade will be allocated.

fielddef.name: NoUnderlyingEvents
fielddef.descr: Number of events in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingEventType
fielddef.descr: Code to represent the type of event.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingEventDate
fielddef.descr: Date of event.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingEventTime
fielddef.descr: Specific time of event. To be used in combination with UnderlyingEventDate(1983).

fielddef.name: UnderlyingEventTimeUnit
fielddef.descr: Time unit associated with the event.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingEventTimePeriod
fielddef.descr: Time unit multiplier for the event.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingEventPx
fielddef.descr: Predetermined price of issue at event, if applicable.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingConstituentWeight
fielddef.descr: For a basket, or pool, describes the weight of each of the constituents within the basket. If not provided, it is assumed to be equal weighted.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingCouponType
fielddef.descr: Specifies the coupon type of the underlying bond.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingTotalIssuedAmount
fielddef.descr: Specifies the total amount of the issue. Corresponds to the par value multiplied by the number of issued security.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingCouponFrequencyPeriod
fielddef.descr: Time unit multiplier for the frequency of the bond's coupon payment.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingCouponFrequencyUnit
fielddef.descr: Time unit associated with the frequency of the bond's coupon payment.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingCouponDayCount
fielddef.descr: The day count convention used in interest calculations for a bond or an interest bearing security.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingObligationID
fielddef.descr: For a CDS basket or pool identifies the reference obligation.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingObligationIDSource
fielddef.descr: Identifies the source scheme of the UnderlyingObligationID(1994).

fielddef.name: UnderlyingEquityID
fielddef.descr: Specifies the equity in which a convertible bond can be converted.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingEquityIDSource
fielddef.descr: Identifies the source of the UnderlyingEquityID(1996).

fielddef.name: UnderlyingLienSeniority
fielddef.descr: Indicates the seniority level of the lien in a loan.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingLoanFacility
fielddef.descr: Specifies the type of loan when the credit default swap's reference obligation is a loan.

descr.p: Specifies the type of reference entity for first-to-default CDS basket contracts

fielddef.name: UnderlyingProtectionTermXIDRef
fielddef.descr: Reference to the protection terms applicable to this entity or obligation. Contains the same XID named string value of the instance in the ProtectionTerms repeating group that applies to this Underlying.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingSettlTermXIDRef
fielddef.descr: Reference to the cash or physical settlement terms applicable to this entity or obligation. Contains the same XID named string value of the instance in the appropriate repeating group that applies to this Underlying.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingIndexSeries
fielddef.descr: The series identifier of a credit default swap index.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingIndexAnnexVersion
fielddef.descr: The version identifier of a credit default swap index annex.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingIndexAnnexDate
fielddef.descr: The date of a credit default swap index series annex.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingIndexAnnexSource
fielddef.descr: The source of a credit default swap index series annex.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingProductComplex
fielddef.descr: Identifies an entire suite of products for a given market. In Futures this may be "interest rates", "agricultural", "equity indexes", etc

fielddef.name: UnderlyingSecurityGroup
fielddef.descr: An exchange specific name assigned to a group of related securities which may be concurrently affected by market events and actions.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingSettleOnOpenFlag
fielddef.descr: Indicator to determine if Instrument is Settle on Open.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingAssignmentMethod
fielddef.descr: Method under which assignment was conducted

fielddef.name: UnderlyingSecurityStatus
fielddef.descr: Gives the current state of the instrument

fielddef.name: UnderlyingObligationType
fielddef.descr: Type of reference obligation for credit derivatives contracts.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingAssetClass
fielddef.descr: The broad asset category for assessing risk exposure.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingAssetSubClass
fielddef.descr: An indication of the general description of the asset class.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingAssetType
fielddef.descr: Used to provide more specific description of the asset specified in UnderlyingAssetSubClass(2082). See https://www.fixtrading.org/codelists/AssetType for code list of applicable values. ISO 4721 Currency Code values are to be used when specific currency as an asset type is to be expressed. Other values may be used by mutual agreement of the counterparties.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingSwapClass
fielddef.descr: The type or classification of swap. Additional values may be used by mutual agreement of the counterparties.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingNthToDefault
fielddef.descr: The Nth reference obligation to default in a CDS reference basket. If specified without UnderlyingMthToDefault(2018) the default will trigger a CDS payout. If UnderlyingMthToDefault(2018) is also present then payout occurs between the Nth and Mth obligations to default.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingMthToDefault
fielddef.descr: The Mth reference obligation to default in a CDS reference basket. When UnderlyingNthToDefault(2017) and UnderlyingMthToDefault(2018) are represented then the CDS payout occurs between the Nth and Mth obligations to default.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingSettledEntityMatrixSource
fielddef.descr: Relevant settled entity matrix source.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingSettledEntityMatrixPublicationDate
fielddef.descr: Specifies the publication date of the applicable version of the matrix. If not specified, the Standard Terms Supplement defines rules for which version of the matrix is applicable.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingStrikeMultiplier
fielddef.descr: Used for derivatives. Multiplier applied to the strike price for the purpose of calculating the settlement value.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingStrikeValue
fielddef.descr: Used for derivatives. The number of shares/units for the financial instrument involved in the option trade.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingStrikePriceDeterminationMethod
fielddef.descr: Specifies how the strike price is determined at the point of option exercise. The strike may be fixed throughout the life of the option, set at expiration to the value of the underlying, set to the average value of the underlying , or set to the optimal value of the underlying.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingStrikePriceBoundaryMethod
fielddef.descr: Specifies the boundary condition to be used for the strike price relative to the underlying price at the point of option exercise.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingStrikePriceBoundaryPrecision
fielddef.descr: Used in combination with StrikePriceBoundaryMethod(1479) to specify the percentage of the strike price in relation to the underlying price. The percentage is generally 100 or greater for puts and 100 or less for calls.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingMinPriceIncrement
fielddef.descr: Minimum price increment for the instrument. Could also be used to represent tick value.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingMinPriceIncrementAmount
fielddef.descr: Minimum price increment amount associated with the UnderlyingMinPriceIncrement(2026). For listed derivatives, the value can be calculated by multiplying UnderlyingMinPriceIncrement(2026) by UnderlyingContractMultiplier(436).

fielddef.name: UnderlyingOptPayoutType
fielddef.descr: Indicates the type of valuation method or payout trigger for an in-the-money option.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingOptPayoutAmount
fielddef.descr: Cash amount indicating the pay out associated with an option. For binary options this is a fixed amount.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingPriceQuoteMethod
fielddef.item: Standard, money per unit of a physical
fielddef.descr: Method for price quotation.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingValuationMethod
fielddef.descr: Indicates type of valuation method used.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingListMethod
fielddef.descr: Indicates whether the instruments are pre-listed only or can also be defined via user request.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingCapPrice
fielddef.descr: Used to express the ceiling price of a capped call.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingFloorPrice
fielddef.descr: Used to express the floor price of a capped put.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingFlexibleIndicator
fielddef.descr: Used to indicate if a security has been defined as flexible according to "non-standard" means. Analog to CFICode Standard/Non-standard indicator.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingFlexProductEligibilityIndicator
fielddef.descr: Used to indicate if a product or group of product supports the creation of flexible securities.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingPositionLimit
fielddef.descr: Position limit for the instrument.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingNTPositionLimit
fielddef.descr: Position Limit in the near-term contract for a given exchange-traded product.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingPool
fielddef.descr: Identifies the mortgage backed security (MBS) / asset backed security (ABS) pool.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingContractSettlMonth
fielddef.descr: Specifies when the contract (i.e. MBS/TBA) will settle. Must be present for MBS/TBA.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingDatedDate
fielddef.descr: If different from IssueDate()

fielddef.name: UnderlyingInterestAccrualDate
fielddef.descr: If different from IssueDate and DatedDate

fielddef.name: UnderlyingShortSaleRestriction
fielddef.item: Security Not Shortable At Or Below Best Bid
Security is not shortable without pre-borrow
fielddef.descr: Indicates whether a restriction applies to short selling a security.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingRefTickTableID
fielddef.descr: Spread table code referred by the security or symbol.

fielddef.name: NoUnderlyingComplexEvents
fielddef.descr: Number of complex events in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingComplexEventType
fielddef.descr: Identifies the type of complex event.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingComplexOptPayoutAmount
fielddef.descr: Cash amount indicating the pay out associated with an event. For binary options this is a fixed amount.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingComplexEventPrice
fielddef.descr: Specifies the price at which the complex event takes effect. Impact of the event price is determined by the UnderlyingComplexEventType(2046).

fielddef.name: UnderlyingComplexEventPriceBoundaryMethod
fielddef.item: Less than or equal to UnderlyingComplexEventPrice(2048)
Greater than or equal to UnderlyingComplexEventPrice(2048)
fielddef.descr: Specifies the boundary condition to be used for the event price relative to the UnderlyingComplexEventPrice(2048) at the point the complex event outcome takes effect as determined by the UnderlyingComplexEventPriceTimeType(2051).

fielddef.name: UnderlyingComplexEventPriceBoundaryPrecision
fielddef.descr: Used in combination with UnderlyingComplexEventPriceBoundaryMethod(2049) to specify the percentage of the strike price in relation to the underlying price. The percentage is generally 100 or greater for puts and 100 or less for calls.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingComplexEventPriceTimeType
fielddef.descr: Specifies when the complex event outcome takes effect. The outcome of a complex event is a payout or barrier action as specified by the UnderlyingComplexEventType(2046).

fielddef.name: UnderlyingComplexEventCondition
fielddef.descr: Specifies the condition between complex events when more than one event is specified. Multiple barrier events would use an "or" condition since only one can be effective at a given time. A set of digital range events would use an "and" condition since both conditions must be in effect for a payout to result.

fielddef.name: NoUnderlyingComplexEventDates
fielddef.descr: Number of underlying complex event dates in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingComplexEventStartDate
fielddef.descr: Specifies the start date of the date range on which a complex event is effective. The start date will be set equal to the end date for single day events such as Bermuda options. The start date must always be less than or equal to end date.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingComplexEventEndDate
fielddef.descr: Specifies the end date of the date range on which a complex event is effective. The start date will be set equal to the end date for single day events such as Bermuda options. UnderlyingComplexEventEndDate(2056) must always be greater than or equal to UnderlyingComplexEventStartDate(2055).

fielddef.name: NoUnderlyingComplexEventTimes
fielddef.descr: Number of complex event times in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingComplexEventStartTime
fielddef.descr: Specifies the start time of the time range on which a complex event date is effective. UnderlyingComplexEventStartTime(2057) must always be less than or equal to UndelryingComplexEventEndTime(2058).

fielddef.name: UnderlyingComplexEventEndTime
fielddef.descr: Specifies the end time of the time range on which a complex event date is effective. UnderlyingComplexEventEndTime(2058) must always be greater than or equal to UnderlyingComplexEventStartTime(2057).

fielddef.name: NoLegEvents
fielddef.descr: Number of events in the repeating group

fielddef.name: LegEventType
fielddef.descr: Code to represent the type of event.

fielddef.name: LegEventDate
fielddef.descr: Date of event.

fielddef.name: LegEventTime
fielddef.descr: Specific time of event. To be used in combination with LegEventDate(2061).

fielddef.name: LegEventTimeUnit
fielddef.descr: Time unit associated with the event.

fielddef.name: LegEventTimePeriod
fielddef.descr: Time unit multiplier for the event.

fielddef.name: LegEventPx
fielddef.descr: Predetermined price of issue at event, if applicable.

fielddef.name: LegEventText
fielddef.descr: Free form text to specify additional information or enumeration description when a standard value does not apply.

fielddef.name: LegAssetClass
fielddef.descr: The broad asset category for assessing risk exposure.

fielddef.name: LegAssetSubClass
fielddef.descr: The general subcategory description of the asset class.

fielddef.name: LegAssetType
fielddef.descr: Used to provide more specific description of the asset specified in LegAssetSubClass(2068). See https://www.fixtrading.org/codelists/AssetType for code list of applicable values. ISO 4721 Currency Code values are to be used when specific currency as an asset type is to be expressed. Other values may be used by mutual agreement of the counterparties.

fielddef.name: LegSwapClass
fielddef.descr: Swap type.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingEventText
fielddef.descr: Free form text to specify comments related to the event.

fielddef.name: EncodedUnderlyingEventTextLen
fielddef.descr: Byte length of encoded (non-ASCII characters) EncodedUnderlyingEventText(2073) field.

fielddef.name: EncodedUnderlyingEventText
fielddef.descr: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the UnderlyingEventText(2071) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding (347) field. If used, the ASCII (English) representation should also be specified in the UnderlyingEventText(2071) field.

fielddef.name: EncodedLegEventTextLen
fielddef.descr: Byte length of encoded (non-ASCII characters) EncodedLegEventText(2075) field.

fielddef.name: EncodedLegEventText
fielddef.descr: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the LegEventText(2066) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding (347) field. If used, the ASCII (English) representation should also be specified in the LegEventText(2066) field.

fielddef.name: NoLegSecondaryAssetClasses
fielddef.descr: Number of secondary asset classes in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: LegSecondaryAssetClass
fielddef.descr: The broad asset category for assessing risk exposure for a multi-asset trade.

fielddef.name: LegSecondaryAssetSubClass
fielddef.descr: An indication of the general description of the asset class.

fielddef.name: LegSecondaryAssetType
fielddef.descr: Used to provide more specific description of the asset specified in LegSecondaryAssetSubClass(2078). See https://www.fixtrading.org/codelists/AssetType for code list of applicable values. ISO 4721 Currency Code values are to be used when specific currency as an asset type is to be expressed. Other values may be used by mutual agreement of the counterparties.

fielddef.name: NoUnderlyingSecondaryAssetClasses
fielddef.descr: Number of secondary asset classes in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingSecondaryAssetClass
fielddef.descr: The broad asset category for assessing risk exposure for a multi-asset trade.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingSecondaryAssetSubClass
fielddef.descr: An indication of the general description of the asset class.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingSecondaryAssetType
fielddef.descr: Used to provide more specific description of the asset specified in UnderlyingSecondaryAssetSubClass(2082). See https://www.fixtrading.org/codelists/AssetType for code list of applicable values. ISO 4721 Currency Code values are to be used when specific currency as an asset type is to be expressed. Other values may be used by mutual agreement of the counterparties.

fielddef.name: NoAdditionalTermBondRefs
fielddef.descr: Number of bonds in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: AdditionalTermBondSecurityID
fielddef.descr: Security identifier of the bond.

fielddef.name: AdditionalTermBondSecurityIDSource
fielddef.descr: Identifies the source scheme of the AdditionalTermBondSecurityID(40001) value.

fielddef.name: AdditionalTermBondDesc
fielddef.descr: Description of the bond.

fielddef.name: EncodedAdditionalTermBondDescLen
fielddef.descr: Byte length of encoded (non-ASCII characters) EncodedAdditionalTermBondDesc(40005) field.

fielddef.name: EncodedAdditionalTermBondDesc
fielddef.descr: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the AdditionalTermBondDesc(40003) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding (347) field. If used, the ASCII (English) representation should also be specified in the AdditionalTermBondDesc(40003) field.

fielddef.name: AdditionalTermBondCurrency
fielddef.descr: Specifies the currency the bond value is denominated in. Uses ISO 4217 currency codes.

fielddef.name: AdditionalTermBondIssuer
fielddef.descr: Issuer of the bond.

fielddef.name: EncodedAdditionalTermBondIssuerLen
fielddef.descr: Byte length of encoded (non-ASCII characters) EncodedAdditionalTermBondIssuer(40009) field.

fielddef.name: EncodedAdditionalTermBondIssuer
fielddef.descr: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the AdditionalTermBondIssuer(40007) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding (347) field. If used, the ASCII (English) representation should also be specified in the AdditionalTermBondIssuer(40007) field.

fielddef.name: AdditionalTermBondSeniority
fielddef.descr: Specifies the bond's payment priority in the event of a default.

fielddef.name: AdditionalTermBondCouponType
fielddef.descr: Coupon type of the bond.

fielddef.name: AdditionalTermBondCouponRate
fielddef.descr: Coupon rate of the bond. See also CouponRate(223).

fielddef.name: AdditionalTermBondMaturityDate
fielddef.descr: Maturity date of the bond.

fielddef.name: AdditionalTermBondParValue
fielddef.descr: Par value of the bond.

fielddef.name: AdditionalTermBondCurrentTotalIssuedAmount
fielddef.descr: Total issued amount of the bond.

fielddef.name: AdditionalTermBondCouponFrequencyPeriod
fielddef.descr: Time unit multiplier for the frequency of the bond's coupon payment.

fielddef.name: AdditionalTermBondCouponFrequencyUnit
fielddef.descr: Time unit associated with the frequency of the bond's coupon payment.

fielddef.name: AdditionalTermBondDayCount
fielddef.descr: The day count convention used in interest calculations for a bond or an interest bearing security.

fielddef.name: NoAdditionalTerms
fielddef.descr: Number of additional terms in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: AdditionalTermConditionPrecedentBondIndicator
fielddef.descr: Indicates whether the condition precedent bond is applicable. The swap contract is only valid if the bond is issued and if there is any dispute over the terms of fixed stream then the bond terms would be used.

fielddef.name: AdditionalTermDiscrepancyClauseIndicator
fielddef.descr: Indicates whether the discrepancy clause is applicable.

fielddef.name: NoCashSettlTerms
fielddef.descr: Number of elements in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: CashSettlCurrency
fielddef.descr: Specifies the currency the CashSettlAmount(40034) is denominated in. Uses ISO 4217 currency codes.

fielddef.name: CashSettlValuationFirstBusinessDayOffset
fielddef.descr: The number of business days after settlement conditions have been satisfied, when the calculation agent is to obtain a price quotation on the reference obligation for the purpose of cash settlement.

fielddef.name: CashSettlValuationSubsequentBusinessDaysOffset
fielddef.descr: The number of business days between successive valuation dates when multiple valuation dates are applicable for cash settlement.

fielddef.name: CashSettlNumOfValuationDates
fielddef.descr: Where multiple valuation dates are specified as being applicable for cash settlement, this specifies the number of applicable valuation dates.

fielddef.name: CashSettlValuationTime
fielddef.descr: Time of valuation.

fielddef.name: CashSettlBusinessCenter
fielddef.descr: Identifies the business center calendar used at valuation time for cash settlement purposes e.g. "GBLO". See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/business-center for standard 4-character code values.

fielddef.name: CashSettlQuoteMethod
fielddef.descr: The type of quote used to determine the cash settlement price.

fielddef.name: CashSettlQuoteAmount
fielddef.descr: When determining the cash settlement amount, if weighted average price quotes are to be obtained for the reference obligation, this is the upper limit to the outstanding principal balance of the reference obligation for which the quote should be obtained. If not specifed, the ISDA definitions provide for a fallback amount equal to floating rate payer calculation amount.

fielddef.name: CashSettlQuoteCurrency
fielddef.descr: Specifies the currency the CashSettlQuoteAmount(40028) is denominated in. Uses ISO 4217 Currency Code.

fielddef.name: CashSettlMinimumQuoteAmount
fielddef.descr: When determining the cash settlement amount, if weighted average price quotes are to be obtained for the reference obligation, this is the minimum intended threshold amount of outstanding principal balance of the reference obligation for which the quote should be obtained. If not specified, the ISDA definitions provide for a fallback amount of the lower of either USD1,000,000 (or its equivalent in the relevent obligation currency) or the (minimum) quoted amount.

fielddef.name: CashSettlMinimumQuoteCurrency
fielddef.descr: Specifies the currency the CashSettlMinimumQuoteAmount(40030) is denominated in. Uses ISO 4217 Currency Code.

fielddef.name: CashSettlDealer
fielddef.descr: Identifies the dealer from whom price quotations for the reference obligation are obtained for the purpose of cash settlement valuation calculation.

fielddef.name: CashSettlBusinessDays
fielddef.descr: The number of business days used in the determination of the cash settlement payment date.

fielddef.name: CashSettlAmount
fielddef.descr: The amount paid between the trade parties, seller to the buyer, for cash settlement on the cash settlement date.

fielddef.name: CashSettlRecoveryFactor
fielddef.descr: Used for fixed recovery, this specifies the recovery level as determined at contract inception, to be applied in the event of a default. The factor is used to calculate the amount paid by the seller to the buyer for cash settlement on the cash settlement date. The amount calculated is (1 - CashSettlRecoveryFactor(40035)) x floating rate payer calculation amount. The currency is derived from the floating rate payer calculation amount.

fielddef.name: CashSettlFixedTermIndicator
fielddef.descr: Indicates whether fixed settlement is applicable or not applicable in a recovery lock.

fielddef.name: CashSettlAccruedInterestIndicator
fielddef.descr: Indicates whether accrued interest is included or not in the value provided in CashSettlAmount(40034). For cash settlement this specifies whether quotations should be obtained inclusive or not of accrued interest. For physical settlement this specifies whether the buyer should deliver the obligation with an outstanding principal balance that includes or excludes accrued interest.

fielddef.name: CashSettlValuationMethod
fielddef.descr: The ISDA defined methodology for determining the final price of the reference obligation for purposes of cash settlement.

fielddef.name: CashSettlTermXID
fielddef.descr: A named string value referenced by UnderlyingSettlTermXIDRef(41315).

fielddef.name: NoContractualDefinitions
fielddef.descr: Number of financing definitions in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: ContractualDefinition
fielddef.descr: Specifies which contract definition, such as those published by ISDA, will apply for the terms of the trade. See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/contractual-definitions for values.

fielddef.name: NoContractualMatrices
fielddef.descr: Number of contractual matrices in the repeating group.

descr.p: Identifies the applicable contract matrix. See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/matrix-type-1-0.xml for values

fielddef.name: ContractualMatrixDate
fielddef.descr: Specifies the publication date of the applicable version of the contract matrix. If not specified, the ISDA Standard Terms Supplement defines rules for which version of the matrix is applicable.

fielddef.name: ContractualMatrixTerm
fielddef.descr: Specifies the applicable key into the relevent contract matrix. In the case of 2000 ISDA Definitions Settlement Matrix for Early Termination and Swaptions, the ContractualMatrixTerm(40045) is not applicable and is to be omitted. See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/credit-matrix-transaction-type for values.

fielddef.name: NoFinancingTermSupplements
fielddef.descr: Number of financing terms supplements in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: FinancingTermSupplementDesc
fielddef.descr: Identifies the applicable contractual supplement. See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/contractual-supplement for values.

fielddef.name: FinancingTermSupplementDate
fielddef.descr: Specifies the publication date of the applicable version of the contractual supplement.

fielddef.name: NoStreams
fielddef.descr: Number of swap streams in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: StreamType
fielddef.descr: Type of swap stream.

fielddef.name: StreamDesc
fielddef.descr: A short descriptive name given to the payment stream. Eg. CDS, Fixed, Float, Float2, GBP. The description has no intrinsic meaning but should be arbitrarily chosen by the remitter as reference.

fielddef.name: StreamPaySide
fielddef.descr: The side of the party paying the stream.

fielddef.name: StreamReceiveSide
fielddef.descr: The side of the party receiving the stream.

fielddef.name: StreamNotional
fielddef.descr: Notional, or initial notional value for the payment stream. Use the PaymentScheduleGrp component to specify the rate steps.

fielddef.name: StreamCurrency
fielddef.descr: Specifies the currency the StreamNotional(40054) is denominated in. Uses ISO 4217 currency codes.

fielddef.name: StreamText
fielddef.descr: Free form text to specify additional information or enumeration description when a standard value does not apply.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingStreamEffectiveDateUnadjusted
fielddef.descr: The unadjusted effective date for the underlying stream.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingStreamEffectiveDateBusinessDayConvention
fielddef.descr: The underlying instrument's stream's effective, or relative effective, date adjustment business day convention. Used only to override the business day convention specified in the UnderlyingDateAdjustment component within the UnderlyingInstrument component.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingStreamEffectiveDateBusinessCenter
fielddef.descr: The business center calendar used for date adjustement of the underlying instrument's stream's effective, or relative effective, date, e.g. "GBLO". See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/business-center for standard 4-character code values.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingStreamEffectiveDateRelativeTo
fielddef.descr: Specifies the anchor date when the effective date is relative to an anchor date.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingStreamEffectiveDateOffsetPeriod
fielddef.descr: Time unit multiplier for the relative effective date offset period.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingStreamEffectiveDateOffsetUnit
fielddef.descr: Time unit associated with the relative effective date offset.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingStreamEffectiveDateOffsetDayType
fielddef.descr: Specifies the day type of the relative effective date offset.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingStreamEffectiveDateAdjusted
fielddef.descr: The adjusted effective date.

fielddef.name: StreamTerminationDateUnadjusted
fielddef.descr: The unadjusted termination date.

fielddef.name: StreamTerminationDateBusinessDayConvention
fielddef.descr: The stream's termination, or relative termination, date adjustment business day convention. Used only to override the business day convention specified in the DateAdjustment component within the Instrument component.

fielddef.name: StreamTerminationDateBusinessCenter
fielddef.descr: The business center calendar used for date adjustmenet of the stream's termination, or relative termination, date e.g. "GBLO". See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/business-center for standard 4-character code values.

fielddef.name: StreamTerminationDateRelativeTo
fielddef.descr: Specifies the anchor date when the termination date is relative to an anchor date.

fielddef.name: StreamTerminationDateOffsetPeriod
fielddef.descr: Time unit multiplier for the relative termination date offset.

fielddef.name: StreamTerminationDateOffsetUnit
fielddef.descr: Time unit associated with the relative termination date offset.

fielddef.name: StreamTerminationDateOffsetDayType
fielddef.descr: Specifies the day type of the relative termination date offset.

fielddef.name: StreamTerminationDateAdjusted
fielddef.descr: The adjusted termination date.

fielddef.name: StreamCalculationPeriodBusinessDayConvention
fielddef.descr: Calculation Period Adjustment Business Day Convention. Used only to override the business day convention specified in the DateAdjustment component within the Instrument component.

fielddef.name: StreamCalculationPeriodBusinessCenter
fielddef.descr: The business center calendar used for date adjustement of the stream's calculation period dates, e.g. "GBLO". See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/business-center for standard 4-character code values.

fielddef.name: StreamFirstPeriodStartDateUnadjusted
fielddef.descr: The unadjusted first calculation period start date if before the effective date.

fielddef.name: StreamFirstPeriodStartDateBusinessDayConvention
fielddef.descr: The first calculation period start date business day convention. Used only to override the business day convention specified in the DateAdjustment component within the Instrument component.

fielddef.name: StreamFirstPeriodStartDateBusinessCenter
fielddef.descr: The business center calendar used for date adjustement of the stream's first calculation period start date, e.g. "GBLO". See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/business-center for standard 4-character code values.

fielddef.name: StreamFirstPeriodStartDateAdjusted
fielddef.descr: The adjusted first calculation period start date, if it is before the effective date.

fielddef.name: StreamFirstRegularPeriodStartDateUnadjusted
fielddef.descr: The unadjusted first start date of the regular calculation period, if there is an initial stub period.

fielddef.name: StreamFirstCompoundingPeriodEndDateUnadjusted
fielddef.descr: The end of the initial compounding period.

fielddef.name: StreamLastRegularPeriodEndDateUnadjusted
fielddef.descr: Unadjusted last regular period end date if there is a final stub period.

fielddef.name: StreamCalculationFrequencyPeriod
fielddef.descr: Time unit multiplier for the frequency at which calculation period end dates occur.

fielddef.name: StreamCalculationFrequencyUnit
fielddef.descr: The unit of frequency at which calculation period end dates occur.

fielddef.name: StreamCalculationRollConvention
fielddef.descr: The convention for determining the sequence of end dates. It is used in conjunction with a specified frequency. Used only to override the roll convention specified in the DateAdjustment component within the Instrument component.

fielddef.name: NoSettlRateFallbacks
fielddef.descr: Number of settlement rate fallbacks in the repeating group

fielddef.name: SettlRatePostponementMaximumDays
fielddef.descr: The maximum number of days to wait for a quote from the disrupted settlement rate option before proceding to this method.

fielddef.name: LegPaymentStreamNonDeliverableSettlRateSource
fielddef.descr: Identifies the source of the rate information.

fielddef.name: SettlRatePostponementSurvey
fielddef.descr: Indicates whether to request a settlement rate quote from the market.

fielddef.name: SettlRatePostponementCalculationAgent
fielddef.descr: Used to identify the settlement rate postponement calculation agent.

fielddef.name: NoProvisions
fielddef.descr: Number of provisions in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: ProvisionType
fielddef.descr: Type of provisions.

fielddef.name: ProvisionDateUnadjusted
fielddef.descr: The unadjusted date of the provision.

fielddef.name: ProvisionDateBusinessDayConvention
fielddef.descr: The instrument provision's date adjustment business day convention. Used only to override the business day convention specified in the DateAdjustment component within the Instrument component.

fielddef.name: ProvisionDateBusinessCenter
fielddef.descr: The business center calendar used for date adjustment association with the provisions, e.g. "GBLO". See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/business-center for standard 4-character code values.

fielddef.name: ProvisionDateAdjusted
fielddef.descr: The adjusted date of the provision.

fielddef.name: ProvisionDateTenorPeriod
fielddef.descr: The unit multiplier for the provision's tenor period.

fielddef.name: ProvisionDateTenorUnit
fielddef.descr: The time unit associated with the provision's tenor period.

fielddef.name: ProvisionCalculationAgent
fielddef.descr: Used to identify the calculation agent. The calculation agent may be identified in ProvisionCalculationAgent(40098) or in the ProvisionParties component.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionSinglePartyBuyerSide
fielddef.descr: If optional early termination is not available to both parties then this component identifies the buyer of the option through its side of the trade.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionSinglePartySellerSide
fielddef.descr: If optional early termination is not available to both parties then this component identifies the seller of the option through its side of the trade.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseStyle
fielddef.descr: The instrument provision option's exercise style.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseMultipleNotional
fielddef.descr: A notional amount which restricts the amount of notional that can be exercised when partial exercise or multiple exercise is applicable. The integral multiple amount defines a lower limit of notional that can be exercised and also defines a unit multiple of notional that can be exercised, i.e. only integer multiples of this amount can be exercised.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseMinimumNotional
fielddef.descr: The minimum notional amount that can be exercised on a given exercise date.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseMaximumNotional
fielddef.descr: The maximum notional amount that can be exercised on a given exercise date.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionMinimumNumber
fielddef.descr: The minimum number of options that can be exercised on a given exercise date.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionMaximumNumber
fielddef.descr: The maximum number of options that can be exercised on a given exercise date. If the number is not specified, it means that the maximum number of options corresponds to the remaining unexercised options.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseConfirmation
fielddef.descr: Used to indicate whether follow-up confirmation of exercise (written or electronic) is required following telephonic notice by the buyer to the seller or seller's agent.

descr.p: An ISDA defined cash settlement method used for the determination of the applicable cash settlement amount. The method is defined in the 2006 ISDA Definitions, Section 18.3. Cash Settlement Methods, paragraph (e).

fielddef.name: ProvisionCashSettlCurrency
fielddef.descr: Specifies the currency of settlement. Uses ISO 4217 currency codes.

fielddef.name: ProvisionCashSettlCurrency2
fielddef.descr: Specifies the currency of settlement for a cross-currency provision. Uses ISO 4217 currency codes.

fielddef.name: ProvisionCashSettlQuoteType
fielddef.descr: Identifies the type of quote to be used.

fielddef.name: ProvisionCashSettlQuoteSource
fielddef.descr: Identifies the source of quote information.

fielddef.name: ProvisionText
fielddef.descr: Free form text to specify additional information or enumeration description when a standard value does not apply.

fielddef.name: ProvisionCashSettlValueTime
fielddef.descr: A time specified in 24-hour format, e.g. 11am would be represented as 11:00:00. The time of the cash settlement valuation date when the cash settlement amount will be determined according to the cash settlement method if the parties have not otherwise been able to agree to the cash settlement amount.

fielddef.name: ProvisionCashSettlValueTimeBusinessCenter
fielddef.descr: Identifies the business center calendar used with the provision's cash settlement valuation time. See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/business-center for standard 4-character code values.

fielddef.name: ProvisionCashSettlValueDateBusinessDayConvention
fielddef.descr: The cash settlement valuation date adjustment business day convention. Used only to override the business day convention specified in the DateAdjustment component within the Instrument component.

fielddef.name: ProvisionCashSettlValueDateBusinessCenter
fielddef.descr: The business center calendar used for date adjustment of the cash settlement valuation date, e.g. "GBLO". See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/business-center for standard 4-character code values.

fielddef.name: ProvisionCashSettlValueDateRelativeTo
fielddef.descr: Specifies the anchor date when the cash settlement value date is relative to an anchor date.

fielddef.name: ProvisionCashSettlValueDateOffsetPeriod
fielddef.descr: Time unit multiplier for the relative cash settlement value date offset.

fielddef.name: ProvisionCashSettlValueDateOffsetUnit
fielddef.descr: Time unit associated with the relative cash settlement value date offset.

fielddef.name: ProvisionCashSettlValueDateOffsetDayType
fielddef.descr: Specifies the day type of the provision's relative cash settlement value date offset.

fielddef.name: ProvisionCashSettlValueDateAdjusted
fielddef.descr: The adjusted cash settlement value date.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseBusinessDayConvention
fielddef.descr: The instrument provision's option exercise date adjustment business day convention. Used only to override the business day convention specified in the DateAdjustment component within the Instrument component.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseBusinessCenter
fielddef.descr: The business center calendar used for date adjustement of the instrument provision's option exercise date, e.g. "GBLO". See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/business-center for standard 4-character code values.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseEarliestDatePeriod
fielddef.descr: Period of the interval to the first (and possibly only) exercise date in the exercise period.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseEarliestDateUnit
fielddef.descr: Unit of the interval to the first (and possibly only) exercise date in the exercise period.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseFrequencyPeriod
fielddef.descr: The frequency period of subsequent exercise dates in the exercise period following the earliest exercise date. An interval of 1 day should be used to indicate an American style exercise period.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseFrequencyUnit
fielddef.descr: The frequency unit of subsequent exercise dates in the exercise period following the earliest exercise date.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseStartDateUnadjusted
fielddef.descr: The unadjusted first day of the exercise period for an American style option.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseStartDateRelativeTo
fielddef.descr: Specifies the anchor date when the option exercise date is relative to an anchor date.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseStartDateOffsetPeriod
fielddef.descr: Time unit multiplier for the relative option exercise start date offset.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseStartDateOffsetUnit
fielddef.descr: Time unit associated with the relative option exercise start date offset.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseStartDateOffsetDayType
fielddef.descr: Specifies the day type of the provision's relative option exercise start date offset.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseStartDateAdjusted
fielddef.descr: The adjusted first day of the exercise period for an American style option.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExercisePeriodSkip
fielddef.descr: The number of periods in the referenced date schedule that are between each date in the relative date schedule. Thus a skip of 2 would mean that dates are relative to every second date in the referenced schedule. If present this should have a value greater than 1.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseBoundsFirstDateUnadjusted
fielddef.descr: The first date of a schedule. This can be used to restrict the range of exercise dates when they are relative.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseBoundsLastDateUnadjusted
fielddef.descr: The last date of a schedule. This can be used to restrict the range of exercise dates when they are relative.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseEarliestTime
fielddef.descr: The earliest time at which notice of exercise can be given by the buyer to the seller (or seller's agent) i) on the expriation date, in the case of a European style option, (ii) on each bermuda option exercise date and the expiration date, in the case of a Bermuda style option the commencement date to, and including, the expiration date, in the case of an American option.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseEarliestTimeBusinessCenter
fielddef.descr: Identifies the business center calendar used with the provision's earliest time for notice of exercise. See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/business-center for standard 4-character code values.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseLatestTime
fielddef.descr: For a Bermuda or American style option, the latest time on an exercise business day (excluding the expiration date) within the exercise period that notice can be given by the buyer to the seller or seller's agent. Notice of exercise given after this time will be deemed to have been given on the next exercise business day.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseLatestTimeBusinessCenter
fielddef.descr: Identifies the business center calendar used with the provision's latest time for notice of exercise. See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/business-center for standard 4-character code values.

fielddef.name: NoProvisionOptionExerciseFixedDates
fielddef.descr: Number of provision option exercise fixed dates in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseFixedDate
fielddef.descr: A predetermined option exercise date, unadjusted or adjusted depending on ProvisionOptionExerciseFixedDateType(40144).

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseFixedDateType
fielddef.descr: Specifies the type of date (e.g. adjusted for holidays).

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExpirationDateUnadjusted
fielddef.descr: The unadusted last day within an exercise period for an American style option. For a European style option it is the only day within the exercise period.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExpirationDateBusinessDayConvention
fielddef.descr: The instrument's provision's option expiration date adjustment business day convention. Used only to override the business day convention specified in the DateAdjustment component within the Instrument component.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExpirationDateBusinessCenter
fielddef.descr: The business center calendar used for date adjustment of the instrument's provision's option expiration date, e.g. "GBLO". See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/business-center for standard 4-character code values.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExpirationDateRelativeTo
fielddef.descr: Specifies the anchor date when an option expiration date is relative to an anchor date.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExpirationDateOffsetPeriod
fielddef.descr: Time unit multiplier for the relative option expiration date offset.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExpirationDateOffsetUnit
fielddef.descr: Time unit associated with the relative option expiration date offset.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExpirationDateOffsetDayType
fielddef.descr: Specifies the day type of the provision's relative option expiration date offset.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExpirationDateAdjusted
fielddef.descr: The adjusted last day within an exercise period for an American style option. For a European style option it is the only day within the exercise period.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExpirationTime
fielddef.descr: The latest time for exercise on the expiration date.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionExpirationTimeBusinessCenter
fielddef.descr: Identifies the business center calendar used with the provision's latest exercise time on expiration date. See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/business-center for standard 4-character code values.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionRelevantUnderlyingDateUnadjusted
fielddef.descr: The unadjusted date on the underlying set by the exercise of an option. What this date is depends on the option (e.g. in a swaption it is the swap effective date, in an extendible/cancelable provision it is the swap termination date).

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionRelevantUnderlyingDateBusinessDayConvention
fielddef.descr: The instrument's provision's option underlying date adjustment business day convention. Used only to override the business day convention specified in the DateAdjustment component within the Instrument component.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionRelevantUnderlyingDateBusinessCenter
fielddef.descr: The business center calendar used for datea adjustement of the instrument's provision's option underlying date, e.g. "GBLO". See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/business-center for standard 4-character code values.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionRelevantUnderlyingDateRelativeTo
fielddef.descr: Specifies the anchor date when the date relevant to the underlying trade on exercise is relative to an anchor date.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionRelevantUnderlyingDateOffsetPeriod
fielddef.descr: Time unit multiplier for the relative option relevant underlying date offset.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionRelevantUnderlyingDateOffsetUnit
fielddef.descr: Time unit associated with the relative option relevant underlying date offset.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionRelevantUnderlyingDateOffsetDayType
fielddef.descr: Specifies the day type of the provision's relative option relevant underlying date offset.

fielddef.name: ProvisionOptionRelevantUnderlyingDateAdjusted
fielddef.descr: The adjusted date on the underlying set by the exercise of an option. What this date is depends on the option (e.g. in a swaption it is the swap effective date, in an extendible/cancelable provision it is the swap termination date).

fielddef.name: ProvisionCashSettlPaymentDateBusinessDayConvention
fielddef.descr: Termination, or relative termination, date adjustment business day convention.

fielddef.name: ProvisionCashSettlPaymentDateBusinessCenter
fielddef.descr: The business center calendar used for date adjustement of the provision's cash settlement payment date, e.g. "GBLO". See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/business-center for standard 4-character code values.

fielddef.name: ProvisionCashSettlPaymentDateRelativeTo
fielddef.descr: Specifies the anchor date when the cash settlement payment date is relative to an anchor date.

fielddef.name: ProvisionCashSettlPaymentDateOffsetPeriod
fielddef.descr: Time unit multiplier for the relative cash settlement payment date offset.

fielddef.name: ProvisionCashSettlPaymentDateOffsetUnit
fielddef.descr: Time unit associated with the relative cash settlement payment date offset.

fielddef.name: ProvisionCashSettlPaymentDateOffsetDayType
fielddef.descr: Specifies the day type of the provision's relative cash settlement payment date offset.

fielddef.name: ProvisionCashSettlPaymentDateRangeFirst
fielddef.descr: First date in range when a settlement date range is provided.

fielddef.name: ProvisionCashSettlPaymentDateRangeLast
fielddef.descr: Last date in range when a settlement date range is provided.

fielddef.name: NoProvisionCashSettlPaymentDates
fielddef.descr: Number of provision cash settlement payment dates in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: ProvisionCashSettlPaymentDate
fielddef.descr: Cash settlement payment date, unadjusted or adjusted depending on ProvisionCashSettlPaymentDateType(40173).

fielddef.name: ProvisionCashSettlPaymentDateType
fielddef.descr: Specifies the type of date (e.g. adjusted for holidays).

fielddef.name: NoProvisionPartyIDs
fielddef.descr: Number of parties identified in the contract provision.

fielddef.name: ProvisionPartyID
fielddef.descr: The party identifier/code for the payment settlement party.

fielddef.name: ProvisionPartyIDSource
fielddef.descr: Identifies class or source of the ProvisionPartyID(40175) value.

fielddef.name: ProvisionPartyRole
fielddef.descr: Identifies the type or role of ProvisionPartyID(40175) specified.

fielddef.name: NoProvisionPartySubIDs
fielddef.descr: Number of sub-party IDs to be reported for the party.

fielddef.name: ProvisionPartySubID
fielddef.descr: Party sub-identifier, if applicable, for ProvisionPartyID(40175).

fielddef.name: ProvisionPartySubIDType
fielddef.descr: The type of ProvisionPartySubID(40179).

fielddef.name: NoProtectionTerms
fielddef.descr: Number of protection terms in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: ProtectionTermNotional
fielddef.descr: The notional amount of protection coverage.

fielddef.name: ProtectionTermCurrency
fielddef.descr: The currency of ProtectionTermNotional(40182). Uses ISO 4217 currency codes.

fielddef.name: ProtectionTermSellerNotifies
fielddef.descr: The notifying party is the party that notifies the other party when a credit event has occurred by means of a credit event notice. If more than one party is referenced as being the notifying party then either party may notify the other of a credit event occurring. ProtectionTermSellerNotifies(40184)=Y indicates that the seller notifies.

fielddef.name: ProtectionTermBuyerNotifies
fielddef.descr: The notifying party is the party that notifies the other party when a credit event has occurred by means of a credit event notice. If more than one party is referenced as being the notifying party then either party may notify the other of a credit event occurring. ProtectionTermBuyerNotifies(40185)=Y indicates that the buyer notifies.

fielddef.name: ProtectionTermEventBusinessCenter
fielddef.descr: When used, the business center indicates the local time of the business center that replaces the Greenwich Mean Time in Section 3.3 of the 2003 ISDA Credit Derivatives Definitions. See http://www.fpml.org/coding-scheme/business-center for standard 4-character code values.

fielddef.name: ProtectionTermStandardSources
fielddef.descr: Indicates whether ISDA defined Standard Public Sources are applicable (ProtectionTermStandardSources(40187)=Y) or not.

fielddef.name: ProtectionTermEventMinimumSources
fielddef.descr: The minimum number of the specified public information sources that must publish information that reasonably confirms that a credit event has occurred. The market convention is two.

fielddef.name: ProtectionTermEventNewsSource
fielddef.descr: Newspaper or electronic news service or source that may publish relevant information used in the determination of whether or not a credit event has occurred.

fielddef.name: ProtectionTermXID
fielddef.descr: A named string value referenced by UnderlyingProtectionTermXIDRef(41314).

fielddef.name: NoProtectionTermEvents
fielddef.descr: Number of protection term events in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: ProtectionTermEventType
fielddef.descr: Specifies the type of credit event applicable to the protection terms. See http://www.fixtradingcommunity.org/codelists#Protection_Term_Event_Types for code list of applicable event types.

fielddef.name: ProtectionTermEventValue
fielddef.descr: Protection term event value appropriate to ProtectionTermEvenType(40192). See http://www.fixtradingcommunity.org/codelists#Protection_Term_Event_Types for applicable event type values.

fielddef.name: ProtectionTermEventCurrency
fielddef.descr: Applicable currency if ProtectionTermEventValue(40193) is an amount. Uses ISO 4217 currency codes.

fielddef.name: ProtectionTermEventPeriod
fielddef.descr: Time unit multiplier for protection term events.

fielddef.name: ProtectionTermEventUnit
fielddef.descr: Time unit associated with protection term events.

fielddef.name: ProtectionTermEventDayType
fielddef.descr: Day type for events that specify a period and unit.

fielddef.name: ProtectionTermEventRateSource
fielddef.descr: Rate source for events that specify a rate source, e.g. Floating rate interest shortfall.

fielddef.name: NoProtectionTermEventQualifiers
fielddef.descr: Number of qualifiers in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: ProtectionTermEventQualifier
fielddef.descr: Protection term event qualifier. Used to further qualify ProtectionTermEventType(40192).

fielddef.name: NoProtectionTermObligations
fielddef.descr: Number of obligations in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: ProtectionTermObligationType
fielddef.descr: Specifies the type of obligation applicable to the protection terms. See http://www.fixtradingcommunity.org/codelists#Protection_Term_Obligation_Types for code list of applicable obligation types.

fielddef.name: ProtectionTermObligationValue
fielddef.descr: Protection term obligation value appropriate to ProtectionTermObligationType(40202). See http://www.fixtradingcommunity.org/codelists#Protection_Term_Obligation_Types for applicable obligation type values.

fielddef.name: NoPhysicalSettlTerms
fielddef.descr: Number of entries in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: PhysicalSettlCurrency
fielddef.descr: Specifies the currency of physical settlement. Uses ISO 4217 currency codes.

fielddef.name: PhysicalSettlBusinessDays
