fielddef.name: PostTradePaymentAccount
fielddef.descr: The cash account on the books of the receiver of the request or the sender of the report to be debited or credited.

fielddef.name: PostTradePaymentAmount
fielddef.descr: The payment amount for the specified PostTradePaymentType(2824).

fielddef.name: PostTradePaymentCurrency
fielddef.descr: Specifies the currency in which PostTradePaymentAmount(2817) is denominated. Uses ISO 4271 currency codes.

fielddef.name: PostTradePaymentDebitOrCredit
fielddef.descr: Payment side of this individual payment from the requesting firm's perspective.

fielddef.name: PostTradePaymentDesc
fielddef.descr: A short descriptive name given to the payment, e.g. Premium, Upfront, etc. The description may be used as reference.

fielddef.name: PostTradePaymentID
fielddef.descr: The identifier for the individual payment.

fielddef.name: PostTradePaymentLinkID
fielddef.descr: Used to link a group of payments together, e.g. cross-currency payments associated with a swap.

fielddef.name: PostTradePaymentStatus
fielddef.descr: Used to indicate the status of a post-trade payment.

fielddef.name: PostTradePaymentType
fielddef.descr: Type of post-trade payment. See ISITC "Payments Cash Purpose Codes" for list of payment type codes to use available at https://isitc.org/market-practices/reference-data-and-standards-market-practice and select "ISITC Classification Code List".

fielddef.name: PostTradePaymentCalculationDate
fielddef.descr: The (actual) date the periodic payments calculations are made.

fielddef.name: PostTradePaymentValueDate
fielddef.descr: The adjusted (for holidays and other non-business days) payment date on which the payment is expected to settle.

fielddef.name: PostTradePaymentFinalValueDate
fielddef.descr: The actual or final payment date on which the payment was made.

fielddef.name: CurrentDisplayPrice
fielddef.descr: Price at which the order is currently displayed to the market. Can be used on order messages, e.g. NewOrderSingle(35=D), to provide the current displayed price of a parent order when splitting it into smaller child orders.

fielddef.name: DuplicateClOrdIDIndicator
fielddef.descr: Used to indicate that a ClOrdID(11) value is an intentional duplicate of a previously sent value. Allows to avoid the rejection of an order with OrdRejReason(103) = 6 (Duplicate Order).

fielddef.name: EventInitiatorType
fielddef.descr: Indicates the type of entity who initiated an event, e.g. modification or cancellation of an order or quote.

fielddef.name: NBBOEntryType
fielddef.descr: Type of NBBO information.

fielddef.name: NBBOPrice
fielddef.descr: Price related to NBBO. NBBOEntryType(2831) may be used to indicate entry type, e.g. bid or offer.

fielddef.name: NBBOQty
fielddef.descr: Quantity related to NBBO. NBBOEntryType(2831) may be used to indicte entry type, e.g. bid or offer.

fielddef.name: NBBOSource
fielddef.descr: Source of NBBO information.

fielddef.name: OrderOriginationFirmID
fielddef.descr: Identifier for the original owner of an order as part of the RelatedOrderGrp component. Use the Parties component with PartyRole(452) = 13 (Order Origination Firm) to identify the original owner of an individual order.

fielddef.name: RelatedOrderTime
fielddef.descr: Timestamp for the assignment of a (unique) identifier to an order.

fielddef.name: SingleQuoteIndicator
fielddef.descr: Used to indicate whether the quoting system allows only one quote to be active at a time for the quote issuer or market maker.

fielddef.name: CurrentWorkingPrice
fielddef.descr: Current working price of the order relative to the state of the order.

fielddef.name: TrdRegTimestampManualIndicator
fielddef.descr: Indicates whether a given timestamp was manually captured.

fielddef.name: CollateralReinvestmentRate
fielddef.descr: Interest rate received for collateral reinvestment.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingRefID
fielddef.descr: Identifies the underlying instrument the entity applies to by referencing the underlying instrument's UnderlyingID(2874).

fielddef.name: CollateralReinvestmentAmount
fielddef.descr: The cash amount of the specified re-investment type.

fielddef.name: CollateralReinvestmentCurrency
fielddef.descr: The currency denomination of the re-invested cash amount. Uses ISO 4217 currency codes.

fielddef.name: CollateralReinvestmentType
fielddef.descr: Indicates the type of investment the cash collateral is re-invested in.

fielddef.name: NoCollateralReinvestments
fielddef.descr: Number of instances of CollateralReinvestmentType(2844) in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: FundingSource
fielddef.descr: Specifies the funding source used to finance margin or collateralized loan.

fielddef.name: FundingSourceCurrency
fielddef.descr: Currency denomination of the market value of the funding source. Uses ISO 4217 currency codes.

fielddef.name: FundingSourceMarketValue
fielddef.descr: Market value of the funding source.

fielddef.name: NoFundingSources
fielddef.descr: Number of instances of FundingSource(2846) in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: LegPaymentStreamOtherDayCount
fielddef.descr: The industry name of the day count convention not listed in LegPaymentStreamDayCount(40283).

fielddef.name: MarginDirection
fielddef.descr: Indicates whether the margin described is posted or received.

fielddef.name: PaymentFixedRate
fielddef.descr: The rate applicable to the fixed rate payment.

fielddef.name: PaymentFloatingRateIndex
fielddef.descr: The payment floating rate index. See SpreadOrBenchmarkCurveData(221) for suggested values.

fielddef.name: PaymentFloatingRateIndexCurvePeriod
fielddef.descr: Time unit multiplier for the floating rate index.

fielddef.name: PaymentFloatingRateIndexCurveUnit
fielddef.descr: Time unit associated with the floating rate index.

fielddef.name: PaymentFloatingRateSpread
fielddef.descr: Spread from floating rate index.

fielddef.name: PaymentFrequencyPeriod
fielddef.descr: Time unit multiplier for the payment frequency.

fielddef.name: PaymentFrequencyUnit
fielddef.descr: Time unit associated with the payment frequency.

fielddef.name: PaymentRateResetFrequencyPeriod
fielddef.descr: Time unit multiplier for the floating rate reset frequency.

fielddef.name: PaymentRateResetFrequencyUnit
fielddef.descr: Time unit associated with the floating rate reset frequency.

fielddef.name: PaymentStreamOtherDayCount
fielddef.descr: The industry name of the day count convention not listed in PaymentStreamDayCount(40742).

fielddef.name: SideCollateralReinvestmentRate
fielddef.descr: Interest rate received for collateral reinvestment.

fielddef.name: SideUnderlyingRefID
fielddef.descr: Identifies the underlying instrument the entity applies to by referencing the underlying instrument's UnderlyingID(2874).

fielddef.name: NoSideCollateralReinvestments
fielddef.descr: Number of instances of SideCollateralReinvestmentType(2867) in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: SideCollateralReinvestmentAmount
fielddef.descr: The cash amount of the specified re-investment type.

fielddef.name: SideCollateralReinvestmentCurrency
fielddef.descr: The currency denomination of the re-invested cash amount. Uses ISO 4217 currency codes.

fielddef.name: SideCollateralReinvestmentType
fielddef.descr: Indicates the type of investment the cash collateral is re-invested in.

fielddef.name: CollateralizationValueDate
fielddef.descr: Date when the collateral is to be assessed or assigned.

fielddef.name: RegulatoryReportTypeBusinessDate
fielddef.descr: The business date on which the event identified in RegulatoryReportType(1934) took place.

fielddef.name: ClearingPortfolioID
fielddef.descr: When the transaction is cleared and included in a portfolio of transactions this identifies the portfolio by its unique identifier.

fielddef.name: NoTransactionAttributes
fielddef.descr: Number of instances of TransactionAttributeType(2872) in the repeating group.

fielddef.name: TransactionAttributeType
fielddef.descr: Type of attribute(s) or characteristic(s) associated with the transaction.

fielddef.name: TransactionAttributeValue
fielddef.descr: Value associated with the specificed TransactionAttributeType(2872).

fielddef.name: UnderlyingID
fielddef.descr: Unique identifier for the underlying instrument within the context of a message.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingPaymentStreamOtherDayCount
fielddef.descr: The industry name of the day count convention not listed in UnderlyingPaymentStreamDayCount(40572).

fielddef.name: PosAmtPrice
fielddef.descr: The price used to calculate the PosAmt(708).

fielddef.name: PosAmtPriceType
fielddef.descr: Specifies the type of price for PosAmtPrice(2876).

fielddef.name: TerminationDate
fielddef.descr: The date of a contract's early termination or other post-trade event when the event is prior to the contract natural end or maturity not defined as part of the security's reference data or contractual terms/agreement.

fielddef.name: CouponOtherDayCount
fielddef.descr: The industry name of the day count convention not listed in CouponDayCount(1950).

fielddef.name: LegCouponOtherDayCount
fielddef.descr: The industry name of the day count convention not listed in LegCouponDayCount(2165).

fielddef.name: UnderlyingCouponOtherDayCount
fielddef.descr: The industry name of the day count convention not listed in UnderlyingCouponDayCount(1993).

fielddef.name: ContraOrderOrigination
fielddef.descr: Identifies the origin of the order from the counterparty of the execution or trade.

fielddef.name: RoutingArrangmentIndicator
fielddef.descr: Indicates whether a routing arrangement is in place, e.g. between two brokers. May be used together with OrderOrigination(1724) to further describe the origin of an order.

fielddef.name: ContraRoutingArrangmentIndicator
fielddef.descr: Indicates whether a routing arrangement is in place, e.g. between two brokers. May be used together with ContraOrderOrigination(2882) to further describe the origin of an order.

fielddef.name: PaymentStreamFormulaLength
fielddef.descr: Byte length of encoded (non-ASCII characters) PaymentStreamFormula(42648) field.

fielddef.name: LegPaymentStreamFormulaLength
fielddef.descr: Byte length of encoded (non-ASCII characters) LegPaymentStreamFormula(42486) field.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingPaymentStreamFormulaLength
fielddef.descr: Byte length of encoded (non-ASCII characters) UnderlyingPaymentStreamFormula(42982) field.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingAccruedInterestAmt
fielddef.descr: Amount of accrued interest of underlying security.

fielddef.name: UnderlyingNumDaysInterest
fielddef.descr: Number of days of interest for underlying security.

fielddef.name: RelatedOrderID
fielddef.descr: Identifier of a related order.

fielddef.name: RelatedOrderIDSource
fielddef.descr: Describes the source of the identifier that RelatedOrderID(2887) represents.

fielddef.name: RelatedOrderQty
fielddef.descr: Quantity of the related order which can be less than its total quantity. For example, when only parts of an order contribute to an aggregated order.

fielddef.name: OrderRelationship
fielddef.descr: Describes the type of relationship between the order identified by RelatedOrderID(2887) and the order outside of the RelatedOrderGrp component.

field.name: ApplID
field.comment: Identifies the application with which a message is associated. Used only if application sequencing is in effect.

field.name: ApplSeqNum
field.comment: Application sequence number assigned to the message by the application generating the message. Used only if application sequencing is in effect. Conditionally required if ApplID has been specified.

field.name: ApplLastSeqNum
field.comment: The previous sequence number in the application sequence stream. Permits an application to publish messages with sequence gaps where it cannot be avoided. Used only if application sequencing is in effect. Conditionally required if ApplID has been specified

field.name: ApplResendFlag
field.comment: Used to indicate that a message is being sent in response to an Application Message Request. Used only if application sequencing is in effect. It is possible for both ApplResendFlag and PossDupFlag to be set on the same message if the Sender's cache size is greater than zero and the message is being resent due to a session level resend request.

descr.p: The ApplicationSequenceControl is used for application sequencing and recovery. Consisting of ApplSeqNum, ApplID, ApplLastSeqNum, and ApplResendFlag, FIX application messages that carries this component block will be able to use application level sequencing. ApplID, ApplSeqNum and ApplLastSeqNum fields identify the application id, application sequence number and the previous application sequence number (in case of intentional gaps) on each application message that carries this block.
The ApplResendFlag is used to indicate that messages are being retransmitted as a result of an Application Message Request.
See Application Sequencing Message section for further details on usage and restrictions.

blockdef.name: CommissionData

field.name: CommCurrency
field.comment: For CIV - Optional

field.name: FundRenewWaiv
field.comment: For CIV - Optional

blockdef.descr: The CommissionData component block is used to carry commission information such as the type of commission and the rate. Use the CommissionDataGrp component as an alternative if multiple commissions or enhanced attributes are needed.

field.name: DerivativeSecurityXMLLen
field.comment: Must be set if SecurityXML field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: DerivativeSecurityXML
field.comment: XML Data Stream describing the Security.

field.name: DerivativeSecurityXMLSchema
field.comment: XML Schema used to validate the XML used to describe the Security.

descr.p: TBA

field.name: DiscretionInst
field.comment: What the discretionary price is related to (e.g. primary price, display price etc)

field.name: DiscretionOffsetValue
field.comment: Amount (signed) added to the "related to" price specified via DiscretionInst, in the context of DiscretionOffsetType.

field.name: DiscretionMoveType
field.comment: Describes whether discretion price is static/fixed or floats

field.name: DiscretionOffsetType
field.comment: Type of Discretion Offset (e.g. price offset, tick offset etc)

field.name: DiscretionLimitType
field.comment: Specifies the nature of the resulting discretion price (e.g. or better limit, strict limit etc)

field.name: DiscretionRoundDirection
field.comment: If the calculated discretion price is not a valid tick price, specifies how to round the price (e.g. to be more or less aggressive)

field.name: DiscretionScope
field.comment: The scope of "related to" price of the discretion (e.g. local, global etc).

descr.p: The presence ofDiscretionInstructionscomponent block on an order indicates that the trader wishes to display one price but will accept trades at another price.

field.name: DisplayLowQty
field.comment: Required whenDisplayMethod= 3

field.name: DisplayHighQty
field.comment: Required whenDisplayMethod= 3

field.name: DisplayMinIncr
field.comment: Can be used to specify larger increments than the standard increment provided by the market. Optionally used whenDisplayMethod= 3

field.name: RefreshQty
field.comment: Required whenDisplayMethod= 2

descr.p: The DisplayInstruction component block is used to convey instructions on how a reserved order is to be handled in terms of when and how much of the order quantity is to be displayed to the market.

field.name: InitialDisplayQty
field.comment: Only to be used in the ExecutionReport

field.name: ExpirationQtyType
field.comment: Required if NoExpiration > 0

descr.p: The ExpirationQty component block identified the expiration quantities and type of expiration.

field.name: AgreementDesc
field.comment: The full name of the base standard agreement, annexes and amendments in place between the principals and applicable to this deal

field.name: AgreementID
field.comment: A common reference to the applicable standing agreement between the principals

field.name: AgreementDate
field.comment: A reference to the date the underlying agreement was executed.

field.name: AgreementCurrency
field.comment: Currency of the underlying agreement.

field.name: TerminationType
field.comment: For Repos the timing or method for terminating the agreement.

field.name: StartDate
field.comment: Settlement date of the beginning of the deal

field.name: EndDate
field.comment: Repayment / repurchase date

field.name: DeliveryType
field.comment: Delivery or custody arrangement for the underlying securities

field.name: MarginRatio
field.comment: Percentage of cash value that underlying security collateral must meet.

descr.p: Component block is optionally used only for financing deals to identify the legal agreement under which the deal was made and other unique characteristics of the transaction. TheAgreementDescfield refers to base standard documents such as MRA 1996 Repurchase Agreement, GMRA 2000 Bills Transaction (U.K.), MSLA 1993 Securities Loan Amended 1998, for example.

field.name: EncodedDocumentationTextLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedDocuentationText(1527) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedDocumentationText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the DocuemtnationText(1513) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

field.name: Symbol
field.comment: Common, "human understood" representation of the security.SecurityIDvalue can be specified if no symbol exists (e.g. non-exchange traded Collective Investment Vehicles). Use "[N/A]" for products which do not have a symbol.

field.name: SymbolSfx
field.comment: Used in Fixed Income with a value of "WI" to indicate "When Issued" for a security to be reissued under an old CUSIP or ISIN or with a value of "CD" to indicate a EUCP with lump-sum interest rather than discount price.

field.name: SecurityID
field.comment: Takes precedence in identifying security to counterparty overSecurityAltIDblock. RequiresSecurityIDSourceif specified.

field.name: SecurityIDSource
field.comment: Required ifSecurityIDis specified.

block.comment: Number of alternate Security Identifiers

field.name: Product
field.comment: Indicates the type of product the security is associated with (high-level category)

field.name: ProductComplex
field.comment: Identifies an entire suite of products for a given market. In Futures this may be "interest rates", "agricultural", "equity indexes", etc

field.name: SecurityGroup
field.comment: An exchange specific name assigned to a group of related securities which may be concurrently affected by market events and actions.

field.name: CFICode
field.comment: Indicates the type of security using ISO 10962 standard, Classification of Financial Instruments (CFI code) values. It is recommended thatCFICodebe used instead ofSecurityTypefor non-Fixed Income instruments.

field.name: SecurityType
field.comment: It is recommended thatCFICodebe used instead ofSecurityTypefor non-Fixed Income instruments. Required for Fixed Income. Refer to Volume 7 - Fixed Income Futures and Options should be specified using the CFICode field instead of SecurityType (Refer to Volume 7 - Recommendations and Guidelines for Futures and Options Markets.)

field.name: SecuritySubType
field.comment: Sub-type qualification/identification of theSecurityType(e.g. for SecurityType="MLEG"). If specified,SecurityTypeis required.

field.name: MaturityMonthYear
field.comment: Specifies the month and year of maturity. Applicable for standardized derivatives which are typically only referenced b y month and year (e.g. S&P futures). NoteMaturityDate(a full date) can also be specified.

field.name: MaturityDate
field.comment: Specifies date of maturity (a full date). Note that standardized derivatives which are typically only referenced by month and year (e.g. S&P futures).may useMaturityMonthYearand/or this field. When using MaturityMonthYear, it is recommended that markets and sell sides report theMaturityDateon all outbound messages as a means of data enrichment.

field.name: MaturityTime
field.comment: For NDFs this represents the fixing time of the contract. It is optional to specify the fixing time.

field.name: SettleOnOpenFlag
field.comment: Indicator to determine ifInstrumentis Settle on Open.

field.name: SecurityStatus
field.comment: Gives the current state of the instrument

field.name: CouponPaymentDate
field.comment: Date interest is to be paid. Used in identifying Corporate Bond issues.

field.name: IssueDate
field.comment: Date instrument was issued. For Fixed Income IOIs for new issues, specifies the issue date.

field.name: RepoCollateralSecurityType
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.4.4)

field.name: RepurchaseTerm
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.4.4)

field.name: RepurchaseRate
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.4.4)

field.name: Factor
field.comment: For Fixed Income: Amortization Factor for deriving Current face from Original face for ABS or MBS securities, note the fraction may be greater than, equal to or less than 1. In TIPS securities this is the Inflation index. Qty * Factor * Price = Gross Trade Amount. For Derivatives: Contract Value Factor by which price must be adjusted to determine the true nominal value of one futures/options contract. (Qty * Price) * Factor = Nominal Value.

field.name: InstrRegistry
field.comment: The location at which records of ownership are maintained for this instrument, and at which ownership changes must be recorded. Can be used in conjunction with ISIN to address ISIN uniqueness issues.

field.name: CountryOfIssue
field.comment: ISO Country code of instrument issue (e.g. the country portion typically used in ISIN). Can be used in conjunction with non-ISINSecurityID(e.g. CUSIP for Municipal Bonds without ISIN) to provide uniqueness.

field.name: StateOrProvinceOfIssue
field.comment: A two-character state or province abbreviation.

field.name: LocaleOfIssue
field.comment: The three-character IATA code for a locale (e.g. airport code for Municipal Bonds).

field.name: RedemptionDate
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.4.4)

field.name: StrikePrice
field.comment: Used for derivatives, such as options and covered warrants

field.name: StrikeCurrency
field.comment: Used for derivatives

field.name: StrikeMultiplier
field.comment: Used for derivatives. Multiplier applied to the strike price for the purpose of calculating the settlement value.

field.name: StrikeValue
field.comment: Used for derivatives. The number of shares/units for the financial instrument involved in the option trade.

field.name: StrikePriceBoundaryMethod
field.comment: When specified, PutOrCall(201), StrikePrice(202), and StrikePriceBoundaryPrecision(1480) must also be specified.

field.name: OptAttribute
field.comment: Used for derivatives, such as options and covered warrants to indicate a versioning of the contract when required due to corporate actions to the underlying. Should not be used to indicate type of option - use the CFICode[461] for this purpose.

field.name: ContractMultiplier
field.comment: For Fixed Income, Convertible Bonds, Derivatives, etc. Note: If used, quantities should be expressed in the "nominal" (e.g. contracts vs. shares) amount.

field.name: MinPriceIncrement
field.comment: Minimum price increment for the instrument. Could also be used to represent tick value.

field.name: MinPriceIncrementAmount
field.comment: Minimum price increment amount associated with the MinPriceIncrement. For listed derivatives, the value can be calculated by multiplying MinPriceIncrement by ContractValueFactor

field.name: UnitOfMeasure
field.comment: Used to indicate the size of the underlying commodity on which the contract is based (e.g., 2500 lbs of lean cattle, 1000 barrels of crude oil, 1000 bushels of corn, etc.)

field.name: SettlMethod
field.comment: Conditionally required if SettlSubMethod(2579) is specified.

field.name: ExerciseStyle
field.comment: Type of exercise of a derivatives security

field.name: OptPayoutAmount
field.comment: Conditionally required if OptPayoutType(1482) = 3 (Binary).

field.name: PriceQuoteMethod
field.comment: Method for price quotation

field.name: ValuationMethod
field.comment: For futures, indicates type of valuation method applied

field.name: ListMethod
field.comment: Indicates whether the instruments are pre-listed only or can also be defined via user request

field.name: CapPrice
field.comment: Used to express the ceiling price of a capped call

field.name: FloorPrice
field.comment: Used to express the floor price of a capped put

field.name: PutOrCall
field.comment: Used to express option right

field.name: FlexibleIndicator
field.comment: Used to indicate if a security has been defined as flexible according to "non-standard" means. Analog to CFICode Standard/Non-standard indicator

field.name: FlexProductEligibilityIndicator
field.comment: Used to indicate if a product or group of product supports the creation of flexible securities

field.name: TimeUnit
field.comment: Used to indicate a time unit for the contract (e.g., days, weeks, months, etc.)

field.name: CouponRate
field.comment: For Fixed Income.

field.name: SecurityExchange
field.comment: Can be used to identify the security.

field.name: PositionLimit
field.comment: Position Limit for the instrument.

field.name: NTPositionLimit
field.comment: Near-term Position Limit for the instrument.

field.name: EncodedIssuerLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedIssuer(349) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedIssuer
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Issuer(106) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

field.name: EncodedSecurityDescLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedSecurityDesc(351) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedSecurityDesc
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the SecurityDesc(107) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

block.comment: Embedded XML document describing the instrument.

field.name: Pool
field.comment: Identifies MBS / ABS pool

field.name: ContractSettlMonth
field.comment: Must be present for MBS/TBA

field.name: CPProgram
field.comment: The program under which a commercial paper is issued

field.name: CPRegType
field.comment: The registration type of a commercial paper issuance

block.comment: Number of repeating EventType group entries.

field.name: DatedDate
field.comment: If different from IssueDate

field.name: InterestAccrualDate
field.comment: If different fromIssueDateand DatedDate

block.comment: Used to identify the parties related to a specific instrument.

comment.p: Spread table code referred by the security or symbol

field.name: AssetClass
field.comment: Required if AssetSubClass(1939) is specified.

field.name: AssetSubClass
field.comment: Required if AssetType(1940) is specified.

field.name: AssetType
field.comment: Required if AssetSubType(2735) is specified.

field.name: NthToDefault
field.comment: Conditionally required when MthToDefault(1943) is specified.

field.name: CouponFrequencyPeriod
field.comment: Conditionally required when CouponFrequencyUnit(1949) is specified.

field.name: CouponFrequencyUnit
field.comment: Conditionally required when CouponFrequencyPeriod(1948) is specified.

field.name: ConvertibleBondEquityIDSource
field.comment: Conditionally required when ConvertibleBondEquityID(1951) is specified.

field.name: EncodedOptionExpirationDescLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedOptionExpirationDesc(1697) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedOptionExpirationDesc
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the OptionExpirationDesc(1581) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

field.name: InTheMoneyCondition
field.comment: Used to express in-the-moneyness behavior in general terms for the option without the use of StrikePrice(202) and PutOrCall(201).

descr.p: TheInstrumentcomponent block contains all the fields commonly used to describe a security or instrument. Typically the data elements in this component block are considered the static data of a security, data that may be commonly found in a security master database. TheInstrumentcomponent block can be used to describe any asset type supported by FIX.

field.name: EncodedFinancialInstrumentFullNameLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedFinancialInstrumentFullName(2716) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedFinancialInstrumentFullName
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the FinancialInstrumentFullName(2714) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

field.name: DeliveryForm
field.comment: Identifies the form of delivery.

field.name: PctAtRisk
field.comment: Percent at risk due to lowest possible call.

block.comment: Number of repeating InstrAttrib group entries.

descr.p: TheInstrumentExtensioncomponent block identifies additional security attributes that are more commonly found for Fixed Income securities.

field.name: LegRepoCollateralSecurityType
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.4.4)

field.name: LegRepurchaseTerm
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.4.4)

field.name: LegRepurchaseRate
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.4.4)

field.name: LegRedemptionDate
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.4.4)

field.name: LegUnitOfMeasure
field.comment: Used to indicate the size of the underlying commodity on which the contract is based (e.g., 2500 lbs of lean cattle, 1000 barrels of crude oil, 1000 bushels of corn, etc.)

field.name: LegTimeUnit
field.comment: Used to indicate a time unit for the contract (e.g., days, weeks, months, etc.)

field.name: EncodedLegIssuerLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedLegIssuer(618) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedLegIssuer
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the LegIssuer(617) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

field.name: EncodedLegSecurityDescLen
field.comment: Must be set if LegEncodedSecurityDesc(622) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedLegSecurityDesc
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the LegSecurityDesc(620) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

field.name: LegRatioQty
field.comment: Specific to the <InstrumentLeg> (not in <Instrument>)

field.name: LegSide
field.comment: Specific to the <InstrumentLeg> (not in <Instrument>)

field.name: LegCurrency
field.comment: Specific to the <InstrumentLeg> (not in <Instrument>)

field.name: LegPool
field.comment: Identifies MBS / ABS pool

field.name: LegPutOrCall
field.comment: Used to express option right

descr.p: TheInstrumentLegcomponent block, like theInstrumentcomponent block, contains all the fields commonly used to describe a security or instrument. In the case of theInstrumentLegcomponent block it describes a security used in multileg-oriented messages.
Refer to theInstrumentcomponent block comments as this component block mirrors Instrument, except for the noted fields.

Several multileg-oriented messages specify anInstrumentLeg component block. An instrument can have zero or more instrument legs. The fundamental business rule that applies to the multileg instrument is that the multileg instrument is defined as the combination of instrument legs. The multileg instrument must be able to be traded atomically that all instrument legs are traded or none are traded.
The LegRatioQty is used to define the quantity of the leg that makes up a single unit of the multleg instrument. An option butterfly strategy is made up of three option legs.

field.name: LegID
field.comment: Used for unique identification of the leg that can subsequently be used whenever a simple leg identification is sufficient. It can also serve as input value for LegRefID(654) whenever only a simple leg reference is allowed or needed

block.comment: Embedded XML document describing the leg instrument.

field.name: LegAssetClass
field.comment: Required if LegAssetSubClass(2068) is specified.

field.name: LegAssetSubClass
field.comment: Required if LegAssetType(2069) is specified.

field.name: LegAssetType
field.comment: Required if LegAssetSubType(2739) is specified.

field.name: LegNthToDefault
field.comment: Conditionally required when LegMthToDefault(2158) is specified.

field.name: LegCouponFrequencyPeriod
field.comment: Conditionally required when LegCouponFreqUnit(2164) is specified.

field.name: LegCouponFrequencyUnit
field.comment: Conditionally required when LegCouponFreqPeriod(2163) is specified.

field.name: LegConvertibleBondEquityIDSource
field.comment: Conditionally required when LegConvertibleBondEquityID(2166) is specified.

field.name: EncodedLegOptionExpirationDescLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedLegOptionExpirationDesc(2180) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedLegOptionExpirationDesc
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the LegOptionExpirationDesc(2178) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

field.name: LegStrikePriceBoundaryMethod
field.comment: When specified, LegPutOrCall(1358), LegStrikePrice(612), and LegStrikePriceBoundaryPrecision(2188) must also be specified.

field.name: LegOptPayoutAmount
field.comment: Conditionally required if LegOptPayoutTyp(2193) = 3 (Binary).

field.name: LegInTheMoneyCondition
field.comment: Used to express in-the-moneyness behavior in general terms for the option without the use of LegStrikePrice(612) and LegPutOrCall(1358).

field.name: EncodedLegFinancialInstrumentFullNameLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedLegFinancialInstrumentFullName(2719) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedLegFinancialInstrumentFullName
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the LegFinancialInstrumentFullName(2717) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

field.name: NoInstrumentParties
field.comment: Repeating group below should contain unique combinations of InstrumentPartyID, InstrumentPartyIDSource, and InstrumentPartyRole

field.name: InstrumentPartyID
field.comment: Required if NoInstrumentParties(1018) > 0. Identification of the party.

field.name: InstrumentPartyIDSource
field.comment: Required if NoInstrumentParties(1018) > 0. Used to identify classification source.

field.name: InstrumentPartyRole
field.comment: Required if NoInstrumentParties(1018) > 0. Identifies the type of InstrumentPartyID(1019).

block.comment: Repeating group of party sub-identifiers.

descr.p: The use of this component block is restricted to instrument definition only and is not permitted to contain transactional information. Only a specified subset of party roles will be supported within the InstrumentParty block.
Possible uses of this block include identifying Listing Source information; Clearing Org information; Parent and Capital Structure information for F/I and derivative instruments.
The LegBenchmarkCurveData is used to convey the benchmark information used for pricing in a multi-legged Fixed Income security.

field.name: LegStipulationType
field.comment: Required ifNoLegStipulations>0

descr.p: TheLegStipulationscomponent block has the same usage as theStipulationscomponent block, but for a leg instrument in a multi-legged security.

field.name: NoNestedPartyIDs
field.comment: Repeating group below should contain unique combinations of NestedPartyID, NestedPartyIDSource, and NestedPartyRole

field.name: NestedPartyID
field.comment: Used to identify source of NestedPartyID. Required ifNestedPartyIDSourceis specified. Required ifNoNestedPartyIDs> 0.

field.name: NestedPartyIDSource
field.comment: Used to identify class source ofNestedPartyIDvalue (e.g. BIC). Required ifNestedPartyIDis specified. Required ifNoNestedPartyIDs> 0.

field.name: NestedPartyRole
field.comment: Identifies the type ofNestedPartyID(e.g. Executing Broker). Required ifNoNestedPartyIDs> 0.

block.comment: Repeating group of NestedParty sub-identifiers.

descr.p: TheNestedPartiescomponent block is identical to thePartiesBlock. It is used in other component blocks and repeating groups when nesting will take place resulting in multiple occurrences of thePartiesblock within a single FIX message.. Use ofNestedPartiesunder these conditions avoids multiple references to thePartiesblock within the same message which is not allowed in FIX tag/value syntax.

field.name: NoNested2PartyIDs
field.comment: Repeating group below should contain unique combinations of Nested2PartyID, Nested2PartyIDSource, and Nested2PartyRole

field.name: Nested2PartyID
field.comment: Used to identify source of Nested2PartyID. Required ifNested2PartyIDSourceis specified. Required ifNoNested2PartyIDs> 0.

field.name: Nested2PartyIDSource
field.comment: Used to identify class source ofNested2PartyIDvalue (e.g. BIC). Required ifNested2PartyIDis specified. Required ifNoNested2PartyIDs> 0.

field.name: Nested2PartyRole
field.comment: Identifies the type ofNested2PartyID(e.g. Executing Broker). Required ifNoNested2PartyIDs> 0.

block.comment: Repeating group of Nested2Party sub-identifiers.

descr.p: TheNestedParties2component block is identical to thePartiesBlock. It is used in other component blocks and repeating groups when nesting will take place resulting in multiple occurrences of thePartiesblock within a single FIX message.. Use ofNestedParties2under these conditions avoids multiple references to thePartiesblock within the same message which is not allowed in FIX tag/value syntax.

field.name: NoNested3PartyIDs
field.comment: Repeating group below should contain unique combinations of Nested3PartyID, Nested3PartyIDSource, and Nested3PartyRole

field.name: Nested3PartyID
field.comment: Used to identify source of Nested3PartyID. Required ifNested3PartyIDSourceis specified. Required ifNoNested3PartyIDs> 0.

field.name: Nested3PartyIDSource
field.comment: Used to identify class source ofNested3PartyIDvalue (e.g. BIC). Required ifNested3PartyIDis specified. Required ifNoNested3PartyIDs> 0.

field.name: Nested3PartyRole
field.comment: Identifies the type ofNested3PartyID(e.g. Executing Broker). Required ifNoNested3PartyIDs> 0.

block.comment: Repeating group of Nested3Party sub-identifiers.

descr.p: TheNestedParties3component block is identical to thePartiesBlock. It is used in other component blocks and repeating groups when nesting will take place resulting in multiple occurrences of thePartiesblock within a single FIX message.. Use ofNestedParties3under these conditions avoids multiple references to thePartiesblock within the same message which is not allowed in FIX tag/value syntax.

field.name: NoNested4PartyIDs
field.comment: Repeating group below should contain unique combinations of Nested4PartyID, Nested4PartyIDSource, and Nested4PartyRole.

field.name: Nested4PartyID
field.comment: Used to identify source of Nested4PartyID. Required ifNested4PartyIDSourceis specified. Required ifNoNested4PartyIDs> 0.

field.name: Nested4PartyIDSource
field.comment: Used to identify class source ofNested4PartyIDvalue (e.g. BIC). Required ifNested4PartyIDis specified. Required ifNoNested4PartyIDs> 0.

field.name: Nested4PartyRole
field.comment: Identifies the type ofNested4PartyID(e.g. Executing Broker). Required ifNoNested4PartyIDs> 0.

descr.p: TheNestedParties3component block is identical to thePartiesBlock. It is used in other component blocks and repeating groups when nesting will take place resulting in multiple occurrences of thePartiesblock within a single FIX message.. Use ofNestedParties4under these conditions avoids multiple references to thePartiesblock within the same message which is not allowed in FIX tag/value syntax.

field.name: OrderQty
field.comment: One of CashOrderQty, OrderQty, or (for CIV only)OrderPercentis required. Note that unless otherwise specified, only one of CashOrderQty, OrderQty, orOrderPercentshould be specified.

field.name: CashOrderQty
field.comment: One of CashOrderQty, OrderQty, or (for CIV only)OrderPercentis required. Note that unless otherwise specified, only one of CashOrderQty, OrderQty, orOrderPercentshould be specified. Specifies the approximate "monetary quantity" for the order. Broker is responsible for converting and calculatingOrderQtyin tradeable units (e.g. shares) for subsequent messages.

field.name: OrderPercent
field.comment: For CIV - Optional. One of CashOrderQty,OrderQtyor (for CIV only)OrderPercentis required. Note that unless otherwise specified, only one of CashOrderQty, OrderQty, orOrderPercentshould be specified.

field.name: RoundingDirection
field.comment: For CIV - Optional

field.name: RoundingModulus
field.comment: For CIV - Optional

descr.p: "TheOrderQtyDatacomponent block contains the fields commonly used for indicating the amount or quantity of an order. Note that when this component block is marked as "required" in a message either one of these three fields must be used to identify the amount: OrderQty,CashOrderQtyorOrderPercent(in the case of CIV)."

field.name: NoPartyIDs
field.comment: Repeating group below should contain unique combinations of PartyID, PartyIDSource, and PartyRole

field.name: PartyID
field.comment: Required if NoPartyIDs(453) > 0. Identification of the party.

field.name: PartyIDSource
field.comment: Required if NoPartyIDs(453) > 0. Used to identify classification source.

field.name: PartyRole
field.comment: Required if NoPartyIDs(453) > 0. Identifies the type of PartyID(448).

descr.p: ThePartiescomponent block is used to identify and convey information on the entities both central and peripheral to the financial transaction represented by the FIX message containing thePartiesBlock. ThePartiesblock allows many different types of entites to be expressed through use of thePartyRolefield and identifies the source of thePartyIDthrough the the PartyIDSource.
See Volume 6 - APPENDIX 6-G - USE OF <PARTIES> COMPONENT BLOCK for additional usage information..

field.name: PegOffsetValue
field.comment: Amount (signed) added to the peg for a pegged order in the context of the PegOffsetType

field.name: PegPriceType
field.comment: Defines the type of peg.

field.name: PegMoveType
field.comment: Describes whether peg is static/fixed or floats

field.name: PegOffsetType
field.comment: Type of Peg Offset (e.g. price offset, tick offset etc)

field.name: PegLimitType
field.comment: Specifies nature of resulting pegged price (e.g. or better limit, strict limit etc)

field.name: PegRoundDirection
field.comment: If the calculated peg price is not a valid tick price, specifies how to round the price (e.g. be more or less aggressive)

field.name: PegScope
field.comment: The scope of the "related to" price of the peg (e.g. local, global etc)

field.name: PegSecurityIDSource
field.comment: Required ifPegSecurityIDis specified.

field.name: PegSecurityID
field.comment: RequiresPegSecurityIDSourceif specified.

descr.p: The Peg Instructions component block is used to tie the price of a security to a market event such as opening price, mid-price, best price. The Peg Instructions block may also be used to tie the price to the behavior of a related security.

field.name: NoPosAmt
field.comment: Number of Position Amount entries.

field.name: PosAmtReason
field.comment: Specifies the reason for an amount type when reported on a position. Useful when multiple instances of the same amount type are reported.

field.name: PosAmtStreamDesc
field.comment: Used when the PosAmt(708) value corresponds to a specific stream in of a swap.

descr.p: The PositionAmountData component block is used to report netted amounts associated with position quantities. In the listed derivatives market the amount is generally expressing a type of futures variation or option premium. In the equities market this may be the net pay or collect on a given position.

field.name: PosType
field.comment: Required if NoPositions > 0

field.name: QuantityDate
field.comment: Date associated with the quantity being reported.

block.comment: Optional repeating group - used to associate or distribute position to a specific party other than the party that currently owns the position.

field.name: CoveredQty
field.comment: Short quantity that is considered covered, e.g. used for short option position

descr.p: The PositionQty component block specifies the various types of position quantity in the position life-cycle including start-of-day, intraday, trade, adjustments, and end-of-day position quantities. Quantities are expressed in terms of long and short quantities.

field.name: NoRootPartyIDs
field.comment: Repeating group below should contain unique combinations of RootPartyID, RootPartyIDSource, and RootPartyRole

field.name: RootPartyID
field.comment: Used to identify source of RootPartyID. Required ifRootPartyIDSourceis specified. Required ifNoRootPartyIDs> 0.

field.name: RootPartyIDSource
field.comment: Used to identify class source ofRootPartyIDvalue (e.g. BIC). Required ifRootPartyIDis specified. Required ifNoRootPartyIDs> 0.

field.name: RootPartyRole
field.comment: Identifies the type ofRootPartyID(e.g. Executing Broker). Required ifNoRootPartyIDs> 0.

descr.p: TheRootPartiescomponent block is a version of thePartiescomponent block used to provide root information regarding the owning and entering parties of a transaction.

field.name: SettlDeliveryType
field.comment: Required if AllocSettlInstType = 1 or 2

field.name: StandInstDbType
field.comment: Required if AllocSettlInstType = 3 (should not be populated otherwise)

field.name: StandInstDbName
field.comment: Required if AllocSettlInstType = 3 (should not be populated otherwise)

field.name: StandInstDbID
field.comment: Identifier used within the StandInstDbType. Required if AllocSettlInstType = 3 (should not be populated otherwise).

block.comment: Required (and must be > 0) if AllocSettlInstType = 2 (should not be populated otherwise)

descr.p: The SettlInstructionsData component block is used to convey key information regarding standing settlement and delivery instructions. It also provides a reference to standing settlement details regarding the source, delivery instructions, and settlement parties
It is important to understand that Settlement Instructions convey standing (reference) data only and is not used for settlement transactions which are currently outside the scope of the FIX Protocol.
See Volume 6 - APPENDIX 6-H - USE OF <SETTLINSTRUCTIONS> COMPONENT BLOCK for additional usage information.

field.name: NoSettlPartyIDs
field.comment: Repeating group below should contain unique combinations of SettlPartyID, SettlPartyIDSource, and SettlPartyRole.

field.name: SettlPartyID
field.comment: Used to identify source of SettlPartyID. Required if SettlPartyIDSource is specified. Required if NoSettlPartyIDs > 0.

field.name: SettlPartyIDSource
field.comment: Used to identify class source of SettlPartyID value (e.g. BIC). Required if SettlPartyID is specified. Required if NoSettlPartyIDs > 0.

field.name: SettlPartyRole
field.comment: Identifies the type of SettlPartyID (e.g. Executing Broker). Required if NoSettlPartyIDs > 0.

block.comment: Repeating group of SettlParty sub-identifiers.

descr.p: The SettlParties component block is used in a similar manner as Parties Block within the context of settlement instruction messages to distinguish between parties involved in the settlement and parties who are expected to execute the settlement process.
TheSideTrdRegTScomponent block is used to convey regulatory timestamps associated with one side of a multi-sided trade event.

field.name: BeginString
field.comment: FIXT.1.1 (Always unencrypted, must be first field in message)

field.name: BodyLength
field.comment: (Always unencrypted, must be second field in message)

field.name: MsgType
field.comment: (Always unencrypted, must be third field in message)

field.name: SenderCompID
field.comment: (Always unencrypted)

field.name: TargetCompID
field.comment: (Always unencrypted)

field.name: OnBehalfOfCompID
field.comment: Trading partner company ID used when sending messages via a third party (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)

field.name: DeliverToCompID
field.comment: Trading partner company ID used when sending messages via a third party (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)

field.name: SecureDataLen
field.comment: Required to identify length of encrypted section of message. (Always unencrypted).Deprecated in FIXT1.1.

field.name: SecureData
field.comment: Required when message body is encrypted. Always immediately followsSecureDataLenfield. Deprecated in FIXT1.1.

field.name: MsgSeqNum
field.comment: (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)

field.name: SenderSubID
field.comment: (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)

field.name: SenderLocationID
field.comment: Sender's LocationID (i.e. geographic location and/or desk) (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)

field.name: TargetSubID
field.comment: "ADMIN" reserved for administrative messages not intended for a specific user. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)

field.name: TargetLocationID
field.comment: Trading partner LocationID (i.e. geographic location and/or desk) (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)

field.name: OnBehalfOfSubID
field.comment: Trading partner SubID used when delivering messages via a third party. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)

field.name: OnBehalfOfLocationID
field.comment: Trading partner LocationID (i.e. geographic location and/or desk) used when delivering messages via a third party. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)

field.name: DeliverToSubID
field.comment: Trading partner SubID used when delivering messages via a third party. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)

field.name: DeliverToLocationID
field.comment: Trading partner LocationID (i.e. geographic location and/or desk) used when delivering messages via a third party. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)

field.name: PossDupFlag
field.comment: Always required for retransmitted messages, whether prompted by the sending system or as the result of a resend request. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)

field.name: PossResend
field.comment: Required when message may be duplicate of another message sent under a different sequence number. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)

field.name: SendingTime
field.comment: (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)

field.name: OrigSendingTime
field.comment: Required for message resent as a result of a Resend Request. If data is not available set to same value asSendingTime(Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)

field.name: XmlDataLen
field.comment: Required when specifyingXmlDatato identify the length of a XmlData message block. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)

field.name: XmlData
field.comment: Can contain a XML formatted message block (e.g. FIXML). Always immediately followsXmlDataLenfield. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) See Volume 1: FIXML Support of FIX Specification

field.name: MessageEncoding
field.comment: Type of message encoding (non-ASCII characters) used in a message's "Encoded" fields. Required if any "Encoding" fields are used.

field.name: LastMsgSeqNumProcessed
field.comment: The lastMsgSeqNumvalue received by the FIX engine and processed by downstream application, such as trading system or order routing system. Can be specified on every message sent. Useful for detecting a backlog with a counterparty.

field.name: ApplVerID
field.comment: Indicates application version using a service pack identifier. The ApplVerID applies to a specific message

field.name: CstmApplVerID
field.comment: Used to support bilaterally agreed custom functionality

descr.p: Each administrative or application message is preceded by a standard header. The header identifies the message type, length, destination, sequence number, origination point and time

Two fields help with resending messages. ThePossDupFlagis set to Y when resending a message as the result of a session level event (i.e. the retransmission of a message reusing a sequence number). ThePossResendis set to Y when reissuing a message with a new sequence number (e.i. resending an order). The receiving application should process these messages as follows:

ul.li: PossDupFlag - if a message with this sequence number has been previously received, ignore message, if not, process normally.
PossResend - forward message to application and determine if previously received (i.e. verify order id and parameters).

descr.p: Message Routing Details - One Firm-to-One Firm (point-to-point)

The following table provides examples regarding the use ofSenderCompID,TargetCompID,DeliverToCompID, andOnBehalfOfCompIDwhen using a single point-to-point FIX session between two firms. Assumption (A=sellside, B =buyside):
Message Routing Details - Third Party Message Routing

The FIX Session Protocol supports the ability for a single FIX session to represent multiple counterpaties. This can be in a 1-to-many, many-to-1, or 1-to-1 fashion. In addition, some third parties may be connected to other third parties effectively forming a "chain" of "hops" between the original message initiator and the final message receiver. TheSenderCompID,OnBehalfOfCompID,TargetCompID, andDeliverToCompIDfields are used for routing purposes.

When a third party sends a message on behalf of another firm (usingOnBehalfOfCompID), that third party may optionally add their details to theNoHopsrepeating group. This repeating group builds a "history" of third parties through which the original message was re-transmitted. TheNoHopsrepeating group is NOT used to facilitate routing, rather it provides an audit trail of third party involvement to the receiver of a message. An audit trail of intermediary involvement may be a requirement of some regulatory bodies or counterparties. When a third party forwards a message on to the next hop (may be the end point or another third party), that third party can add its hop details to theNoHopsrepeating group (e.g. itsSenderCompIDasHopCompID, itsSendingTimeasHopSendingTime, and the received message'sMsgSeqNumor some other reference asHopRefID).

Note that ifOnBehalfOfCompIDorDeliverToCompIDmessage source identification/routing is used for a FIX session, then it must be used on all Application messages transmitted via that session accordingly (Reject message if not).

The following table provides examples regarding the use ofSenderCompID,TargetCompID,DeliverToCompID, andOnBehalfOfCompIDwhen using a single FIX session to represent multiple firms. Assumption (A=sellside, B and C=buyside, Q=third party):

tr.td: Send from A to B via Q
B responds to A via Q
Send from A to B *AND* C via Q
B *AND* C send to A via Q

descr.p: Note that some fields (e.g.ClOrdIDon aNew Order Single) must be unique for all orders on a given FIX session. Thus when usingOnBehalfOfCompID(orDeliverToCompID) addressing, a recommended approach is to prependOnBehalfOfCompID(orDeliverToCompID) to the original value. Thus if A sends QClOrdIDvalue of "123", then Q could specifyClOrdIDof "A-123" when sending the message to C to ensure uniqueness.

field.name: SignatureLength
field.comment: Required when trailer contains signature. Note: Not to be included withinSecureDatafield. Deprecated in FIXT1.1.

field.name: Signature
field.comment: Note: Not to be included withinSecureDatafield. Deprecated in FIXT1.1.

field.name: CheckSum
field.comment: (Always unencrypted, always last field in message)

descr.p: Each message, administrative or application, is terminated by a standard trailer. The trailer is used to segregate messages and contains the three digit character representation of theCheckSumvalue.

field.name: Spread
field.comment: For Fixed Income

field.name: BenchmarkPriceType
field.comment: Must be present ifBenchmarkPriceis used.

field.name: BenchmarkSecurityID
field.comment: The identifier of the benchmark security, e.g. Treasury against Corporate bond.

field.name: BenchmarkSecurityIDSource
field.comment: Source of BenchmarkSecurityID. If not specified, then ID Source is understood to be the same as that in theInstrumentblock.

descr.p: TheSpreadOrBenchmarkCurveDatacomponent block is primarily used for Fixed Income to convey spread to a benchmark security or curve.

field.name: StipulationType
field.comment: Required ifNoStipulations>0

descr.p: TheStipulationscomponent block is used in Fixed Income to provide additional information on a given security. These additional information are usually not considered static data information.

field.name: TrdRegTimestamp
field.comment: Required ifNoTrdRegTimestamps> 1

field.name: TrdRegTimestampType
field.comment: Required ifNoTrdRegTimestamps> 1

field.name: DeskType

field.name: InformationBarrierID
field.comment: DeskType is required for OATS Reporting if InformationBarrierID(1727) is specified

field.name: NBBOEntryType
field.comment: May be used with TrdRegTimestampType(770)=34 (Reference time for NBBO).

field.name: NBBOPrice
field.comment: May be used with TrdRegTimestampType(770)=34 (Reference time for NBBO).

field.name: NBBOQty
field.comment: May be used with TrdRegTimestampType(770)=34 (Reference time for NBBO).

field.name: NBBOSource
field.comment: May be used with TrdRegTimestampType(770)=34 (Reference time for NBBO).

descr.p: TheTrdRegTimestampscomponent block is used to express timestamps for an order or trade that are required by regulatory agencies These timesteamps are used to identify the timeframes for when an order or trade is received on the floor, received and executed by the broker, etc.

field.name: TriggerType
field.comment: Required if any other Triggering tags are specified.

field.name: TriggerPrice
field.comment: Only relevant and required forTriggerAction= 1

field.name: TriggerSymbol
field.comment: Only relevant and required forTriggerAction= 1

field.name: TriggerSecurityID
field.comment: RequiresTriggerSecurityIDSourceif specified. Only relevant and required forTriggerAction= 1

field.name: TriggerSecurityIDSource
field.comment: RequiresTriggerSecurityIDSourceif specified. Only relevant and required forTriggerAction= 1

field.name: TriggerPriceType
field.comment: Only relevant forTriggerAction= 1

field.name: TriggerPriceTypeScope
field.comment: Only relevant forTriggerAction= 1

field.name: TriggerPriceDirection
field.comment: Only relevant forTriggerAction= 1

field.name: TriggerNewPrice
field.comment: Should be specified if the order changes Price.

field.name: TriggerOrderType
field.comment: Should be specified if the order changes type.

field.name: TriggerNewQty
field.comment: Required if the order should change quantity

field.name: TriggerTradingSessionID
field.comment: Only relevant and required forTriggerType= 2.

field.name: TriggerTradingSessionSubID
field.comment: RequiresTriggerTradingSessionIDif specified. Relevant forTriggerType= 2 only.

descr.p: TheTriggeringInstructioncomponent block specifies the conditions under which an order will be triggered by related market events as well as the behavior of the order in the market once it is triggered. .

field.name: NoUnderlyingAmounts
field.comment: Number of Distribution instructions in this message (number of repeating groups to follow).

field.name: UnderlyingPayAmount
field.comment: Amount to pay in order to receive the underlying instrument.

field.name: UnderlyingCollectAmount
field.comment: Amount to collect in order to deliver the underlying instrument.

field.name: UnderlyingSettlementDate
field.comment: Date the underlying instrument will settle. Used for derivatives that deliver into more than one underlying instrument. Settlement dates can vary across underlying instruments.

field.name: UnderlyingSettlementStatus
field.comment: Settlement status of the underlying instrument. Used for derivatives that deliver into more than one underlying instrument. Settlement can be delayed for an underlying instrument.

descr.p: The UnderlyingAmount component block is used to supply the underlying amounts, dates, settlement status and method for derivative positions.

comment.p: CFTC: The futures contract expiration date or the price exposure month resulting from a futures swap. For the EndOfDay Settlement Prices report show the contract expiration month or date. Both YYYYMM and YYYYMMDD are supported.

field.name: UnderlyingRepoCollateralSecurityType
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.4.4)

field.name: UnderlyingRepurchaseTerm
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.4.4)

field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.4.4)

field.name: UnderlyingRedemptionDate
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.4.4)

field.name: UnderlyingUnitOfMeasure
field.comment: Used to indicate the size of the underlying commodity on which the contract is based (e.g., 2500 lbs of lean cattle, 1000 barrels of crude oil, 1000 bushels of corn, etc.)

field.name: UnderlyingTimeUnit
field.comment: Used to indicate a time unit for the contract (e.g., days, weeks, months, etc.)

field.name: EncodedUnderlyingIssuerLen
field.comment: Must be set if UnderlyingEncodedIssuer(363) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedUnderlyingIssuer
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the UnderlyingIssuer(363) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

field.name: EncodedUnderlyingSecurityDescLen
field.comment: Must be set if UnderlyingEncodedSecurityDesc(307) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedUnderlyingSecurityDesc
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the UnderlyingSecurityDesc(307) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

field.name: UnderlyingAllocationPercent
field.comment: Specific to the UnderlyingInstrument. Percent of the StrikePricethat this underlying represents. Necessary for derivatives that deliver into more than one underlying instrument.

field.name: UnderlyingCurrency
field.comment: Specific to theUnderlyingInstrument(not inInstrument).

field.name: UnderlyingQty
field.comment: Specific to theUnderlyingInstrument(not inInstrument). Unit amount of the underlying security (par, shares, currency, etc.)

field.name: UnderlyingSettlementType
field.comment: Specific to the UnderlyingInstrument Indicates order settlement period for the underlying deliverable component.

field.name: UnderlyingCashAmount
field.comment: Specific to the UnderlyingInstrument Cash amount associated with the underlying component. Necessary for derivatives that deliver into more than one underlying instrument and one of the underlying's is a fixed cash value.

field.name: UnderlyingCashType
field.comment: Specific to the UnderlyingInstrument Used for derivatives that deliver into cash underlying. Indicates that the cash is either fixed or difference value (difference between strike and current underlying price)

field.name: UnderlyingPx
field.comment: Specific to theUnderlyingInstrument(not inInstrument). In a financing deal clean price (percent-of-par or per unit) of the underlying security or basket.

field.name: UnderlyingDirtyPrice
field.comment: Specific to theUnderlyingInstrument(not inInstrument). " In a financing deal price (percent-of-par or per unit) of the underlying security or basket. "Dirty" means it includes accrued interest"

field.name: UnderlyingEndPrice
field.comment: Specific to theUnderlyingInstrument(not inInstrument). In a financing deal price (percent-of-par or per unit) of the underlying security or basket at the end of the agreement.

field.name: UnderlyingStartValue
field.comment: Specific to theUnderlyingInstrument(not inInstrument). Currencyvalue attributed to this collateral at the start of the agreement

field.name: UnderlyingCurrentValue
field.comment: Specific to theUnderlyingInstrument(not inInstrument). Currencyvalue currently attributed to this collateral

field.name: UnderlyingEndValue
field.comment: Specific to theUnderlyingInstrument(not inInstrument). Currencyvalue attributed to this collateral at the end of the agreement

block.comment: Specific to theUnderlyingInstrument(not inInstrument). Insert here the contents of the <UnderlyingStipulations> Component Block

field.name: UnderlyingAdjustedQuantity
field.comment: Specific to theUnderlyingInstrument(not inInstrument). For listed derivatives margin management, this is the number of shares adjusted for upcoming corporate action. Used only for securities which are optionable and are between ex-date and settlement date (4 days).

field.name: UnderlyingFXRate
field.comment: Specific to theUnderlyingInstrument(not inInstrument). Foreign exchange rate used to computeUnderlyingCurrentValue(885) (or market value) fromUnderlyingCurrency(318) toCurrency(15).

field.name: UnderlyingFXRateCalc
field.comment: Specific to theUnderlyingInstrument(not inInstrument). Specified whether UnderlyingFXRate (1045) should be multiplied or divided to deriveUnderlyingCurrentValue(885).

field.name: UnderlyingPutOrCall
field.comment: Used to express option right

descr.p: TheUnderlyingInstrumentcomponent block, like theInstrumentcomponent block, contains all the fields commonly used to describe a security or instrument. In the case of theUnderlyingInstrumentcomponent block it describes an instrument which underlies the primary instrument Refer to theInstrumentcomponent block comments as this component block mirrors Instrument, except for the noted fields.

comment.p: CFTC: The calendar month exposure resulting from 1) a situation where a paired swap does not reference a DCM contract and the delivery of the instruments comprising the cash market index used for pricing does not coincide with any delivery window of a relevant DCM contract; or, 2) any exposure reported as part of a paired swap but which is not in any of the commodities (or substantially the same commodities) underlying the listed DCM contract. The price reference month should, by definition, only be reported when there is not an applicable futures equivalent month for the position being reported.

block.comment: Embedded XML document describing the underlying instrument.

field.name: UnderlyingCouponFrequencyPeriod

field.name: UnderlyingInTheMoneyCondition
field.comment: Used to express in-the-moneyness behavior in general terms for the option without the use of UnderlyingStrikePrice(316) and UnderlyingPutOrCall(315).
