field.comment: Must be set if EncodedUnderlyingFinancialInstrumentFullName(2722) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedUnderlyingFinancialInstrumentFullName
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the UnderlyingFinancialInstrumentFullName(2720) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

field.name: UnderlyingIndexCurveUnit
field.comment: Requires UnderlyingSecurityID(305) to identify the index. Requires UnderlyingIndexCurvePeriod(2724).

field.name: UnderlyingIndexCurvePeriod
field.comment: Requires UnderlyingSecurityID(305) to identify the index. Requires UnderlyingIndexCurveUnit(2723).

field.name: UnderlyingID
field.comment: Used for unique identification of the underlying instance that can subsequently be used to serve as input value for fields such as UnderlyingRefID(2841), for example, whenever a simple underlying reference is allowed or needed.

field.name: UnderlyingStipType
field.comment: Required ifNoUnderlyingStips>0

descr.p: TheUnderlyingStipulationscomponent block has the same usage as theStipulationscomponent block, but for an underlying security.

field.name: NoUndlyInstrumentParties
field.comment: Repeating group below should contain unique combinations of InstrumentPartyID, InstrumentPartyIDSource, and InstrumentPartyRole

field.name: UnderlyingInstrumentPartyID
field.comment: Used to identify the source of PartyID. Required if UnderlyingInstrumentPartyIDSource(1060) is specified. Required if NoUndlyInstrumentParties(1058) > 0.

field.name: UnderlyingInstrumentPartyIDSource
field.comment: Used to identify class source of UnderlyingInstrumentPartyID(1059) value (e.g. BIC). Required if UnderlyingInstrumentPartyID(1059) is specified. Required if NoUndlyInstrumentParties(1058) > 0.

field.name: UnderlyingInstrumentPartyRole
field.comment: Identifies the type of UnderlyingInstrumentPartyID(1059) (e.g. Executing Broker). Required if NoUndlyInstrumentParties(1058) > 0.

block.comment: Repeating group of party sub-identifiers.

descr.p: The use of this component block is restricted to instrument definition only and is not permitted to contain transactional information. Only a specified subset of party roles will be supported within the InstrumentParty block.
Possible uses of this block include identifying Listing Source information; Clearing Org information; Parent and Capital Structure information for F/Iixed Income and derivative instruments.
TheYieldDatacomponent block conveys yield information for a given Fixed Income security.

field.name: SecurityXMLLen
field.comment: Must be provided if SecurityXML field is specified and must immediately precede it.

descr.p: The SecurityXML component is used for carrying security description or definition in an XML format. See "Specifying an FpML product specification from within the FIX Instrument Block" for more information on using this component block with FpML as a guideline.

field.name: NoRateSources
field.comment: Number of rate sources being specified.

field.name: ReferencePage
field.comment: May be used when RateSource(1446) = 99 (Other).

field.name: NoTargetPartyIDs
field.comment: Repeating group below should contain unique combinations of TargetPartyID, TargetPartyIDSource, and TargetPartyRole.

field.name: TargetPartyID
field.comment: Required if NoTargetPartyIDs > 0. Used to identify PartyID targeted for the action specified in the message.

descr.p: Required if NoTargetPartyIDs > 0.
Used to identify PartyID the party targeted for the action specified in the message

field.name: TargetPartyIDSource
field.comment: Used to identify source of target party id.

descr.p: Used to identify source of target party identifier.

field.name: TargetPartyRole
field.comment: Used to identify the role of target party id

descr.p: Used to identify the role of source party ID identifier.

field.name: TargetPartyRoleQualifier
field.comment: Used to further qualify the role of target party role.

descr.p: Used to further qualify the role of the target party role.

comment.p: Repeating group of target party sub-identifiers

blockdef.name: ComplexEvents

field.name: ComplexEventType
field.comment: Required if NoComplexEvents(1483) > 0.

field.name: ComplexEventCondition
field.comment: Conditionally required when there are more than one ComplexEvents occurrences. A chain of ComplexEvents must be linked together through use of the ComplexEventCondition(1490) in which the relationship between any two events is described. For any two ComplexEvents the first occurrence will specify the ComplexEventCondition(1490) which links it with the second event.

blockdef.descr: The ComplexEvent Group is a repeating block which allows an unlimited number and types of events in the lifetime of an option to be specified.

blockdef.name: ComplexEventDates

field.name: NoComplexEventDates
field.comment: Number of complex event date occurrences for a given complex event.

field.name: ComplexEventStartDate
field.comment: Required if NoComplexEventDates(1491) > 0.

field.name: ComplexEventEndDate
field.comment: Required if NoComplexEventDates(1491) > 0.

blockdef.descr: The ComplexEventDate and ComplexEventTime components are used to constrain a complex event to a specific date range or time range. If specified the event is only effective on or within the specified dates and times.

blockdef.name: ComplexEventTimes

field.name: NoComplexEventTimes
field.comment: Number of complex event date occurrences for a given complex event.

field.name: ComplexEventStartTime
field.comment: Required if NoComplexEventTimes(1494) > 0.

field.name: ComplexEventEndTime
field.comment: Required if NoComplexEventTimes(1494) > 0.

blockdef.descr: The ComplexEventTime component is nested within the ComplexEventDate in order to further qualify any dates placed on the event and is used to specify time ranges for which a complex event is effective. It is always provided within the context of start and end dates. The time range is assumed to be in effect for the entirety of the date or date range specified.

field.name: NoContAmts
field.comment: Number of contract details in this message (number of repeating groups to follow)

field.name: ContAmtType
field.comment: Must be first field in the repeating group.

field.name: EventType
field.comment: Required if NoEvents(864) > 0.

field.name: EventDate
field.comment: Conditionally required when EventTime(1145) is specified.

field.name: EventTimeUnit
field.comment: Conditionally required when EventTimePeriod(1826) is specified.

field.name: EventTimePeriod
field.comment: Conditionally required when EventTimeUnit(1827) is specified.

field.name: EncodedEventTextLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedEventText(1579) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedEventText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the EventText(868) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

descr.p: The EvntGrp is a repeating subcomponent of the Instrument component used to specify events associated with the instrument.

The EvntGrp contains three different methods to express a "time" associated with the event using the EventDate(866) and EventTime(1145) pair of fields or the EventTimeUnit(1827) and EventTimePeriod(1826) pair of fields or EventMonthYear(2340).

The EventDate(866), and optional EventTime(1145), may be used to specify an exact date and optional time for the event. The EventTimeUnit(1827) and EventTimePeriod(1826) may be used to express a time period associated with the event, e.g. 3-month, 4-years, 2-weeks. The EventMonthYear(2340), and optional EventTime(1145), may be used to express the event as a month of year, with optional day of month or week of month.
Either EventDate(866) or EventMonthYear(2340), and the optional EventTime(1145), must be specified or EventTimeUnit(1827) and EventTimePeriod(1826) must be specified.
The EventMonthYear(2340) may be used instead of EventDate(866) when month-year, with optional day of month or week of month, is required instead of a date.

field.name: NoRelatedSym
field.comment: Specifies the number of repeating symbols (instruments) specified

field.name: NoLegs
field.comment: Number of legs

block.comment: Required if NoLegs(555) > 0

blockdef.name: MiscFeesGrp

field.name: NoMiscFees
field.comment: Required if any miscellaneous fees are reported. Indicates number of repeating entries.

field.name: MiscFeeAmt
field.comment: Required if NoMiscFees(136) > 0.

field.name: MiscFeeType
field.comment: Required if NoMiscFees(136) > 0.

blockdef.descr: The MiscFeesGrp component is used to provide details of trade and transaction fees other than commissions, e.g. regulatory, exchange, taxes, levies, markup, trade reporting, etc. In the context of ESMA RTS 27 Best Execution Reporting, it may also be used to collect and publish the nature and level of current venue fees, rebates and payouts. Use MiscFeeQualifier(2712) to communicate whether the fee affects trade economics.

field.name: NoRootPartySubIDs
field.comment: Repeating group of RootParty sub-identifiers.

field.name: RootPartySubID
field.comment: Sub-identifier (e.g. Clearing Acct for PartyID=Clearing Firm) if applicable. Required if NoRootPartySubIDs > 0.

field.name: RootPartySubIDType
field.comment: Type of Sub-identifier. Required if NoRootPartySubIDs > 0.

field.name: NoTradingSessions
field.comment: Specifies the number of repeating TradingSessionIDs

field.name: TradingSessionID
field.comment: Required if NoTradingSessions is > 0.

field.name: NoUnderlyings
field.comment: Number of underlyings

block.comment: Must be provided if NoUnderlyings (711) > 0

field.name: NoUndlyInstrumentPartySubIDs
field.comment: Number of underlyings

blockdef.name: RoutingGrp

field.name: NoRoutingIDs
field.comment: Required if any RoutingType and RoutingIDs are specified. Indicates the number within repeating group.

field.name: RoutingType
field.comment: Indicates type of RoutingID. Required if NoRoutingIDs is > 0.

field.name: RoutingID
field.comment: Identifies routing destination. Required if NoRoutingIDs is > 0.

blockdef.descr: The RoutingGrp is used to allow the application message sender to instruct the intermediary distributing the message who to further send the application message to. The original sender may also instruct who is not allowed to receive the message. When provided, the routing instructions provided in this component are effective on a message by message basis.

field.name: NoTickRules
field.comment: Number of tick rules. This block specifies the rules for determining how a security ticks, i.e. the price increments at which it can be quoted and traded, depending on the current price of the security.

field.name: StartTickPriceRange
field.comment: Required if NoTickRules(1205) > 0

field.name: EndTickPriceRange
field.comment: Ending price range for the specified tick increment.

field.name: TickIncrement
field.comment: Tick increment for stated price range. Specifies the valid price increments at which a security can be quoted and traded

field.name: TickRuleType
field.comment: Specifies the type of tick rule which is being described.

field.name: TickRuleProductComplex
field.comment: Can be used to limit tick rule to specific product suite.

descr.p: The TickRules component specifies the rules for determining how a security ticks, i.e. the price increments at which it can be quoted, traded, and for certain cases settled, depending on the current price of the security

field.name: PriceLimitType
field.comment: Describes the how the price limits are expressed

field.name: LowLimitPrice
field.comment: Allowable low limit price for the trading day. A key parameter in validating order price. Used as the lower band for validating order prices. Orders submitted with prices below the lower limit will be rejected

field.name: HighLimitPrice
field.comment: Allowable high limit price for the trading day. A key parameter in validating order price. Used as the upper band for validating order prices. Orders submitted with prices above the upper limit will be rejected

field.name: TradingReferencePrice
field.comment: Reference price for the current trading price range usually representing the mid price between the HighLimitPrice and LowLimitPrice. The value may be the settlement price or closing price of the prior trading day.

blockdef.name: MarketDataFeedTypes

field.name: NoMDFeedTypes
field.comment: The number of feed types and corresponding book depths associated with a security

field.name: MDFeedType
field.comment: Required if NoMDFeedTypes(1141) > 0.

field.name: MarketDepth
field.comment: Specifies the depth of book (or levels of market depth) for the feed type.

field.name: MarketDepthTimeInterval
field.comment: Conditionally required when MarketDepthTimeIntervalUnit(2564) is specified.

field.name: MarketDepthTimeIntervalUnit
field.comment: Conditionally required when MarketDataTimeInterval(2563) is specified.

field.name: MDRecoveryTimeInterval
field.comment: Conditionally required when MDRecoveryTimeIntervalUnit(2566) is specified.

field.name: MDRecoveryTimeIntervalUnit
field.comment: Conditionally required when MDRecoveryTimeInterval(2565) is specified.

blockdef.descr: The MarketDataFeedTypes component is used to specify the different available feed types and sub-types, and additional market data feed related attributes, such as the market depth of the specified feed type.

field.name: NoLotTypeRules
field.comment: Number of Lot Types

field.name: LotType
field.comment: Defines the lot type assigned to the order. Use as an alternate to RoundLot. To be used with MinLotSize. LotType + MinLotSize ( max is next level minus 1)

field.name: MinLotSize
field.comment: Minimum lot size allowed based on lot type specified in LotType

blockdef.name: MatchRules

field.name: NoMatchRules
field.comment: Number of match rules

field.name: MatchAlgorithm
field.comment: Required if NoMatchRules(1235) > 0.

field.name: MatchRuleProductComplex
field.comment: Can be used to limit match rule to specific product suite.

field.name: CustomerPriority
field.comment: Can be used to give customer orders priority for the given matching algorithm.

blockdef.descr: The MatchRules component is used to specify the details of order matching rules for specified product group or complex.

field.name: NoExecInstRules
field.comment: Number of execution instructions

field.name: ExecInstValue
field.comment: Indicates execution instructions that are valid for the specified market segment

field.name: NoTimeInForceRules
field.comment: Number of time in force techniques

field.name: TimeInForce
field.comment: Indicates time in force techniques that are valid for the specified market segment

field.name: NoOrdTypeRules
field.comment: Number of order types

field.name: OrdType
field.comment: Indicates order types that are valid for the specified market segment.

block.comment: Specifies the order types that are valid for trading. The scope of the rule is determined by the context in which the component is used. In this case, the scope is trading session.
Specifies the time in force rules that are valid for trading. The scope of the rule is determined by the context in which the component is used. In this case, the scope is trading session.
Specifies the execution instructions that are valid for trading. The scope of the rule is determined by the context in which the component is used. In this case, the scope is trading session.
Specifies the matching rules that are valid for trading. The scope of the rule is determined by the context in which the component is used. In this case, the scope is trading session.
Specifies the market data feed types that are valid for trading. The scope of the rule is determined by the context in which the component is used. In this case, the scope is trading session.

Specifies the auction order types that are valid for trading on the identified. The scope of the rule is determined by the context in which the component is used. In this case, the scope is trading session.

blockdef.name: BaseTradingRules

block.comment: Specifies price tick rules for the security.
Specifies the lot types that are valid for trading.
Specifies the price limits that are valid for trading.

field.name: MaxTradeVol
field.comment: For listed derivatives this indicates the minimum quantity necessary for an order or trade to qualify as a block trade.

field.name: MultilegModel
field.comment: Used for multileg security only.

field.name: MultilegPriceMethod
field.comment: Used for multileg security only.

field.name: PriceType
field.comment: Defines the default price type used for trading.

block.comment: Specifies the valid price range tables for trading.
Specifies the valid quote sizes for trading.

field.name: FastMarketPercentage
field.comment: Can be used as a factor to be applied to other base trading rules during a fast market, e.g. to widen price or size ranges by the specified percentage factor.

blockdef.descr: Trading rules that are applicable to a market, market segment or individual security independent of a trading session.

field.name: NoLegs
field.comment: Required for multileg IOIs

block.comment: Required for multileg IOIs. For Swaps one leg is Buy and other leg is Sell

field.name: LegIOIQty
field.comment: Required for multileg IOIs

field.name: NoIOIQualifiers
field.comment: Required if any IOIQualifiers are specified. Indicates the number of repeating IOIQualifiers.

field.name: IOIQualifier
field.comment: Required if NoIOIQualifiers > 0

field.name: NoLinesOfText
field.comment: Specifies the number of repeating lines of text specified

field.name: Text
field.comment: Repeating field, number of instances defined in LinesOfText

field.name: EncodedTextLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedText field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Text field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field.

field.name: NoNewsRefIDs
field.comment: Number of news item references

field.name: NewsRefID
field.comment: Required if NoNewsRefIDs(1475) > 0. News item being referenced.

field.name: NewsRefType
field.comment: Type of reference.

block.comment: Required if NoLegs (555) > 0.

field.name: LegQty
field.comment: Deprecated in FIX 5.0 SP1. The LegQty(687) field is deprecated. The use of LegOrderQty(685) is recommended instead

field.name: LegOrderQty
field.comment: Quantity ordered for this leg as provided during order entry.

field.name: LegPriceType
field.comment: Code to represent type of price presented in LegBidPx(681) and LegOfferPx(684). Conditionally required when LegBidPx(681) or PegOfferPx(684) is present.

field.name: LegRefID
field.comment: Use of LegRefID(654) in this component is deprecated. Recommend the use of LegID(1788) in the InstrumentLeg component.

block.comment: Required if NoLegs (555) > 0.

field.name: LegQty
field.comment: Deprecated in FIX 5.0 SP1. The LegQty(687) field is deprecated. The use of LegOrderQty(685) is recommended instead

field.name: LegOrderQty
field.comment: Quantity ordered for this leg as provided during order entry.

field.name: NoQuoteEntries
field.comment: The number of securities (instruments) whose quotes are to be canceled Not required when cancelling all quotes.

block.comment: Insert here the set of "Instrument" (symbology) fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages".
Insert here the set of "FinancingDetails" (symbology) fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages"

field.name: NoQuoteEntries
field.comment: The number of quotes for this Symbol (QuoteSet) that follow in this message.

field.name: QuoteEntryID
field.comment: Uniquely identifies the quote across the complete set of all quotes for a given quote provider. First field in repeating group. Required if NoQuoteEntries > 0.

block.comment: Insert here the set of "Instrument" (symbology) fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages"

field.name: BidPx
field.comment: If F/X quote, should be the "all-in" rate (spot rate adjusted for forward points). Note that either BidPx, OfferPx or both must be specified.

field.name: OfferPx
field.comment: If F/X quote, should be the "all-in" rate (spot rate adjusted for forward points). Note that either BidPx, OfferPx or both must be specified.

field.name: BidSpotRate
field.comment: May be applicable for F/X quotes

field.name: OfferSpotRate
field.comment: May be applicable for F/X quotes

field.name: BidForwardPoints
field.comment: May be applicable for F/X quotes

field.name: OfferForwardPoints
field.comment: May be applicable for F/X quotes

field.name: SettlDate
field.comment: Can be used with forex quotes to specify a specific "value date"

field.name: OrdType
field.comment: Can be used to specify the type of order the quote is for

field.name: SettlDate2
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0) Can be used with OrdType = "Forex - Swap" to specify the "value date" for the future portion of a F/X swap.

field.name: OrderQty2
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0) Can be used with OrdType = "Forex - Swap" to specify the order quantity for the future portion of a F/X swap.

field.name: BidForwardPoints2
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0)Bid F/X forward points of the future portion of a F/X swap quote added to spot rate. May be a negative value

field.name: OfferForwardPoints2
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0)Offer F/X forward points of the future portion of a F/X swap quote added to spot rate. May be a negative value

field.name: Currency
field.comment: Can be used to specify the currency of the quoted price.

field.name: QuoteEntryRejectReason
field.comment: Reason Quote Entry was rejected.

field.name: NoQuoteEntries
field.comment: The number of quotes for this Symbol (instrument) (QuoteSet) that follow in this message.

field.name: QuoteEntryID
field.comment: Uniquely identifies the quote across the complete set of all quotes for a given quote provider.

field.comment: If F/X quote, should be the "all-in" rate (spot rate adjusted for forward points). Note that either BidPx, OfferPx or both must be specified.

field.name: OfferPx
field.comment: If F/X quote, should be the "all-in" rate (spot rate adjusted for forward points). Note that either BidPx, OfferPx or both must be specified.

field.comment: May be applicable for F/X quotes

field.name: OfferSpotRate
field.comment: May be applicable for F/X quotes

field.name: BidForwardPoints
field.comment: May be applicable for F/X quotes

field.name: OfferForwardPoints
field.comment: May be applicable for F/X quotes

field.name: OrdType
field.comment: Can be used to specify the type of order the quote is for

field.name: SettlDate2
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0)Can be used with OrdType = "Forex - Swap" to specify the "value date" for the future portion of a F/X swap.

field.name: OrderQty2
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0)Can be used with OrdType = "Forex - Swap" to specify the order quantity for the future portion of a F/X swap.

field.name: BidForwardPoints2
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0)Bid F/X forward points of the future portion of a F/X swap quote added to spot rate. May be a negative value.

field.name: OfferForwardPoints2

field.name: Currency
field.comment: Can be used to specify the currency of the quoted price.

field.name: QuoteQualifier
field.comment: Required if NoQuoteQualifiers > 0

field.name: NoRelatedSym
field.comment: Number of related symbols (instruments) in Request

block.comment: Insert here the set of "Instrument" (symbology) fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages"
Insert here the set of "FinancingDetails" (symbology) fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages"

field.name: PrevClosePx
field.comment: Useful for verifying security identification

field.name: QuoteRequestType
field.comment: Indicates the type of Quote Request (e.g. Manual vs. Automatic) being generated.

field.name: QuoteType
field.comment: Type of quote being requested from counterparty or market (e.g. Indicative, Firm, or Restricted Tradeable) Valid values used by FX in the request: 0 = Indicative, 1 = Tradeable; Absence implies a request for an indicative quote.

field.name: Side
field.comment: If OrdType = "Forex - Swap", should be the side of the future portion of a F/X swap. The absence of a side implies that a two-sided quote is being requested. For single instrument use. FX values, 1 = Buy, 2 = Sell; This is from the perspective of the Initiator. If absent then a two-sided quote is being requested for spot or forward.

field.name: QtyType
field.comment: Type of quantity specified in a quantity field. For FX, if used, should be "0".

block.comment: Conditionally required for single instrument quoting when applicable for the type of instrument.

field.name: SettlType
field.comment: For NDFs either SettlType (specifying the tenor) or SettlDate must be specified.

field.name: SettlDate
field.comment: Can be used (e.g. with forex quotes) to specify the desired "value date". For NDFs either SettlType (specifying the tenor) or SettlDate must be specified.

field.name: SettlDate2
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0)Can be used with OrdType = "Forex - Swap" to specify the "value date" for the future portion of a F/X swap.

field.name: OrderQty2
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0)Can be used with OrdType = "Forex - Swap" to specify the order quantity for the future portion of a F/X swap.

field.name: Currency
field.comment: Can be used to specify the desired currency of the quoted price. May differ from the 'normal' trading currency of the instrument being quote requested.

field.name: SettlCurrency
field.comment: Required for NDFs to specify the settlement currency (fixing currency).

block.comment: Insert here the set of "Stipulations" (repeating group of Fixed Income stipulations) fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages"

field.name: QuotePriceType
field.comment: Initiator can specify the price type the quote needs to be quoted at. If not specified, the Respondent has option to specify how quote is quoted.

field.name: OrdType
field.comment: Can be used to specify the type of order the quote request is for

field.name: ValidUntilTime
field.comment: Used by the quote initiator to indicate the period of time the resulting Quote must be valid until

field.name: ExpireTime
field.comment: The time when the request for quote or negotiation dialog will expire.

field.name: TransactTime
field.comment: Time transaction was entered

block.comment: Insert here the set of "SpreadOrBenchmarkCurveData" (Fixed Income spread or benchmark curve) fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages"

field.name: Price
field.comment: Quoted or target price

field.name: Price2
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0)Can be used with OrdType = "Forex - Swap" to specify the Quoted or target price for the future portion of a F/X swap.

block.comment: Insert here the set of "YieldData" (yield-related) fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages".

field.name: QuoteID
field.comment: Can be used when QuoteRequestType(303) = 3(Confirm quote)

field.name: SecondaryQuoteID
field.comment: Can be used when QuoteRequestType(303) = 3(Confirm quote)

field.name: ExposureDuration
field.comment: The(minimum or suggested) period of time a quoted price is to be tradable before it becomes indicative.(i.e. quoted price becomes off-the-wire).

field.name: MidPx
field.comment: For OTC swaps, may be used to provide the estimated midmarket-mark.

field.name: StrikeTime
field.comment: Conditionally required when QuoteQual(695) = d (Deferred spot) is specified.

field.name: TradeContinuation
field.comment: Maybe used to indicate quote/negotiation is for the specified post-execution trade continuation or lifecycle event.

field.name: EncodedTradeContinuationTextLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedTradeContinuationText(2371) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedTradeContinuationText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the TradeContinuationText(2374) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

field.name: TrdType
field.comment: May be used by SEFs (Swap Execution Facilities) to indicate a block swap transaction

block.comment: Required if NoLegs (555) > 0.

field.name: LegQty
field.comment: Deprecated in FIX 5.0 SP1. The LegQty(687) field is deprecated. The use of LegOrderQty(685) is recommended instead

field.name: LegOrderQty
field.comment: Quantity ordered for this leg as provided during order entry.

field.name: LegRefID
field.comment: Use of LegRefID(654) in this component is deprecated. Recommend the use of LegID(1788) in the InstrumentLeg component.

field.name: LegMidPx
field.comment: For OTC swaps, may be used to provide the estimated midmarket-mark.

field.name: NoRelatedSym
field.comment: Number of related symbols (instruments) in Request

field.comment: Total number of quotes canceled for the QuoteSet across all messages.

field.name: TotNoAccQuotes
field.comment: Total number of quotes accepted for the QuoteSet across all messages.

field.name: TotNoRejQuotes
field.comment: Total number of quotes rejected for the QuoteSet across all messages.

field.comment: Indicates whether this is the last fragment in a sequence of message fragments. Only required where message has been fragmented.

field.comment: The number of sets of quotes in the message

field.name: QuoteSetID
field.comment: Sequential number for the QuoteSet. For a given QuoteID - assumed to start at 1. Must be the first field in the repeating group.

block.comment: Insert here the set of "Instrument" (symbology) fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages"

field.name: SettlType
field.comment: For NDFs either SettlType (specifying the tenor) or SettlDate must be specified.

field.name: SettlDate
field.comment: SettlType (specifying the tenor) or SettlDate must be specified.

field.name: MDEntrySize
field.comment: Quantity or volume represented by the Market Data Entry. In the context of the Market Data Request this allows the Initiator to indicate the quantity of the market data request. Specific to FX this field indicates the ceiling amount the customer is seeking prices for.

field.name: NoMDEntries
field.comment: Number of entries following.

field.name: MDEntryType
field.comment: Must be the first field in this repeating group.

field.name: MDEntryID
field.comment: Conditionally required when maintaining an order-depth book (AggregatedBook (266) is "N"). Allows subsequent Incremental changes to be applied using MDEntryID.

field.name: MDEntryPx
field.comment: Conditionally required if MDEntryType is not 'A' (Imbalance), 'B' (Trade Volume), or 'C' (Open Interest). Conditionally required when MDEntryType = 'Q' (Auction clearing price).

field.name: OrdType
field.comment: Used to support market mechanism type; limit order, market order, committed principal order

field.name: Currency
field.comment: Can be used to specify the currency of the quoted price.

field.name: SettlCurrency
field.comment: Required for NDFs to specify the settlement currency (fixing currency).

field.name: MDEntrySize
field.comment: Conditionally required if MDEntryType = '0'(Bid), '1' (Offer), '2'(Trade), 'B'(Trade Volume), or 'C'(Open Interest).

field.name: LotType
field.comment: Can be used to specify the lot type of the quoted size in order depth books.

field.name: MDMkt
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0)Market posting quote / trade. Valid values: See Volume 6: Appendix 6-C

field.name: QuoteCondition
field.comment: Space-delimited list of conditions describing a quote.

field.name: TradeCondition
field.comment: Space-delimited list of conditions describing a trade

field.name: MDEntryOriginator
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0)

field.name: LocationID
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0)

field.name: DeskID
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0)

field.name: OpenCloseSettlFlag
field.comment: Used if MDEntryType = Opening Price(4), Closing Price(5), or Settlement Price(6).

field.name: TimeInForce
field.comment: For optional use when this Bid or Offer represents an order

field.name: ExpireDate
field.comment: For optional use when this Bid or Offer represents an order. ExpireDate and ExpireTime cannot both be specified in one Market Data Entry.

field.name: ExpireTime
field.comment: For optional use when this Bid or Offer represents an order. ExpireDate and ExpireTime cannot both be specified in one Market Data Entry.

field.name: MinQty
field.comment: For optional use when this Bid or Offer represents an order

field.name: ExecInst
field.comment: Can contain multiple instructions, space delimited.

field.name: OrderID
field.comment: For optional use when this Bid, Offer, or Trade represents an order

field.name: SecondaryOrderID
field.comment: For optional use to support Hit/Take (selecting a specific order from the feed) without disclosing a private order id.

field.name: QuoteEntryID
field.comment: For optional use when this Bid, Offer, or Trade represents a quote

field.name: MDEntryBuyer
field.comment: For optional use in reporting Trades

field.name: MDEntrySeller
field.comment: For optional use in reporting Trades

field.name: NumberOfOrders
field.comment: In an Aggregated Book, used to show how many individual orders make up an MDEntry

field.name: MDEntryPositionNo
field.comment: Display position of a bid or offer, numbered from most competitive to least competitive, per market side, beginning with 1

field.name: TrdType
field.comment: Specifies trade type when a trade is being reported. For optional use in reporting trades.

field.name: Text
field.comment: Text to describe the Market Data Entry. Part of repeating group.

field.name: EncodedTextLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedText field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Text field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field.

field.name: MDPriceLevel
field.comment: Display position of a bid or offer, numbered from most competitive to least competitive, per market side, beginning with 1

field.name: OrderCapacity
field.comment: Designates the capacity of the firm placing the order

field.name: HighPx
field.comment: Used to report high price in association with trade, bid or ask rather than a separate entity

field.name: LowPx
field.comment: Used to report low price in association with trade, bid or ask rather than a separate entitty

field.name: FirstPx
field.comment: Indicates the first price of a trading session; can be a bid, ask, or trade price.

field.name: LastPx
field.comment: Indicates the last price of a trading session; can be a bid, ask, or trade price.

field.name: TradeVolume
field.comment: Used to report trade volume in association with trade, bid or ask rather than a separate entity

field.name: SettlDate
field.comment: Indicates date on which instrument will settle.For NDFs required for specifying the "value date".

field.name: RptSeq
field.comment: Used to identify the sequence number within a feed type

field.name: ExposureDuration
field.comment: Conditionally required when TimeInForce(59) = 10 (Good for Time)

field.name: TrdSubType
field.comment: For optional use in reporting trades.

field.name: MatchType
field.comment: For optional use in reporting trades.

field.name: OrderCategory
field.comment: Use for MMT negotiated transaction indicator

field.name: TradePublishIndicator
field.comment: For optional use in reporting trades.

field.name: NumberOfBuyOrders
field.comment: For optional use in reporting trades

field.name: NumberOfSellOrders
field.comment: For optional use in reporting trades

block.comment: For optional use when reporting trades. Lists trades related to the current market data entry, e.g. leg trades of a multi-leg trade

field.name: TradeID
field.comment: For optional use in reporting Trades.

field.name: StrategyLinkID
field.comment: For optional use in reporting Trades. May be used to link together trades that are reported separately but are part of the same overall trade, e.g. spread trade and their constituent trades.

field.name: LegRefID
field.comment: May be specified for an MDEntryType(269)=2 (Trade) entry to indicate that MDEntryPx(270), PriceType(423) and MDEntrySize(271) apply to the instance of the InstrmtLegGrp component with matching LegID(1788).

field.name: RegulatoryReportType
field.comment: Used only when reporting a trade (MDEntryType(269)=2 (Trade)) that is a regulatory trade report.

field.name: NoMDEntries
field.comment: Number of entries following.

field.name: MDUpdateAction
field.comment: Must be first field in this repeating group.

field.name: DeleteReason
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0)If MDUpdateAction = Delete(2), can be used to specify a reason for the deletion.

field.name: MDSubBookType
field.comment: Can be used to define a subordinate book.

field.name: MarketDepth
field.comment: Can be used to define the current depth of the book.

field.name: MDEntryType
field.comment: Conditionally required if MDUpdateAction = New(0). Cannot be changed.

field.name: MDEntryID
field.comment: If specified, must be unique among currently active entries if MDUpdateAction = New (0), must be the same as a previous MDEntryID if MDUpdateAction = Delete (2), and must be the same as a previous MDEntryID if MDUpdateAction = Change (1) and MDEntryRefID is not specified, or must be unique among currently active entries if MDUpdateAction = Change(1) and MDEntryRefID is specified.

field.name: MDEntryRefID
field.comment: If MDUpdateAction = New(0), for the first Market Data Entry in a message, either this field or a Symbol must be specified. If MDUpdateAction = Change(1), this must refer to a previous MDEntryID.

field.name: MDEntryPx
field.comment: Conditionally required when MDUpdateAction = New(0) and MDEntryType is not Imbalance(A) ), Trade Volume (B), or Open Interest (C). Conditionally required when MDEntryType = "Auction Clearing Price"

field.name: OrdType
field.comment: Used to support market mechanism type; limit order, market order, committed principal order

field.name: Currency
field.comment: Can be used to specify the currency of the quoted price.

field.name: SettlCurrency
field.comment: Required for NDFs to specify the settlement currency (fixing currency).

field.name: MDEntrySize
field.comment: Conditionally required when MDUpdateAction = New(0) and MDEntryType = Bid(0), Offer(1), Trade(2) , Trade Volume(B), or Open Interest(C).

field.name: LotType
field.comment: Can be used to specify the lot type of the quoted size in order depth books.

field.name: MDMkt
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0)Market posting quote / trade. Valid values: See Volume 6: Appendix 6-C

field.name: QuoteCondition
field.comment: Space-delimited list of conditions describing a quote.

field.name: TradeCondition
field.comment: Space-delimited list of conditions describing a trade

field.name: TrdType
field.comment: Use for MMT transaction category. Conditionally required in all MMT-supporting messages. For optional use in reporting Trades

field.name: MatchType
field.comment: For optional use in reporting Trades

field.name: MDEntryOriginator
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0)

field.name: LocationID
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0)

field.name: DeskID
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0)

field.name: OpenCloseSettlFlag
field.comment: Used if MDEntryType = Opening Price(4), Closing Price(5), or Settlement Price(6).

field.name: TimeInForce
field.comment: For optional use when this Bid or Offer represents an order

field.name: ExpireDate
field.comment: For optional use when this Bid or Offer represents an order. ExpireDate and ExpireTime cannot both be specified in one Market Data Entry.

field.name: ExpireTime
field.comment: For optional use when this Bid or Offer represents an order. ExpireDate and ExpireTime cannot both be specified in one Market Data Entry.

field.name: MinQty
field.comment: For optional use when this Bid or Offer represents an order

field.name: ExecInst
field.comment: Can contain multiple instructions, space delimited.

field.name: OrderID
field.comment: For optional use when this Bid, Offer, or Trade represents an order

field.name: SecondaryOrderID
field.comment: For optional use to support Hit/Take (selecting a specific order from the feed) without disclosing a private order id.

field.name: QuoteEntryID
field.comment: For optional use when this Bid, Offer, or Trade represents a quote

field.name: TradeID
field.comment: For optional use in reporting Trades

field.name: MDEntryBuyer
field.comment: For optional use in reporting Trades

field.name: MDEntrySeller
field.comment: For optional use in reporting Trades

field.name: NumberOfOrders
field.comment: In an Aggregated Book, used to show how many individual orders make up an MDEntry

field.name: MDEntryPositionNo
field.comment: Display position of a bid or offer, numbered from most competitive to least competitive, per market side, beginning with 1

field.name: Text
field.comment: Text to describe the Market Data Entry. Part of repeating group.

field.name: EncodedTextLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedText field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Text field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field.

field.name: LastPx
field.comment: Indicates the last price of a trading session; can be a bid, ask, or a trade price.

field.name: SettlDate
field.comment: Indicates date on which instrument will settle. For NDFs required for specifying the "value date".

field.name: TransBkdTime
field.comment: For optional use in reporting Trades. Used to specify the time of trade agreement for privately negotiated trades.

field.name: TransactTime
field.comment: For optional use in reporting Trades. Used to specify the time of matching.

field.name: RptSeq
field.comment: Allows sequence number to be specified within a feed type

field.name: ExposureDuration
field.comment: Conditionally required when TimeInForce(59) = 10 (Good for Time)

block.comment: Use for MMT EX/CUM dividend indicator

field.name: TrdSubType
field.comment: Use for MMT crossing trade indicator

field.name: OrderCategory
field.comment: Use for MMT negotiated transaction indicator

field.name: TradePublishIndicator
field.comment: Use for MMT publication mode

block.comment: For optional use when reporting trades. Lists trades related to the current market data entry, e.g. leg trades of a multi-leg trade

field.name: NumberOfBuyOrders
field.comment: For optional use in reporting trades

field.name: NumberOfSellOrders
field.comment: For optional use in reporting trades

field.name: StrategyLinkID
field.comment: For optional use in reporting Trades. May be used to link together trades that are reported separately but are part of the same overall trade, e.g. spread trade and their constituent trades.

field.name: RegulatoryReportType
field.comment: Used only when reporting a trade (MDEntryType(269)=2 (Trade)) that is a regulatory trade report.

field.name: NoMDEntryTypes
field.comment: Number of MDEntryType fields requested.

field.name: MDEntryType
field.comment: Must be the first field in this repeating group. This is a list of all the types of Market Data Entries that the firm requesting the Market Data is interested in receiving.

field.name: AltMDSourceID
field.comment: Alternative Market Data Source

field.name: NoOfSecSizes
field.comment: Number of entries following. Conditionally required when MDUpdateAction = New(0) and MDEntryType = Bid(0) or Offer(1).

field.name: MDSecSizeType
field.comment: Defines the type of secondary size specified in MDSecSize(1179). Must be first field in this repeating group

field.name: NoStatsIndicators
field.comment: Number of statistics indicators

field.name: StatsType
field.comment: Indicates that the MD Entry is eligible for inclusion in the type of statistic specified by the StatsType. Must be provided if NoStatsIndicators greater than 0.

field.name: NoAsgnReqs
field.comment: Stream Assignment Requests.

field.name: NoAsgnReqs
field.comment: Stream Assignment Requests.

field.name: TradingSessionID
field.comment: Identifier for Trading Session

field.name: SecurityExchange
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0SP1)

field.name: MarketID
field.comment: Market for which Trading Session applies

field.name: MarketSegmentID
field.comment: Market Segment for which Trading Session applies

field.name: TradSesMethod
field.comment: Method of Trading

field.name: TradSesMode
field.comment: Trading Session Mode

field.name: UnsolicitedIndicator
field.comment: "Y" if message is sent unsolicited as a result of a previous subscription request.

field.name: TradSesStatus
field.comment: State of trading session.

field.name: TradSesStatusRejReason
field.comment: Used with TradSesStatus = "Request Rejected"

field.name: TradSesStartTime
field.comment: Starting time of trading session

field.name: TradSesOpenTime
field.comment: Time of the opening of the trading session

field.name: TradSesPreCloseTime
field.comment: Time of pre-close of trading session

field.name: TradSesCloseTime
field.comment: Closing time of trading session

field.name: TradSesEndTime
field.comment: End time of trading session

field.comment: Number of legs that make up the Security

field.name: DerivativeEventType
field.comment: Indicates type of event describing security.

field.name: DerivativeEventTime
field.comment: Specific time of event. To be used in combination with EventDate.

field.name: ListUpdateAction
field.comment: If provided, then Instrument occurrence has explicitly changed.

field.name: Text
field.comment: Comment, instructions, or other identifying information.

field.name: EncodedTextLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedText field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Text field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field.

field.name: NoStrikeRules
field.comment: Number of strike rule entries. This block specifies the rules for determining how new strikes should be listed within the stated price range of the underlying instrument.

field.name: StrikeRuleID
field.comment: Allows strike rule to be referenced via an identifier so that rules do not need to be explicitly enumerated.

field.name: StartStrikePxRange
field.comment: Starting price for the range to which the StrikeIncrement applies. Price refers to the price of the underlying.

field.name: EndStrikePxRange
field.comment: Ending price of the range to which the StrikeIncrement applies. Price refers to the price of the underlying.

field.name: StrikeIncrement
field.comment: Value by which strike price should be incremented within the specified price.

field.name: StrikeExerciseStyle
field.comment: Enumeration that represents the exercise style for a class of options. Same values as ExerciseStyle.

block.comment: Describes the maturity rules for a given set of strikes as defined by StrikeRules.

field.name: NoMaturityRules
field.comment: Number of maturity rule entries. This block specifies the rules for determining how new strikes should be listed within the stated price range of the underlying instrument.

field.name: MaturityRuleID
field.comment: Allows maturity rule to be referenced via an identifier so that rules do not need to be explicitly enumerated.

field.name: MaturityMonthYearFormat
field.comment: Format used to generate the MMY for each option contract:

field.name: MaturityMonthYearIncrementUnits
field.comment: enumeration specifying the increment unit:.

field.name: StartMaturityMonthYear
field.comment: Starting maturity for the range to which the StrikeIncrement applies. Price refers to the price of the underlying.

field.name: EndMaturityMonthYear
field.comment: Ending maturity monthy year to which the StrikeIncrement applies. Price refers to the price of the underlying.

field.name: MaturityMonthYearIncrement
field.comment: Value by which maturity month year should be incremented within the specified price range.

field.name: NoTradingSessionRules
field.comment: Allows trading rules to be expressed by trading session.

field.name: TradingSessionID
field.comment: Identifier for the trading session. Must be provided if NoTradingSessions >0. Set to [N/A] if values are not specific to trading session.

field.name: TradingSessionSubID
field.comment: Identifier for the trading session. Set to [N/A] if values are not specific to trading session sub id.

block.comment: Contains trading rules specified at the trading session level.

field.name: NoMarketSegments
field.comment: Number of Market Segments on which a security may trade..

field.name: MarketID
field.comment: Identifies the market which lists and trades the instrument.

field.name: MarketSegmentID
field.comment: Identifies the segment of the market to which the specify trading rules and listing rules apply.

block.comment: This block specifies the rules for determining how new strikes should be listed within the stated price range of the underlying instrument.
Optional block which can be used to to summarize common attributes shared across a set of option instruments which belong to the same series.
Additional attribution for the instrument series
Security trading and listing attributes for the series level

field.name: NestedInstrAttribType
field.comment: Code to represent the type of instrument attribute.

field.name: NestedInstrAttribValue
field.comment: Attribute value appropriate to the NestedInstrAttribType field.

field.name: DerivativeSymbol
field.comment: Common, "human understood" representation of the security. SecurityID value can be specified if no symbol exists (e.g. non-exchange traded Collective Investment Vehicles). Use "[N/A]" for products which do not have a symbol.

field.name: DerivativeSymbolSfx
field.comment: Used in Fixed Income with a value of " WI" to indicate " When Issued" for a security to be reissued under an old CUSIP or ISIN or with a value of " CD " to indicate a EUCP with lump-sum interest rather than discount price.

field.name: DerivativeSecurityID
field.comment: Takes precedence in identifying security to counterparty over SecurityAltID block. Requires SecurityIDSource if specified.

field.name: DerivativeSecurityIDSource
field.comment: Required if SecurityID is specified.

field.name: DerivativeProduct
field.comment: Indicates the type of product the security is associated with (high-level category).

field.name: DerivativeProductComplex
field.comment: Identifies an entire suite of products for a given market. In Futures this may be "interest rates", "agricultural", "equity indexes", etc

field.name: DerivFlexProductEligibilityIndicator
field.comment: Used to indicate if a product or group of product supports the creation of flexible securities

field.name: DerivativeSecurityGroup
field.comment: An exchange specific name assigned to a group of related securities which may be concurrently affected by market events and actions.

field.name: DerivativeCFICode
field.comment: Indicates the type of security using ISO 10962 standard, Classification of Financial Instruments (CFI code) values. It is recommended that CFICode be used instead of SecurityType for non-Fixed Income instruments.

field.name: DerivativeSecurityType
field.comment: It is recommended that CFICode be used instead of SecurityType for non-Fixed Income instruments. Required for Fixed Income. Refer to Volume 7 - Fixed Income Futures and Options should be specified using the CFICode[461] field instead of SecurityType[167] (Refer to Volume 7 - Recommendations and Guidelines for Futures and Options Markets.)

field.name: DerivativeSecuritySubType
field.comment: Sub-type qualification/identification of the SecurityType (e.g. for SecurityType=MLEG). If specified, SecurityType is required.

field.name: DerivativeMaturityMonthYear
field.comment: Specifies the month and year of maturity. Applicable for standardized derivatives which are typically only referenced by month and year (e.g. S and P futures). Note MaturityDate (a full date) can also be specified.

field.name: DerivativeMaturityDate
field.comment: Specifies date of maturity (a full date). Note that standardized derivatives which are typically only referenced by month and year (e.g. S and P futures).may use MaturityMonthYear and or this field. When using MaturityMonthYear, it is recommended that markets and sell sides report the MaturityDate on all outbound messages as a means of data enrichment.

field.name: DerivativeSettleOnOpenFlag
field.comment: Indicator to determine if Instrument is Settle on Open.

field.name: DerivativeSecurityStatus
field.comment: Gives the current state of the instrument.

field.name: DerivativeIssueDate
field.comment: Date instrument was issued. For Fixed Income IOIs for new issues, specifies the issue date.

field.name: DerivativeInstrRegistry
field.comment: The location at which records of ownership are maintained for this instrument, and at which ownership changes must be recorded. Can be used in conjunction with ISIN to address ISIN uniqueness issues.

field.name: DerivativeCountryOfIssue
field.comment: ISO Country code of instrument issue (e.g. the country portion typically used in ISIN). Can be used in conjunction with non-ISIN SecurityID (e.g. CUSIP for Municipal Bonds without ISIN) to provide uniqueness.

field.name: DerivativeStateOrProvinceOfIssue
field.comment: A two-character state or province abbreviation.

field.name: DerivativeLocaleOfIssue
field.comment: The three-character IATA code for a locale (e.g. airport code for Municipal Bonds).

field.name: DerivativeStrikePrice
field.comment: Used for derivatives, such as options and covered warrants.

field.name: DerivativeStrikeCurrency
field.comment: Used for derivatives

field.name: DerivativeStrikeMultiplier
field.comment: Used for derivatives. Multiplier applied to the strike price for the purpose of calculating the settlement value.

field.name: DerivativeStrikeValue
field.comment: Used for derivatives. The number of shares/units for the financial instrument involved in the option trade.

field.name: DerivativeOptAttribute
field.comment: Used for derivatives, such as options and covered warrants to indicate a versioning of the contract when required due to corporate actions to the underlying. Should not be used to indicate type of option - use the CFICode[461] for this purpose.

field.name: DerivativeContractMultiplier
field.comment: For Fixed Income, Convertible Bonds, Derivatives, etc. Note: If used, quantities should be expressed in the "nominal" (e.g. contracts vs. shares) amount.

field.name: DerivativeMinPriceIncrement
field.comment: Minimum price increment for the instrument. Could also be used to represent tick value.

field.name: DerivativeMinPriceIncrementAmount
field.comment: Minimum price increment amount associated with the MinPriceIncrement [969]. For listed derivatives, the value can be calculated by multiplying MinPriceIncrement by ContractValueFactor [231].

field.name: DerivativeSettlMethod
field.comment: Settlement method for a contract. Can be used as an alternative to CFI Code value.

field.name: DerivativePriceQuoteMethod
field.comment: Method for price quotation.

field.name: DerivativeValuationMethod
field.comment: For futures, indicates type of valuation method applied.

field.name: DerivativeListMethod
field.comment: Indicates whether strikes are pre-listed only or can also be defined via user request.

field.name: DerivativeCapPrice
field.comment: Used to express the ceiling price of a capped call.

field.name: DerivativeFloorPrice
field.comment: Used to express the floor price of a capped put.

field.name: DerivativeExerciseStyle
field.comment: Type of exercise of a derivatives security.

field.name: DerivativeOptPayAmount
field.comment: Cash amount indicating the pay out associated with an option. For binary options this is a fixed amount.

field.name: DerivativeTimeUnit
field.comment: Used to indicate a time unit for the contract (e.g., days, weeks, months, etc.).

field.name: DerivativeSecurityExchange
field.comment: Can be used to identify the security.

field.name: DerivativePositionLimit
field.comment: Position Limit for the instrument.

field.name: DerivativeNTPositionLimit
field.comment: Near-term Position Limit for the instrument.

field.name: DerivativeEncodedIssuerLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedIssuer field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: DerivativeEncodedIssuer
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Issuer field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field.

field.name: DerivativeEncodedSecurityDescLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedSecurityDesc field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: DerivativeEncodedSecurityDesc
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the SecurityDesc field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field.

block.comment: Embedded XML document describing security.

field.name: DerivativeContractSettlMonth
field.comment: Must be present for MBS or TBA.

field.name: DerivativeInTheMoneyCondition
field.comment: Used to express in-the-moneyness behavior in general terms for the option without the use of DerivativeStrikePrice(1261) and DerivativePutOrCall(1323).

field.name: NoDerivativeInstrumentParties
field.comment: Should contain unique combinations of DerivativeInstrumentPartyID, DerivativeInstrumentPartyIDSource, and DerivativeInstrumentPartyRole.

field.name: DerivativeInstrumentPartyID
field.comment: Used to identify party id related to instrument series.

field.name: DerivativeInstrumentPartyIDSource
field.comment: Used to identify source of instrument series party id.

field.name: DerivativeInstrumentPartyRole
field.comment: Used to identify the role of instrument series party id.

field.name: LegCustodialLotID
field.comment: Custodial Lot Identifier. Only used for specific lot trades.

field.name: LegVersusPurchaseDate
field.comment: Acquisition Date of the Lot. Defined as the effective acquisition date that would be used for gain-loss reporting. Only used for specific lot trades. If this field is used, either LegVersusPurchasePrice(1758) or LegCurrentCostBasis(1759) should be specified.

field.name: LegVersusPurchasePrice
field.comment: Price per Share. The Price value should be computed as Current Cost Basis / Quantity Held. Only used for specific lot trades. If this field is used, LegVersusPurchaseDate(1757) should be specified.

field.name: LegCurrentCostBasis
field.comment: Current Cost Basis for the lot. Only used for specific lot trades. If this field is used, LegVersusPurchaseDate(1757) should be specified.

field.name: NoAllocs
field.comment: Number of repeating groups for pre-trade allocation.

field.name: AllocAccount
field.comment: Required if NoAllocs > 0. Must be first field in repeating group.

block.comment: Insert here the set of "Nested Parties" (firm identification "nested" within additional repeating group) fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages". Used for NestedPartyRole=Clearing Firm

field.name: CustodialLotID
field.comment: Custodial Lot Identifier. Only used for specific lot trades.

field.name: VersusPurchaseDate
field.comment: Acquisition Date of the Lot. Defined as the effective acquisition date that would be used for gain-loss reporting. Only used for specific lot trades. If this field is used, either VersusPurchasePrice(1754) or CurrentCostBasis(1755) should be specified.

field.name: VersusPurchasePrice
field.comment: Price per Share. The Price value should be computed as Current Cost Basis / Quantity Held. Only used for specific lot trades. If this field is used, VersusPurchaseDate(1753) should be specified.

field.name: CurrentCostBasis
field.comment: Current Cost Basis for the lot. Only used for specific lot trades. If this field is used, VersusPurchaseDate(1753) should be specified.

field.name: AllocLegRefID
field.comment: The field may not be used in NewOrderSingle(35=D), OrderCancelReplaceRequest(35=G), NewOrderList(35=E) or any other message where there are no legs.

field.name: NoStrategyParameters
field.comment: Indicates number of strategy parameters.

field.name: StrategyParameterName
field.comment: Name of parameter.

field.name: StrategyParameterType
field.comment: Datatype of the parameter.

field.name: StrategyParameterValue
field.comment: Value of the parameter.

field.name: NoContraBrokers
field.comment: Number of ContraBrokers repeating group instances.

field.name: ContraBroker
field.comment: First field in repeating group. Required if NoContraBrokers > 0.

field.name: NoLegs
field.comment: Number of leg executions.

block.comment: Required if NoLegs (555) > 0

field.name: LegQty
field.comment: The LegQty(687) field is deprecated. The use of LegOrderQty(685) is recommended instead

field.name: LegOrderQty
field.comment: Quantity ordered for this leg as provided during order entry.

field.name: LegSwapType
field.comment: Instead of LegOrderQty(685) requests that the sellside calculate LegOrderQty(685) based on opposite Leg.

field.name: LegPositionEffect
field.comment: Provide if different from the value specified for the overall multileg security in PositionEffect(77) in the Instrument component

field.name: LegCoveredOrUncovered
field.comment: Provide if different from the value specified for the overall multileg security in CoveredOrUncovered(203) in the Instrument component.

field.name: LegRefID
field.comment: Use of LegRefID(654) in this component is deprecated. Recommend the use of LegID(1788) in the InstrumentLeg component.

field.name: LegSettlDate
field.comment: Takes precedence over a calculated LegSettlType(587) when specified regardless of LegSettlType(587) value. Conditionally required when LegSettlType(587) = B(Broken date).

field.name: LegLastPx
field.comment: Used to report the execution price assigned to the leg of the multileg instrument.

field.name: LegGrossTradeAmt
field.comment: For FX Futures can be used to express the notional value of a trade when LegLastQty(1418) and other quantity fields are expressed in terms of number of contracts - LegContractMultiplier(231) is required in this case.

field.name: LegLastQty
field.comment: Quantity execution for this leg.

field.name: LegShortSaleExemptionReason
field.comment: Available for optional use when LegSide(624) = 6 (Sell short exempt) in InstrumentLeg component

field.name: FillRefID
field.comment: Use to reference the partial execution of a multi-leg order to which this leg execution belongs.

field.name: LegClearingAccountType
field.comment: Provide if different from the value specified for the overall multileg security in ClearingAccountType(1816) in the Instrument component.

field.name: NoFills
field.comment: Specifies the number of partial fills included in this Execution Report.

field.name: FillExecID
field.comment: Unique identifier of execution as assigned by sell-side (broker, exchange, ECN). Must not overlap ExecID(17). Required if NoFills(1362) > 0.

field.name: FillPx
field.comment: Price of this partial fill. Required if NoFills(1362) > 0. Refer to LastPx(31).

field.name: FillQty
field.comment: Quantity (e.g. shares) bought/sold on this partial fill. Required if NoFills(1362) > 0.

block.comment: Contraparty information.

field.name: FillMatchID
field.comment: Can be used to refer to the related match event.

field.name: FillMatchSubID
field.comment: Can be used to refer to a price level (e.g. match step, clip) within the related match event.

field.name: AffectedOrigClOrdID
field.comment: Required if NoAffectedOrders(534) > 0. Indicates the client order id of an order affected by this request. If order(s) were manually delivered (or otherwise not delivered over FIX and not assigned a ClOrdID(11)) this field should contain string "MANUAL".

field.name: OrigClOrdID
field.comment: Required if NoAffectedOrders > 0 and must be the first repeating field in the group. Indicates the client order id of an order affected by this request. If order(s) were manually delivered (or otherwise not delivered over FIX and not assigned a ClOrdID) this field should contain string "MANUAL".

field.name: AffectedOrderID
field.comment: Contains the OrderID(37) assigned by the counterparty of an affected order. Conditionally required when AffectedOrigClOrdID(1824) = "MANUAL".

field.name: AffectedSecondaryOrderID
field.comment: Contains the SecondaryOrderID(198) assigned by the counterparty of an affected order. Not required as part of the repeating group.

field.name: NoNotAffectedOrders
field.comment: Optional field used to indicate the number of order identifiers for orders not affected by the request. Must be followed with NotAffOrigClOrdID (1372) as the next field.

field.name: NotAffOrigClOrdID
field.comment: Required if NoNotAffectedOrders(1370) > 0 and must be the first repeating field in the group. Indicates the client order id of an order not affected by the request. If order(s) were manually delivered (or otherwise not delivered over FIX and not assigned a ClOrdID) this field should contain string "MANUAL".

field.name: NotAffectedOrderID
field.comment: Contains the OrderID assigned by the counterparty of an unaffected order. Not required as part of the repeating group if NotAffOrigClOrdID(1372) has a value other than "MANUAL".

field.name: NoSides
field.comment: Must be 1 or 2

field.name: OrigClOrdID
field.comment: Required when referring to orders that were electronically submitted over FIX or otherwise assigned a ClOrdID(11).

field.name: ClOrdID
field.comment: Unique identifier of the order as assigned by institution or by the intermediary with closest association with the investor.

block.comment: Insert here the set of "Parties" (firm identification) fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages"
Insert here the set of "OrderQtyData" fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages"

field.name: EncodedTextLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedText field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Text field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field.

field.name: EncodedComplianceTextLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedComplianceText(2352) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedComplianceText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the ComplianceText(2404) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

field.name: NoSides
field.comment: Must be 1 or 2 if CrossType(549) = 1 (All or none cross), 2 otherwise

field.name: Side
field.comment: Required if NoSides(552) > 0

field.name: OrigClOrdID
field.comment: Required when referring to orders that were electronically submitted over FIX or otherwise assigned a ClOrdID(11).

field.name: ClOrdID
field.comment: Unique identifier of the order as assigned by institution or by the intermediary with closest association with the investor.

field.name: AllocID
field.comment: Use to assign an identifier to the block of preallocations.

field.name: ForexReq
field.comment: Indicates that broker is requested to execute a Forex accommodation trade in conjunction with the security trade.

field.name: SettlCurrency
field.comment: Required when ForexReq (121) = Y.

field.name: BookingType
field.comment: Method for booking out this order. Used when notifying a broker that an order to be settled by that broker is to be booked out as an OTC derivative (e.g. CFD or similar). Absence of this field implies regular booking.

field.name: EncodedTextLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedText field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Text field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field.

field.name: PositionEffect
field.comment: For use in derivatives omnibus accounting

field.name: CoveredOrUncovered
field.comment: For use with derivatives, such as options

field.name: SideTimeInForce
field.comment: Specifies how long the order as specified in the side stays in effect. Absence of this field indicates Day order.

field.name: SideShortSaleExemptionReason
field.comment: Available for optional use when Side(54) = 6 (Sell short exempt).

block.comment: Use as an alternative to CommissionData if multiple commissions or enhanced attributes are needed.

field.name: NoLegs
field.comment: Number of legs

block.comment: Required if NoLegs(555) > 0

field.name: LegQty
field.comment: The LegQty(687) field is deprecated. The use of LegOrderQty(685) is recommended instead. (Deprecated in FIX.5.0 SP1)

field.name: LegSwapType
field.comment: Instead of LegOrderQty(685) requests that the sellside calculate LegOrderQty(685) based on opposite Leg.

field.name: LegPositionEffect
field.comment: Provide if different from the value specified for the overall multileg security in PositionEffect(77) in the Instrument component.

field.name: LegCoveredOrUncovered
field.comment: Provide if different from the value specified for the overall multileg security in CoveredOrUncovered(203) in the Instrument component.

field.name: LegRefID
field.comment: Use of LegRefID(654) in this component is deprecated. Recommend the use of LegID(1788) in the InstrumentLeg component.

field.name: LegOrderQty
field.comment: Quantity ordered for this leg as provided during order entry.

field.name: LegShortSaleExemptionReason
field.comment: Available for optional use when LegSide(624) = 6 (Sell short exempt) in InstrumentLeg component

field.name: LegClearingAccountType
field.comment: Provide if different from the value specified for the overall multileg security in ClearingAccountType(1816) in the Instrument component.

field.name: NoAllocs
field.comment: Number of repeating groups for pre-trade allocation.

field.name: AllocAccount
field.comment: Required if NoAllocs > 0. Must be first field in repeating group.

block.comment: Insert here the set of "NestedParties3" (firm identification "nested" within additional repeating group) fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages"

field.name: CustodialLotID
field.comment: Custodial Lot Identifier. Only used for specific lot trades.

field.name: VersusPurchaseDate
field.comment: Acquisition Date of the Lot. Defined as the effective acquisition date that would be used for gain-loss reporting. Only used for specific lot trades. If this field is used, either VersusPurchasePrice(1754) or CurrentCostBasis(1755) should be specified.

field.name: VersusPurchasePrice
field.comment: Price per Share. The Price value should be computed as Current Cost Basis / Quantity Held. Only used for specific lot trades. If this field is used, VersusPurchaseDate(1753) should be specified.

field.name: CurrentCostBasis
field.comment: Current Cost Basis for the lot. Only used for specific lot trades. If this field is used, VersusPurchaseDate(1753) should be specified.

field.name: NoBidComponents
field.comment: Used if BidType="Disclosed"

field.name: ListID
field.comment: Required if NoBidComponents > 0. Must be first field in repeating group.

field.name: Side
field.comment: When used in request for a "Disclosed" bid indicates that bid is required on assumption that SideValue1 is Buy or Sell. SideValue2 can be derived by inference.

field.name: TradingSessionID
field.comment: Indicates off-exchange type activities for Detail.

field.name: NetGrossInd
field.comment: Indicates Net or Gross for selling Detail.

field.name: SettlDate
field.comment: Takes precedence over SettlType value and conditionally required/omitted for specific SettlType values.

field.name: NoBidComponents
field.comment: Used if BidType="Disclosed"

block.comment: First element Commission required if NoBidComponents > 0.

field.name: Country
field.comment: ISO Country Code.

field.name: Side
field.comment: When used in request for a "Disclosed" bid indicates that bid is required on assumption that SideValue1 is Buy or Sell. SideValue2 can be derived by inference.

field.name: Price
field.comment: Second element of price

field.name: FairValue
field.comment: The difference between the value of a future and the value of the underlying equities after allowing for the discounted cash flows associated with the underlying stocks (E.g. Dividends etc).

field.name: NetGrossInd
field.comment: Net/Gross

field.name: SettlDate
field.comment: Takes precedence over SettlType value and conditionally required/omitted for specific SettlType values.

field.name: EncodedTextLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedText field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Text field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field.

field.name: NoBidDescriptors
field.comment: Used if BidType="Non Disclosed"

field.name: BidDescriptorType
field.comment: Required ifNoBidDescriptors > 0. Must be first field in repeating group.

field.name: SideValueInd
field.comment: Refers to theSideValue1or SideValue2. These are used as opposed to Buy or Sell so that the basket can be quoted either way as Buy or Sell.

field.name: LiquidityValue
field.comment: Value betweenLiquidityPctLowandLiquidityPctHighin Currency

field.name: LiquidityNumSecurities
field.comment: Number of Securites betweenLiquidityPctLowandLiquidityPctHighin Currency

field.name: LiquidityPctLow
field.comment: Liquidity indicator or lower limit ifLiquidityNumSecurities> 1

field.name: LiquidityPctHigh
field.comment: Upper liquidity indicator ifLiquidityNumSecurities> 1

field.name: EFPTrackingError
field.comment: Eg Used in EFP (Exchange For Physical) trades 12%

field.name: FairValue
field.comment: Used in EFP trades

field.name: OutsideIndexPct
field.comment: Used in EFP trades

field.name: ValueOfFutures
field.comment: Used in EFP trades

field.name: NoStrikes
field.comment: Number of strike price entries

field.name: EncodedText

field.name: ClOrdID
field.comment: Must be the first field in the repeating group.

field.name: ListSeqNo
field.comment: Order number within the list

field.name: ExecInst
field.comment: Can contain multiple instructions, space delimited. If OrdType=P, exactly one of the following values (ExecInst = L, R, M, P, O, T, or W) must be specified.

field.name: IOIID
field.comment: Required for Previously Indicated Orders (OrdType=E)

field.name: QuoteID
field.comment: Required for Previously Quoted Orders (OrdType=D)

field.name: RefOrderID
field.comment: Required for counter-order selection / Hit / Take Orders (OrdType = Q)

field.name: RefOrderIDSource
field.comment: Conditionally required if RefOrderID is specified.

field.name: ExpireDate
field.comment: Conditionally required if TimeInForce = GTD andExpireTime is not specified.

field.name: ExpireTime
field.comment: Conditionally required if TimeInForce = GTD andExpireDate is not specified.

field.name: GTBookingInst
field.comment: States whether executions are booked out or accumulated on a partially filled GT order

field.name: BookingType
field.comment: Method for booking out this order. Used when notifying a broker that an order to be settled by that broker is to be booked out as an OTC derivative (e.g. CFD or similar). Absence of this field implies regular booking.

field.name: EncodedTextLen
field.comment: Must be set ifEncodedTextfield is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of theTextfield in the encoded format specified via theMessageEncodingfield.

field.name: SettlDate2
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0) Can be used withOrdType= "Forex - Swap" to specify the "value date" for the future portion of a F/X swap.

field.name: OrderQty2
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0) Can be used withOrdType= "Forex - Swap" to specify the order quantity for the future portion of a F/X swap.

field.name: Price2
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0) Can be used withOrdType= "Forex - Swap" to specify the price for the future portion of a F/X swap which is also a limit order. For F/X orders, should be the "all-in" rate (spot rate adjusted for forward points).

field.name: MaxShow
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0)

field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0) For further specification of the TargetStrategy

field.name: ParticipationRate
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0) Mandatory for a TargetStrategy = Participate order and specifies the target particpation rate. For other order types optionally specifies a volume limit (i.e. do not be more than this percent of the market volume)

field.name: Designation
field.comment: Supplementary registration information for this Order within the List

field.name: ShortSaleExemptionReason
field.comment: Available for optional use when Side(54) = 6 (Sell short exempt).
