descr.p: TheBid RequestMessage can be used in one of two ways depending on which market conventions are being followed.

In the Non disclosed convention (e.g. US/European model) theBid Requestmessage can be used to request a bid based on the sector, country, index and liquidity information contained within the message itself. In the Non disclosed convention the entry repeating group is used to define liquidity of the program. See "Program/Basket/List Trading" for an example.

In the Disclosed convention (e.g. Japanese model) the BidRequest message can be used to request bids based on the ListOrderDetail messages sent in advance ofBid Requestmessage. In the Disclosed convention the list repeating group is used to define which ListOrderDetail messages a bid is being sort for and the directions of the required bids.

The pair of fieldsSideValue1andSideValue2are used to show the monetary total value in either direction (buy or sell) of the transaction without revealing whether it is the buy-side institutions intention to buy or sell.

The two repeating groups, NoEntries andNoBidComponentsare mutually exclusive and a function of which bidding model is being used. If the Non Disclosure method is being used the portfolio of stocks being traded is described by a number of bid descriptors entries. If the Disclosure Method is being used the portfolio is fully disclosed, except for side, by a number of list entries enumerating the lists that list the stocks to be traded.

ABid Requestmessage withBidRequestTransTypecancel may be used to indicate to sell side firms that they no longer need to store details of theBid Requestas they have either lost the bid or the List has been canceled.
TheBid Responsemessage can be used in one of two ways depending on which market conventions are being followed.

In the Non disclosed convention theBid Responsemessage can be used to supply a bid based on the sector, country, index and liquidity information contained within the corresponding bid request message. See "Program/Basket/List Trading" for an example.
In the Disclosed convention theBid Responsemessage can be used to supply bids based on the List Order Detail messages sent in advance of the correspondingBid Requestmessage.

field.name: TotNoStrikes
field.comment: Used to support fragmentation. Sum ofNoStrikesacross all messages with the same ListID.

field.name: LastFragment
field.comment: Indicates whether this is the last fragment in a sequence of message fragments. Only required where message has been fragmented.

block.comment: Number of strike price entries

descr.p: The strike price message is used to exchange strike price information for principal trades. It can also be used to exchange reference prices for agency trades.

While the FIX Session Protocol is based upon "Tag=Value" syntax for the Standard Header, Standard Trailer, and the Administrative Messages which make up the FIX Session Protocol, it is possible to send FIXML or other XMLbased content ("payload") via the FIX Session Protocol. The FIXML or other XML-based content is enclosed in a traditional "Tag=Value" FIX standard header via the standard header's XmlDataLen and XmlData fields and followed by the "Tag=Value" FIX standard trailer.

descr.p: TheRegistration Instructionsmessage type may be used by institutions or retail intermediaries wishing to electronically submit registration information to a broker or fund manager (for CIV) for an order or for an allocation.

ARegistration Instructionsmessage can be submitted as new, cancel or replace. TheRegistTransTypefield indicates the purpose of the message. When submitting replace or cancelRegistTransTypemessages theRegistRefIDfield is required. ReplacementRegistration Instructionsmessages must contain all data for the replacement registration.
See VOLUME 7 - "PRODUCT: COLLECTIVE INVESTMENT VEHICLES"

TheRegistration Instructionsmessage contains repeating fields for each of several joint registrants. The number of registration details instances is indicated in NoRegistDtls. The repeating fields are shown in the message definition below in typeface Bold-Italic and indented with the symbol. The fields relative position within the repeating group in the message is important. For example, each instance of registration must be in the order as shown in the message definition below.

field.name: RegistID
field.comment: Unique identifier of the originalRegistration Instructionsdetails

field.name: RegistTransType
field.comment: Identifies originalRegistration Instructionstransaction type

field.name: RegistRefID
field.comment: Required for Cancel and ReplaceRegistTransTypemessages

field.comment: Unique identifier of the order as assigned by institution or intermediary.

block.comment: Insert here the set of "Parties" (firm identification) fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages".

descr.p: TheRegistration Instructions Responsemessage type may be used by broker or fund manager (for CIV) in response to aRegistration Instructionsmessage submitted by an institution or retail intermediary for an order or for an allocation.
TheRegistration Instructions Responsemessage is used to:

ol.li: confirm the receipt of aRegistration Instructionsmessage
confirm changes to an existing Registration Instructions message (i.e. accept cancel and replace requests)
relay assigned client and account Ids for Registration Instructions messages withRegistTransType=New

descr.p:
EachRegistration Instructions Responsemessage contains aRegistStatusfield which is used to communicate the current state of theRegistration Instructionsas understood by the broker or fund manager. The Registration Instruction statuses are as follows (in highest to lowest precedence):
RegistStatus
Description
Accepted
Registration details are acceptable to the receiving broker, intermediary or fund manager. Assigned client and account Ids may be returned.
Rejected
Registration details have been rejected by the receiving broker, intermediary or fund manager.
Held
Registration details have been held by the receving broker, intermediary or fund manager. Assigned (possibly provisional) client and account Ids may be returned.

descr.p: The order mass cancel request message requests the cancelation of all of the remaining quantity of a group of orders matching criteria specified within the request. NOTE: This message can only be used to cancel order messages (reduce the full quantity).

An order mass cancel request is assigned aClOrdIDand is treated as a separate entity. The order mass cancel request is acknowledged using an Order Mass Cancel Report. TheOrder Mass Cancel Reportwill contain theClOrdIDthat was specified on the Order Mass Cancel Request. TheClOrdIDassigned to the cancel request must be unique amongst theClOrdIDassigned to regular orders, replacement orders, cancel requests, and order mass cancel requests.

An immediate response to this message is required. It is recommended that an ExecutionRpt with ExecType=Pending Cancel be sent unless theOrder Mass Cancel Requestcan be immediately accepted (ExecutionRpt with ExecType=Canceled) or rejected (Order Cancel Reject message).

field.name: ClOrdID
field.comment: ClOrdID provided on the Order Mass Cancel Request. Unavailable in case of an unsolicited report, such as after a trading halt or a corporate action requiring the deletion of outstanding orders.

descr.p: The purpose of this message is to initiate a margin requirement inquiry for a margin account. The inquiry may be submitted at the detail level or the summary level. It can also be used to inquire margin excess/deficit or net position information. Margin excess/deficit will provide information about the surplus or shortfall compared to the previous trading day or a more recent margin calculation. An inquiry for net position information will trigger one or more PositionReport messages instead of one or more MarginRequirementReport messages.

If the inquiry is made at the detail level, an Instrument block must be provided with the desired level of detail. If the inquiry is made at the summary level, the Instrument block is not provided, implying a summary request is being made. For example, if the inquiring firm specifies the Security Type of "FUT" in the Instrument block, then a detail report will be generated containing the margin requirements for all futures positions for the inquiring account. Similarly, if the inquiry is made at the summary level, the report will contain the total margin requirement aggregated to the margin account level.

Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of theTextfield in the encoded format specified via theMessageEncodingfield.

descr.p: The new PartyDetailsListRequest message is used to request for information on one or more party(-ies) and their relationships from a central master reference system or another party that stores and maintains party reference information. The central master reference system can be an exchange that provides such information to trading applications that connect to it. Reference information may include relationships between parties.
Types of requests may include:

ul.li: Request all party information available from counterparty.
Request party information for a specific party identifier or list of identifiers
Request party information for one or more party roles
Request party information for one or more types of party relationships
Request all related party information

descr.p: Party relationships, as indicated in the response, can either be inferred based on PartyDetailRole, or made explicit. For example, if PartyDetailRole is Executing Firm(1) and RelatedPartyDetailRole is Customer Account(24), it should be obvious that the executing firm trades for the customer account. This relationship can also be made explicit by using the PartyRelationshipGrp component block, specifying PartyRelationship as Trades for(3). Relationships between parties are modeled as a web or mesh. PartyRelationship can indicate that an entity of a specific PartyDetailRole is also an entity of different PartyDetailRole, e.g. an Executing Firm with one ID is also a Clearing Firm with another ID.

With the exception of "Is also," PartyRelationship is specified as a list of reciprocal relationships. This enables a relationship to be conveyed regardless of which party is specified in PartyDetailID and which is specified in RelatedPartyDetailID. The list of reciprocal party relationships is as follows:

tr.td: Provides quotes to 18 Requests quotes from

descr.p: If Executing Firm A "Trades for" Customer Account B, then Customer Account B "Trades through" Executing Firm A. If Executing Firm A were specified in PartyDetailID, and Customer Account B were specified in RelatedPartyDetailID, then PartyRelationship would be Trades for(3). Alternately, if Customer Account B were specified in PartyDetailID, and Executing Firm A were specified in RelatedPartyDetailID, then PartyRelationship would be Trades through(4).

Examples illustrating each odd numbered PartyRelationship type, with several possible PartyDetailRole and RelatedPartyDetailRole values, are given in the table below. Only odd numbered PartyRelationship values are illustrated because the even numbered cases can be obtained by swapping PartyDetailRole and RelatedPartyDetailRole. This list is not exclusive, but rather illustrative of some relations that can be modeled

tr.td:
Clearing Firm
Prime Broker
Clearing Account

Executing Firm
Customer Account

Clearing Firm
Executing Firm
Investor ID
Customer Account
Clearing Account

Clearing Firm

Prime Broker
Market Maker

Systematic internaliser (SA)

Regulated Market (RM)

Executing Firm
Executing Trader
Investor ID
Prime Broker
Market Maker
13 = Carries positions for Position Account Executing Firm
Any role applicable for the parent firm
Any role applicable for the subsidiary

Customer Account

Clearing Firm

Asset Manager

Customer Account
Position Account
Clearing Account

descr.p: Multiple PartyRelationship values can be specified if multiple types of relationships exist between two parties. For example, a Clearing Firm might both "Clears for" and "Approves of" an Introducing Broker.
A request may specify one or more PartyID values, one or more RequestedPartyRole values, one or more RelationshipType values, or none of these.

A request without these fields returns the requested details on all parties. A request specifying only one or more PartyIDs returns details about those parties. A request specifying only one or more RequestedPartyRole values returns details about all parties with a matching PartyRole.

msgdef.descr: This new message type is used to update party information at the receiving party's side with information supplied by the sender. This message is modeled in a similar manner as the various UpdateReport messages in Securities Reference Data. The ListUpdateAction field is key to define the type of change (Add, Modify, Delete) to be applied to the party within PartyDetailGrp

field.name: NoRelatedSym
field.comment: Number of exceptions with a trading status different from SecurityMassTradingStatus (1679)

block.comment: Insert here the set of InstrumentExtension fields defined in Common Components of Application Messages

field.name: Text
field.comment: Comment, instructions, or other identifying information.

field.name: EncodedTextLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedText field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Text field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field.

field.name: SecurityStatusReqID
field.comment: Must be unique, or the ID of previous Security Mass Status Request to disable if SubscriptionRequestType = Disable previous Snapshot + Updates Request (2).

field.name: SubscriptionRequestType
field.comment: SubcriptionRequestType indicates to the other party what type of response is expected. A snapshot request only asks for current information. A subscribe request asks for updates as the status changes. Unsubscribe will cancel any future update messages from the counter party.

field.name: SecurityStatusReqID
field.comment: Required when mass status is in response to a SecurityMassStatusRequest (35=CN) messag

field.name: SecurityListID
field.comment: Identifies all securities for a security list identifier.

field.name: MarketID
field.comment: Identifies all securities for a market.

field.name: MarketSegmentID
field.comment: Identifies all securities for a market segment.

field.name: TradingSessionID
field.comment: Identifies all securities for a trading session.

field.name: TradingSessionSubID
field.comment: Identifies all securities for a trading subsession.

field.name: UnsolicitedIndicator
field.comment: Set to 'Y' if message is sent as a result of a subscription request not a snapshot request.

field.name: MDBookType
field.comment: Used to relay changes in the book type.

field.name: MarketDepth
field.comment: Used to relay changes in Market Depth.

field.name: TransactTime
field.comment: Time of state change for security list.

field.name: TradeDate
field.comment: Business day that the state change applies to.

blockdef.name: SecurityClassificationGrp

field.name: SecurityClassificationReason
field.comment: Conditionally required if NoSecurityClassifications (1582) > 0.

blockdef.descr: Product Classification Component block supports extended classification of products. Added to Instrument block

blockdef.name: LegPositionAmountData

field.name: NoLegPosAmt
field.comment: Number of Position Amount entries.

blockdef.descr: LegPositionAmountData allows cash flow amounts to be associated with a leg.

blockdef.name: ThrottleResponse
blockdef.descr: This component is used to convey information about the throttle status on response messages, e.g. Execution Report, Quote Status Report, etc.

blockdef.name: ThrottleParamsGrp

field.name: NoThrottles
field.comment: Indicates number of throttles to follow

field.name: ThrottleAction
field.comment: Required when NoThrottles > 0

field.name: ThrottleType
field.comment: Required when NoThrottles > 0

field.name: ThrottleNoMsgs
field.comment: Number of messages per time interval, or number of outstanding requests. Required when NoThrottles > 0

field.name: ThrottleTimeInterval
field.comment: Can be used only when ThrottleType = Inbound Rate. Indicates, along with ThrottleTimeUnit , the interval of time in which ThrottleNoMsgs may be sent. Default is 1

field.name: ThrottleTimeUnit
field.comment: Can be used only when ThrottleType = Inbound Rate. Indicates, along with ThrottleTimeUnit , the interval of time in which ThrottleNoMsgs may be sent. Default is 1

block.comment: Indicates MsgType values that this throttle counts. If not specified, the definition is implicit based upon bilateral agreement

blockdef.descr: This component is used to represent Throttles. This will be added to the User Response message. While we anticipate this may be added to the Party Entitlement Report message to convey the information at a more granular party or party relationship level, that is outside the scope of this proposal. User Response messages convey throttle information per user or per session. Consideration has been given to extending this component block to the Logon, but session-level changes are outside the scope of this proposal.

blockdef.name: ThrottleMsgTypeGrp

field.name: ThrottleMsgType
field.comment: Required when NoThrottleMsgType > 0

blockdef.descr: This component is used to convey a list of MsgType values.

blockdef.name: SettlementAmountGrp

field.name: SettlementAmount
field.comment: w Required if NoSettlementAmounts(1700) > 0

blockdef.descr: The Settlement Amount Group component block is a repeatable block intended to provide the settlement amounts for an account.

blockdef.name: CollateralAmountGrp

field.name: CurrentCollateralAmount
field.comment: Required if NoCollateralsAmounts > 0

field.name: CollateralCurrency
field.comment: Can be used to specify the base settlement currency of CollateralAmount(1704) if Currency(15) is not specified or is not the same.

field.name: CollateralReinvestmentRate
field.comment: May be used to specify the average reinvestment rate when there are multiple instances of the CollateralReinvestmentGrp.

field.name: UnderlyingRefID
field.comment: May be used to indicate that this entry applies to the underlying collateral instrument being referenced by the value in UnderlyingID(2874).

blockdef.descr: The Collateral Amount Group component block is a repeatable block intended to provide the current value of the collateral type on deposit. The currency of the collateral value may be optionally included.

field.name: PayCollectType
field.comment: Required if NoPayCollects(1707) > 0

field.name: PayCollectCurrency
field.comment: Can be used to specify the base settlement currency if Currency(15) is not specified.

block.comment: Used to identify the parties for the account (clearing organization, clearing firm, account type, etc.)

descr.p: The Account Summary Report is provided by the clearinghouse to its clearing members on a daily basis. It contains margin, settlement, collateral and pay/collect data for each clearing member level account type. Clearing member account types will be described through use of the Parties component and PtysSubGrp sub-component.

In certain usages, Clearing Members can send the Account Summary Report message to the clearinghouse as needed. For example, Clearing Members can send this message to the clearinghouse to identify the value of collateral for each customer (to satisfy CFTC Legally Segregated Operationally Commingled (LSOC) regulatory reporting obligations).

The Parties component and PtysSubGrp sub-component are used to describe the Clearing Member number and account type for that report. Net settlement amount or amounts are provided using the SettlementAmountGrp component. Margin requirement amounts are provided using the Margin Amount Data component.

The current collateral values for each valid collateral type is provided using the CollateralAmountGrp component. Likewise pay/collect information is provided using the PayCollectGrp component. Margin and pay/collect amounts can optionally be tied to markets and market segments for clearing houses that support multiple markets

field.name: Currency
field.comment: Identifies the base reporting currency used in this report.

block.comment: Can be used to identify mark to market information for the position.

msgdef.name: Party Risk Limits Update Report

comment.p: Conditionally required when sent as part of a subscription requested by a PartyRiskLimitsRequest(35=CL).

field.name: RiskLimitRequestType
field.comment: Can be used if sent as part of a subscription started by a PartyRiskLimitsRequest(35=CL).

field.name: EncodedTextLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedText(355) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Text(58) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

msgdef.descr: PartyRiskLimitsUpdateReport is used to convey incremental changes to risk limits. It is similar to the regular report but uses <PartyRiskLimitsUpdateGrp> instead of <PartyRiskLimitsGrp> to include an update action

block.comment: May be used to specify the requesting party in the event the request was made verbally or via other means.

msgdef.name: Party Risk Limits Definition Request

comment.p: May be used to identify the party making the request and their role.
Risk limits to be enforced for given party(-ies) and related party(-ies).

msgdef.descr: PartyRiskLimitDefinitionRequest is used for defining new risk limits. The structure is based on the PartyRiskLimitsReport.

msgdef.name: Party Risk Limits Definition Request Ack
msgdef.descr: PartyRiskLimitDefinitionRequestAck is used for accepting (with or without changes) or rejecting the definition of risk limits. The structure is based on the PartyRiskLimitsReport (including changes proposed by this document)

blockdef.name: PartyRiskLimitsUpdateGrp

comment.p: Required if NoPartyRiskLimits(1677) > 0

block.condreq: T$1324 = 'A' or (T$1324 in ('M', 'D') and not existtags (T$1670))

comment.p: Conditionally required when ListUpdateAction(1324) = A(Add). Conditionally required when ListUpdateAction(1324) = M(Modify) or D(Delete) and RiskLimitID(1670) is not provided.
Conditionally required when ListUpdateAction(1324) = A(Add) or M(Modify).
Conditionally required when PartyDetailGrp component is not provided

blockdef.descr: PartyRiskLimitsUpdateGrp is a repeating group based on the existing block <PartyRiskLimitsGrp> with an additional field ListUpdateAction (1324) to support incremental changes of risk limit definitions. The group is part of the definition request as well as part of the update report for risk limits

blockdef.name: PartyRiskLimitsAckGrp

comment.p: Required if NoPartyRiskLimits(1677) > 0
Required if NoPartyRiskLimits(1677) > 0
Conditionally required when RiskLimitID(1670) is not provided. Changes to party or related party(-ies) defined in the request are not permitted

Conditionally required when RiskLimitStatus(1763) = 1 (Accepted with changes) and must then be complete, i.e. omissions compared to the request represent risk limits that were removed, additional risk limits are possible.
Conditionally required when PartyDetailGrp component is not provided

field.name: EncodedRejectTextLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedRejectText(1665) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedRejectText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the RejectText(1328) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

blockdef.descr: PartyRiskLimitsAckGrp is a repeating group based on the existing block <PartyRiskLimitsGrp> with an additional field RiskLimitStatus (1763) to accept (with or without changes) or reject individual risk limits. It is only used in PartyRiskLimitDefinitionRequestAck, the response to the request to define risk limits. An approval with changes requires to send <RiskLimitsGrp> with the complete set of risk limits that have been accepted for the party defined

blockdef.name: PartyEntitlementGrp

comment.p: Required if NoPartyEntitlements(1772) > 0.

block.comment: Required unless omitted to indicate the removal of entitlements for the party(-ies) specified in the PartyDetailGrp component.

blockdef.descr: PartyEntitlementGrp conveys a list of parties (optionally including related parties) and the entitlements for each.

blockdef.name: EntitlementGrp

field.name: EntitlementIndicator
field.comment: Required if NoEntitlements(1773) > 0

field.name: EntitlementType
field.comment: Absence of this field indicates the meaning of the entitlement is implicit.

blockdef.descr: EntitlementGrp conveys a list of entitlements for one specific party, or relationship between two parties. Each entitlement may be further limited or clarified using optional fields and components.

blockdef.name: EntitlementAttribGrp

field.name: EntitlementAttribType
field.comment: Required if NoEntitlementAttrib(1777) > 0

field.name: EntitlementAttribDatatype
field.comment: If specified, and this is an attribute published by FPL in the external code list, this must agree with the published datatype.

field.name: EntitlementAttribValue
field.comment: Required if NoEntitlementAttrib(1777) > 0

blockdef.descr: EntitlementAttribGrp conveys a list of one or more attributes related to an entitlement. An entitlement may contain an EntitlementType, which states what can be done at a gross level, e.g. that a party can make markets. It may be limited further within EntitlementGrp, e.g. that such market making is allowed only for a list of stocks. The EntitlementAttribGrp contains fine details clarifying or limiting the EntitlementType, e.g. that such market making must be conducted with a specific minimum quote size and a specific maximum spread

blockdef.name: MarketSegmentScopeGrp

field.name: MarketID
field.comment: Required if NoMarketSegments(1310) > 0

blockdef.descr: MarketSegmentScopeGrp conveys a list of markets and, optionally, their market segments. Note that the component MarketSegmentGrp exists, but is not useful for this purpose, as it conveys additional information not appropriate in this context

msgdef.name: Party Entitlements Request

block.comment: May be used to identify the party making the request and their role.
Scope of the query/request for specific party(-ies).
Scope of the query/request for specific party roles. For example, "all information for PartyRole=24"
Scope of the query/request for specific securities.

msgdef.descr: The PartyEntitlementsRequest message is used to request for entitlement information for one or more parties, specific party role(s), or specific instruments(-s).

msgdef.name: Party Entitlements Report

field.name: EntitlementRequestID
field.comment: Conditionally required when responding to PartyEntitlementsRequest(35=CU).

field.name: RequestResult
field.comment: Conditionally required when responding to PartyEntitlementsRequest(35=CU).

msgdef.descr: The PartyEntitlementsReport is used to report entitlements for one or more parties, party role(s), or specific instrument(s).

blockdef.name: TargetMarketSegmentGrp

field.name: TargetMarketSegmentID
field.comment: Required when NoTargetMarketSegments(1789) > 0

blockdef.descr: The following new component block is a repeating group to convey a list of market segments upon which an action is to be taken.

blockdef.name: AffectedMarketSegmentGrp

field.name: AffectedMarketSegmentID
field.comment: Required when NoAffectedMarketSegments(1791) > 0

blockdef.descr: AffectedMarketSegmentGrp is a repeating groups to convey a list of market segments that have been affected by a mass action

blockdef.name: NotAffectedMarketSegmentGrp

field.name: NotAffectedMarketSegmentID
field.comment: Required when NoNotAffectedMarketSegments(1793) > 0

blockdef.descr: NotAffectedMarketSegmentGrp is a repeating groups to convey a list of market segments that have not been affected by a mass action

blockdef.name: OrderEventGrp

field.name: OrderEventType
field.comment: Required when NoOrderEvents (1795) > 0

blockdef.descr: OrderEventGrp conveys different types of events affecting orders. These can include entry, modification and deletion of orders as well as executions (fills). Modifications can be solicited or unsolicited, e.g. triggering of stop orders, replenishment of reserve orders, orders being suspended (locked) or released from suspension

blockdef.name: DisclosureInstructionGrp

field.name: DisclosureType
field.comment: Required when NoDisclosureInstructions (1812) > 0

blockdef.descr: DisclosureInstructionGrp is a new repeating group of instructions, each of which relates to one or more elements of an order. The instruction itself conveys whether the information should be disclosed, e.g. in market data, or not

blockdef.name: SideCrossLegGrp

field.name: LegRefID
field.comment: Required if NoCrossLegs(1829) > 0

field.name: LegOrderQty
field.comment: Quantity ordered from this leg as provided during order entry

field.name: LegClearingAccountType
field.comment: Provide if different from the value specified for the overall multileg security in ClearingAccountType(1816) in the Instrument component

field.name: LegPositionEffect
field.comment: Provide if different from the value specified for the overall multileg security in PositionEffect(77) in the Instrument component

field.name: LegCoveredOrUncovered
field.comment: Provide if different from the value specified for the overall multileg security in CoveredOrUncovered(203) in the Instrument component.

field.name: LegShortSaleExemptionReason
field.comment: Available for optional use when LegSide(624) = 6 (Sell short exempt) in InstrumentLeg component

blockdef.descr: SideCrossLegGrp is a repeating group that is similar to LegOrdGrp component in order to support leg level information per side of cross orders and is part of SideCrossOrdModGrp component. LegOrdGrp component cannot be re-used for this purpose as it contains the InstrumentLeg component and NestedParties component which are already part of the cross messages. The difference to LegOrdGrp component is that SideCrossLegGrp component does not have an InstrumentLeg component to describe the legs, it only has a single reference field to identify the leg which can be defined by the InstrumentLeg component which is present on a higher level of the message and outside of the side group.

field.name: NotAffOrigClOrdID
field.comment: Required if NoNotAffectedOrders(1370) > 0 and must be the first repeating field in the group. Indicates the client order identifier of an order not affected by the request. If order(s) were manually delivered (or otherwise not delivered over FIX and not assigned a ClOrdID(11)) this field should contain string "MANUAL"

field.name: NotAffectedOrderID
field.comment: Contains the OrderID(37) assigned by the counterparty of an unaffected order. Not required as part of the repeating group if NotAffOrigClOrdID(1372) has a value other than "MANUAL"

field.name: NotAffSecondaryOrderID
field.comment: Contains the SecondaryOrderID(198) assigned by the counterparty of an unaffected order. Not required as part of the repeating group

field.name: NotAffectedReason
field.comment: Can be used to provide a reason for excluding this order from the scope of the mass action.

blockdef.name: TradePriceConditionGrp

field.name: TradePriceCondition
field.comment: Required if NoTradePriceConditions > 0. Must be first field in repeating group.

blockdef.descr: Price conditions associated with a trade that impact trade price.

blockdef.name: TradeQtyGrp

field.name: TradeQtyType
field.comment: Required if NoTradeQtys > 0. Must be first field in repeating group.

blockdef.descr: Quantities of the trade that have been processed and the type of processing that has occurred for that trade quantity.

blockdef.name: TradePositionQty
blockdef.descr: The TradePositionQty component block specifies, for a single trade side, the various types of position quantity in the position life-cycle including start-of-day, intraday, trade, adjustments, and end-of-day position quantities.

blockdef.name: TradeAllocAmtGrp

field.name: TradeAllocAmtType
field.comment: Required if NoTradeAllocAmts > 0. Must be first field in repeating group.

blockdef.descr: The TradAllocAmtGrp component is used to communicate the monetary amounts associated with allocated positions. This is the per-allocation portion of the per-trade amount specified in PositionAmountData component.

blockdef.name: RelatedTradeGrp

field.name: RelatedTradeID
field.comment: Required if NoRelatedTrades(1855) > 0

field.name: RelatedTradeDate
field.comment: Optionally used to help identify the trade when RelatedTradeID is not unique across multiple days.

field.name: RelatedTradeMarketID
field.comment: Optionally used to help identify the trade when RelatedTradeID is not unique across multiple days.

field.name: RelatedRegulatoryTradeIDSource
field.comment: Optionally used for RelatedTradeIDSource(1857) = 6 (Regulatory trade ID) when RelatedTradeID(1856) is not unique across multiple reporting entities.

blockdef.descr: This component is used to identify trades that are related to each other for a business purpose, such as netting of forwards. This component should not be used in lieu of explicit FIX fields that denote specific semantic relationships, but rather should be used when no such fields exist.

blockdef.name: RelatedPositionGrp

field.name: RelatedPositionID
field.comment: Required if NoRelatedPositions (1861) > 0

blockdef.descr: This component is used to identify positions that are related to each other or to other trades. This should not be used in lieu of explicit FIX fields that denote specific semantic relationships, but rather should be used when no such fields exist.

field.name: QuoteID
field.comment: Contains the QuoteID(117) of a single Quote(35=S).

field.name: QuoteMsgID
field.comment: Contains the QuoteMsgID(1166) of a single Quote(35=S) or QuoteCancel(35=Z).

field.name: QuoteRejectReason
field.comment: Conditionally required when QuoteAckStatus(1865) = 2(Rejected)

descr.p: The Quote Ack message is used to acknowledge a Quote(35=S) submittal or request to cancel an individual quote using the QuoteCancel(35=Z) message during a Quote/Negotiation dialog. The Quote Ack message is available for optional use to acknowledge the request to cancel an individual quote (QuoteCancel(35=Z) with QuoteCancelType(298) = 5(Cancel specified sinqle quote)).

block.comment: May be used by the quote receiver to inform quote provider of pre-trade transparency waiver determination in the context of MiFID II.

blockdef.name: ValueChecksGrp

field.name: ValueCheckType
field.comment: Required if NoValueChecks > 0. Must be first field in repeating group.

field.name: ValueCheckAction
field.comment: Required if NoValueChecks > 0.

blockdef.descr: This component can be used by the message submitter to provide a list of value types to be checked by the counter party or message recipient.

field.name: LegSecurityXMLLen
field.comment: Must be provided if LegSecurityXML(1872) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

descr.p: The LegSecurityXML component is used to provide a definition in an XML format for the leg instrument.
See "Specifying an FpML product specification from within the FIX Instrument Block" in Volume 1 of the FIX Specification for more information on using this component block with FpML as a guideline.

field.name: UnderlyingSecurityXMLLen
field.comment: Must be provided if UnderlyingSecurityXML(1875) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

descr.p: The UnderlyingSecurityXML component is used to provide a definition in an XML format for the underlying instrument.
See "Specifying an FpML product specification from within the FIX Instrument Block" in Volume 1 of the FIX Specification for more information on using this component block with FpML as a guideline.

blockdef.name: PartyDetailAckGrp

comment.p: Required if NoPartyUpdates(1676) > 0.
Required if NoPartyUpdates(1676) > 0.

blockdef.descr: The PartyDetailAckGrp component is used in the Party Details Definition Request Ack message to provide the status of each action (add, modify or delete) requested by the Party Details Definition Requestmessage. The PartyDetailDefinitionStatus field is used to indicate the status. In the case where an add or modify request is accepted with changes, the PartyDetailGrp component is required, with the complete set of party details that have been accepted for the party included.

comment.p: Required if NoPartyEntitlements(1772) > 0.

block.comment: Optional when ListUpdateAction = M(Modify) or D(Delete) and EntitlementRefID is provided.
Optional when ListUpdateAction = M(Modify) or D(Delete) and EntitlementRefID is provided.

field.name: EntitlementRefID
field.comment: Optional when PartyDetailGrp is provided or ListUpdateAction = A(Add).

descr.p: The PartyEntitlementUpdateGrp component is used to supply incremental entitlement definitions changes for the party(-ies) specified in the PartyDetailGrp component. The update action type is specified using ListUpdateAction(1324).

comment.p: Required if NoPartyEntitlements(1772) > 0.
Required if NoPartyEntitlements(1772) > 0.

block.comment: Optional when ListUpdateAction = M(Modify) or D(Delete) and EntitlementRefID is provided.
Optional when ListUpdateAction = M(Modify) or D(Delete) and EntitlementRefID is provided.

field.name: EntitlementRefID
field.comment: Optional when PartyDetailGrp is provided or ListUpdateAction = A(Add).

descr.p: The PartyDetailAckGrp component is used in the Party Details Definition Request Ack message to provide the status of each action (add, modify or delete) requested by the Party Details Definition Requestmessage.

The PartyDetailDefinitionResult field is used to indicate the status. In the case where an add or modify request is accepted with changes, the PartyDetailGrp component is required, with the complete set of party details that have been accepted for the party included.

block.comment: Can be used to identify the party making the request and their role.
Specifies the parties and relationships between parties to be defined, modified or deleted.

descr.p: The Party Details Definition Request message is used for defining new parties and modifying or deleting existing parties information, including the relationships between parties.
The recipient of the message responds with a Party Details Definition Request Ack to indicate whether the request was accepted or rejected.
The Party Details Definition Request Ack is used as a response to the Party Details Definition Request message. The request can be accepted (with or without changes) or rejected.

field.name: EntitlementRequestID
field.comment: Conditionally required when responding to a PartyEntitlementsRequest(35=CU) message.

block.comment: Specifies the updated entitlements to be enforced for the given party(-ies) and related party(-ies).

field.name: EncodedTextLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedText(355) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Text(58) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

descr.p: The Party Entitlements Update Report is used to convey incremental changes to party entitlements. It is similar to the PartyEntitlementsReport(35=CV). This message uses the PartyEntitlementUpdateGrp component which includes the ability to specify an update action using ListUpdateAction.

block.comment: May be used to specify the requesting party in the event the request was made verbally or via other means.
Can be used to identify the party making the request and their role.
Specifies the entitlements to be defined, modified or deleted for the given party(-ies) and related party(-ies).

descr.p: The Party Entitlements Definition Request is used for defining new entitlements, and modifying or deleting existing entitlements for the specified party(-ies).
The Party Entitlements Definition Request Ack (35=DB) is the response message, used to indicate whether the request was accepted or rejected

The Party Entitlements Definition Request Ack (35=DB) is used as a response to the Party Entitlements Definition Request to accept(with or without changes) or reject the definition of party entitlements.

field.name: NoInstrmtMatchSides
field.comment: Number of instrument match sides that are part of the same match event

block.comment: Required if NoInstrmtMatchSides(1889) > 0

Identifies a Multi-leg Execution if present. Note that LegID should be present if individual leg executions will be referenced in TrdInstrmtLegExecGrp. LegID(1788) in the InstrmtLegGrp component can be used to reference individual leg executions referenced in the TrdInstrmtLegExecGrp component with LegRefID(654).

field.name: TrdMatchSubID
field.comment: Can be used to identify distinct price levels within a match event, e.g. Match Steps or Clips.

field.name: Quantity
field.comment: Total quantity for this instrument in th is match event. This is the cumulative sum of LastQty(32) for all match steps for this instrument.

field.name: SettlCurrency
field.comment: Contra currency of the deal. Used to qualify CalculatedCcyLastQty

comment.p: Trade quantity for this instrument within this match step. Trade Quantity for this instrument within this Match Step. This is determined as follows: For each TrdMatchSideGrp instance contained within this InstrmtMatchSideGrp instance, sum the SideLastQty field if the Side is a buy. Likewise, take the sum if the side is a sell. LastQty will be the greater of these two sums.
The value is the greater of the sum of SideLastQty(1009) of each side (i.e. buy or sell) for each TrdMatchSideGrp instance within the current InstrmtMatchSideGrp instance.
Required if NoInstrmtMatchSides (1889) > 0

field.name: LastPx
field.comment: Trade price. Required if NoInstrmtMatchSides (1889) > 0

block.comment: Required if NoInstrmtMatchSides (1889) > 0

descr.p: The InstrmtMatchSideGrp component is used to convey all trades for a given match event reported by instrument and trade side.

Each trade match report can contain any number of trades for any number of instruments. This component contains all instruments together with all of the trade sides (possibly more than two) that occurred for each instrument within the same match event.

blockdef.name: TrdMatchSideGrp

field.name: NoTrdMatchSides
field.comment: Number of trade match sides

field.name: Side
field.comment: Required if NoTrdMatchSides (1890) > 0

field.name: SideExecID
field.comment: This refers to the ExecID of the execution being reported. Used in trade reporting models that utilize different execution IDs for each side of the trade. This is used when reporting a trade with two or more sides.

field.name: SideTradeReportID
field.comment: Used to indicate the report ID for this trade match side.

field.name: OrderDelay
field.comment: Time lapsed from order entry until match, based on the unit of time specified in OrderDelayUnit. Default is seconds if OrderDelayUnit is not specified. Value = 0, indicates the aggressor (the initiating side of the trade)

field.name: OrderDelayUnit
field.comment: Used in conjunction with OrderDelay to specify the time unit being expressed. Default is "seconds" if not specified.

comment.p: Used to indicate the matched quantity for this trade side as a result of the match event.
Required if NoTrdMatchSides(1890) > 0.

field.name: SideClearingTradePrice
field.comment: Used to indicate a side specific alternate clearing price.

field.name: SidePriceDifferential
field.comment: Used to indicate the Price Differential between the first and second leg of a complex instrument.

field.name: SideClearingTradePriceType
field.comment: Used to indicate whether the trade is clearing using execution price or alternate clearing price.

field.name: SideFillStationCd
field.comment: Used for order routing to indicate the Fill Station Code for this trade match side.

field.name: SideReasonCd
field.comment: Used to indicate the reason for execution for this trade match side.

field.name: SideTrdSubTyp
field.comment: Used to support multi-sided orders of different trade types.

field.name: NetGrossInd
field.comment: Code to represent whether value is net (inclusive of tax) or gross.

field.name: SideCurrency
field.comment: Used to identify the currency of the trade match side.

field.name: SideSettlCurrency
field.comment: Used to identify the settlement currency of the trade match side.

block.comment: Trade price. Required if NoTrdMatchSides (1890) > 0

field.name: CustOrderCapacity
field.comment: The customer capacity for this trade.

field.name: ExchangeRule
field.comment: Used to report any exchange rules that apply to this trade.

field.name: TradeAllocIndicator
field.comment: Identifies if the trade is to be allocated.

field.name: AvgPxGroupID
field.comment: Identifies the average price group for the trade

comment.p: Can be used if the match event results in matches across different market segments for this side.
Used instead of MarketSegmentID(1300) when market segment may be different across sides.
Note that the market cannot be different across sides and is specified in MarketID(1301).
Can be used if the match event results in matches across different venue types for this side.
Used instead of VenueType(1430) when venue type may be different across sides.

block.comment: Carries order related details.
Specifies the partial fills of the order related to the current trade match side.

field.name: Text
field.comment: May be used by the executing market to record any execution Details that are particular to that market. Can be used to include text included in the order submission.

field.name: EncodedTextLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedText field is specified and must immediately precede it

field.name: EncodedText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Text field in the encoded format specified via theMessageEncoding field.

field.name: EncodedComplianceTextLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedComplianceText(2352) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedComplianceText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the ComplianceText(2404) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

blockdef.descr: The TrdMatchSideGrp component conveys all trade sides for a single instance of the InstrmtMatchSideGrp component.

blockdef.name: TrdInstrmtLegExecGrp

field.name: NoLegExecs
field.comment: Number of legs. Identifies a Multi-leg Execution if present and non-zero.

field.name: LegRefID
field.comment: Required when NoLegExecs (1892) > 0. Used to identify a specific leg.

comment.p: Provide if the PositionEffect for the leg is different from that specified for the overall multileg security.

field.name: LegCoveredOrUncovered
field.comment: Provide if the CoveredOrUncovered for the leg is different from that specified for the overall multileg security.

field.name: LegLastPx
field.comment: Used to report the execution price assigned to the leg of the multileg instrument

field.name: LegShortSaleExemptionReason
field.comment: Optional when LegSide(624) = 6(Short sale exempt)

blockdef.descr: The TrdInstrmtLegExecGrp component comprises individual executions for legs of the trade side of a trade match report for a specific instrument.

comment.p: Trade match identifier assigned in the matching engine and used to correlate a cleared trade with a match event. Should be common for all trades included in a match event. Conditionally required for trades reported from a matching platform.

field.name: TradeReportType
field.comment: Identifies the type of trade. Can indicate new submissions, addendums, cancellations, etc.

field.name: ClearingBusinessDate
field.comment: The business date for which the trade is expected to be cleared

field.name: TradeDate
field.comment: Used when reporting other than current day trades.

field.name: VenueType
field.comment: Identifies the type of venue where a trade was executed

field.name: TradeMatchTimestamp
field.comment: Timestamp of the trade or match event. For off-exchange trades the time at which the deal was negotiated or matched by the exchange. This timestamp will be the same on all the trades and will not change when a trade is modified.

field.name: TransactTime
field.comment: Indicates time of the transaction. Used after initial submission to indicate time of addendum, cancellation, etc. Time of the match event or transaction that resulted in this match report.

field.name: MultiLegReportingType
field.comment: Type of report if multileg instrument. Differentiates match events involving complex instruments(MultiLegReportingType(442)=3(multi-leg security)) from those only involving simple instruments (MultiLegReportingType(442)= 1, 2) should not be used.

block.comment: Match sides per instrument. This is conditionally required when submitting a new trade, e.g. TradeReportType = Submit(0).

descr.p: The Trade Match Report (35=DC) message is used by exchanges and ECN's to report matched trades to central counterparties (CCPs) as an atomic event.
The message is used to express the one-to-one, one-to-many and many-to-many matches as well as implied matches in which more complex instruments can match with simpler instruments.

field.name: TrdMatchID
field.comment: Indicates the Match ID of the Trade Match Report being acknowledged. Identifier of the TradeMatchReport (35=DC) being acknowledged.

field.name: TradeMatchRejectReason
field.comment: Conditionally required when TradeMatchAckStatus(1896) = Rejected(2).

descr.p: The TradeMatchReportAck(35=DD) is used to respond to the TradeMatchReport(35=DC) message. It may be used to report on the status of the request (e.g. accepting the request or rejecting the request)

comment.p: New Price Movement Point Group will repeat for each underlying price move
Required if NoPriceMovements(1919) > 0

descr.p: The PriceMovementGrp component is a repeatable block intended to contain theoretical profit and loss data at various price movement points account type(s) for which the price movement may apply to.
Price Movement repeating group for proprietary and non-proprietary accounts.

field.name: PriceMovementValue
field.comment: Value at the price movement point. Required if NoPriceMovementValues(1919) > 0.

field.name: PriceMovementPoint
field.comment: Price movement point up or down

field.name: PriceMovementType
field.comment: Format of the PriceMoveValue(percent or amount are initial options)

descr.p: This PriceMovementValueGrp component is a repeatable block that will be utilized to represent a value relative to a specific price movement point.

field.name: ClearingAccountType
field.comment: Required if NoClearingAccountTypes(1918) > 0.

descr.p: The ClearingAccountTypeGrp component is used specify the type of clearing account types.
When used within the PriceMovementGrp, the ClearingAccountTypeGrp specifies the type of account the price movement data is applicable for.

blockdef.name: LegPaymentStreamNonDeliverableSettlRateSource

field.name: LegPaymentStreamNonDeliverableSettlReferencePage
field.comment: Conditionally required when LegPaymentStreamNonDeliverableSettlRateSource(40087) = 3 (ISDA Settlement Rate Option) or 99 (Other).

field.comment: Must be set if EncodedAdditionalTermBondDesc(40005) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedAdditionalTermBondDesc
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the AdditionalTermBondDesc(40003) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

field.comment: Must be set if EncodedAdditionalTermBondIssuer(40009) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.comment: Required if NoCashSettlTerms(40022) > 0.

descr.p: The CashSettlTermGrp is a repeating component within the Instrument component used to report cash settlement terms referenced from UnderlyingInstruments.

Usage of CashSettlTermGrp must either include a known CashSettlAmount(40034) or provide the cash settlement term parameters needed to derive the cash settlement amount. CashSettlTermXID(40039) is provided for cross-referencing from an instance of the UnderlyingInstrument component through the UnderlyingSettlementTermXIDRef(2002) field.

blockdef.name: FinancingContractualDefinitionGrp

field.name: ContractualDefinition
field.comment: Required if NoContractualDefinitions(40040) > 0.

blockdef.descr: The FinancingContractualDefinitionGrp is a repeating component within the FinancingDetails component used to report the definitions published by ISDA that define the terms of a derivative trade.

blockdef.name: FinancingContractualMatrixGrp

field.comment: Required if NoContractualMatrices(40042) > 0.

blockdef.descr: The FinancingContractualMatrixGrp is a repeating component within the FinancingDetails component used to report the contractual matrices that apply to the derivative trade.

blockdef.name: FinancingTermSupplementGrp

field.name: FinancingTermSupplementDesc
field.comment: Required if NoFinancingTermSupplements(40046) > 0.

blockdef.descr: The FinancingTermSupplementGrp is a repeating component within the FinancingDetails component used to report contractual terms supplements of derivative trades.

field.name: StreamType
field.comment: Required if NoStreams(40049) > 0.

field.name: EncodedStreamTextLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedStreamText(40983) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedStreamText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the StreamText(40056) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

field.name: StreamNotionalFrequencyPeriod
field.comment: Conditionally required when StreamNotionalFrequencyUnit(41307) is specified.

field.name: StreamNotionalFrequencyUnit
field.comment: Conditionally required when StreamNotionalFrequencyPeriod(41306) is specified.

descr.p: The StreamGrp is a repeating subcomponent of the Instrument component used to detail the swap streams associated with the instrument

A swap will ordinarily have one or two streams. Each one may contain a StreamDesc(40051) with a descriptive string such as "Float" or "Fixed". However the choice of description should have no effect on the stream's purpose.

StreamPaySide(40052) and StreamReceiveSide(40053) link the appropriate swap parties to their role in the stream. In pre-trade messages the side value (e.g. Side(54) field) of the request or order should arbitrarily be "1" (Buy) or "2" (Sell), and StreamPaySide(40052) and StreamReceiveSide(40053) should be set to 1 appropriately the same side value indicating the aggressor's desired role. On fills and post-trade messages, the executing firm takes the opposite side and indicates its role by setting StreamPaySide(40052) and StreamReceiveSide(40053) to the opposite side of the aggressor's role.

blockdef.name: UnderlyingStreamEffectiveDate

field.name: UnderlyingStreamEffectiveDateBusinessDayConvention
field.comment: When specified, this overrides the business day convention defined in the UnderlyingDateAdjustment component in UnderlyingInstrument. The specified value would be specific to this instance of the underlying instrument's stream effective dates.

block.comment: When specified, this overrides the business centers defined in the UnderlyingDateAdjustment component in UnderlyingInstrument. The specified values would be specific to this instance of the underlying instrument's stream effective dates.

field.name: UnderlyingStreamEffectiveDateOffsetPeriod
field.comment: Conditionally required when UnderlyingStreamEffectiveDateOffsetUnit(40062) is specified.

field.name: UnderlyingStreamEffectiveDateOffsetUnit
field.comment: Conditionally required when UnderlyingStreamEffectiveDateOffsetPeriod(40061) is specified.

blockdef.descr: UnderlyingStreamEffectivedDate is a subcomponent of the UnderlyingStreamGrp component used to specify the effective date of the stream.

field.comment: Conditionally required when StreamTerminationDateOffsetUnit(40070) is specified.

field.name: StreamTerminationDateOffsetUnit

blockdef.descr: StreamTerminationDate is a subcomponent of the StreamGrp component used to specify the termination date of the stream.

block.comment: When specified, this overrides the business centers defined in the DateAdjustment component in Instrument. The specified values would be specific to this instance of the instrument provisions.

field.name: ProvisionDateTenorPeriod
field.comment: Conditionally required when ProvisionDateTenorUnit(40097) is specified.

field.name: ProvisionDateTenorUnit
field.comment: Conditionally required when ProvisionDateTenorPeriod(40096) is specified.

field.name: EncodedProvisionTextLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedProvisionText(40987) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedProvisionText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the ProvisionText(40113) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

descr.p: The ProvisionGrp is a repeating subcomponent of the Instrument component used to detail additional terms and conditions associated with the instrument.
A swap may have one or more provisions

block.comment: When specified, this overrides the business centers defined in the DateAdjustment component in Instrument. The specified values would be specific to this instance of the provisional cash settlement value date.

blockdef.name: RegulatoryTradeIDGrp

field.name: RegulatoryTradeID
field.comment: Required if NoRegulatoryTradeIDs(1907) > 0.

field.name: RegulatoryLegRefID
field.comment: This field may be is used for multi-leg trades sent as a single message to indicate that the entry applies only to a specific leg

blockdef.descr: The SideRegulatoryTradeIDGrp is a repeating component within the TrdCapRptSideGrp component used to report the source, value and relationship of multiple trade identifiers for the same trade side. This component can be used to meet regulatory trade reporting requirements where identifiers such as the Unique Swaps Identifier (USI) are required to be reported, showing the chaining of these identifiers as needed.

field.name: AllocRegulatoryTradeID
field.comment: Required if NoAllocRegulatoryTradeIDs(1908) > 0.

field.name: AllocRegulatoryLegRefID
field.comment: This field may be is used for multi-leg trades sent as a single message to indicate that the entry applies only to a specific leg.

descr.p: The AllocRegulatoryTradeIDGrp is a repeating component within the TrdAllocGrp component used to report the source, value and relationship of multiple trade identifiers for the same trade allocation instance.

This component can be used to meet regulatory trade reporting requirements where identifiers such as the Unique Swaps Identifier (USI) are required to be reported, showing the chaining of these identifiers as needed.

field.name: ProvisionOptionExerciseFixedDate
field.comment: Required if NoProvisionOptionExerciseFixedDates (40142) > 0.

descr.p: The ProvisionOptionExerciseFixedDateGrp is a repeating component within the ProvisionOptionExerciseDates component used to report an array of unadjusted or adjusted fixed exercise dates.

For the purpose of optimization, the ProvisionOptionExerciseFixedDateType(40144) field may optionally be omitted after the first instance provided the instance(s) which immediately follow is of the same date type. When the next instance requires a different date type from the prior instance, the ProvisionOptionExerciseFixedDateType(40144) is required to specify the date type.

field.name: SideRegulatoryTradeID

field.name: SideRegulatoryLegRefID
field.comment: This field may be is used for multi-leg trades sent as a single message to indicate that the entry applies only to a specific leg.

descr.p: The SideRegulatoryTradeIDGrp is a repeating component within the TrdCapRptSideGrp component used to report the source, value and relationship of multiple trade identifiers for the same trade side.

This component can be used to meet regulatory trade reporting requirements where identifiers such as the Unique Swaps Identifier (USI) are required to be reported, showing the chaining of these identifiers as needed.

field.name: ProvisionOptionRelevantUnderlyingDateOffsetPeriod
field.comment: Conditionally required when ProvisionOptionRelevantUnderlyingDateOffsetUnit(40160) is specified.

field.name: ProvisionOptionRelevantUnderlyingDateOffsetUnit
field.comment: Conditionally required when ProvisionOptionRelevantUnderlyingDateOffsetPeriod(40159) is specified.

blockdef.descr: The ProvisionOptionRelevantUnderlyingDate is a subcomponent within the ProvisionGrp component used to report the option relevant underlying date defined in the provision.

field.comment: When specified, this overrides the business day convention defined in the DateAdjustment component in Instrument. The specified value would be specific to this instance of the provisional cash settlement payment dates.

field.name: ProvisionCashSettlPaymentDate
field.comment: Required if NoProvisionCashSettlPaymentDates (40171) > 0.

descr.p: The ProvisionCashSettlPaymentFixedDateGrp is a repeating component within the ProvisionCashSettlPaymentDates component used to report fixed cash settlement payment dates defined in the provision.

For the purpose of optimization, the ProvisionCashSettlPaymentDateType(40173) field may optionally be omitted after the first instance provided the instance(s) which immediately follow is of the same date type. When the next instance requires a different date type from the prior instance, the ProvisionCashSettlPaymentDateType(40173) is required to specify the date type.

blockdef.name: SecondaryAssetGrp

field.comment: Required if NoSecondaryAssetClasses(1976) > 0.

field.name: SecondaryAssetSubClass
field.comment: Required if SecondaryAssetType(1979) is specified.

field.name: SecondaryAssetType
field.comment: Required if SecondaryAssetSubType(2741) is specified.

blockdef.descr: SecondaryAssetGrp is a repeating subcomponent of the Instrument component used to specify secondary assets of a multi-asset swap.

field.name: ProvisionPartyID
field.comment: Required if NoProvisionPartyIDs(40174) > 0.

field.name: ProvisionPartyIDSource
field.comment: Required if NoProvisionPartyIDs(40174) > 0.

field.name: ProvisionPartyRole
field.comment: Required if NoProvisionPartyIDs(40174) > 0. The same roles as PartyRole (452).

descr.p: ProvisionParties is a repeating component within the Provision component used to report the parties identified in the contract provision.
The fields ProvisionPartyID(40175), ProvisionPartyIDSource(40176) and ProvisionPartyIDRole(40177) are conditionally required when any one these fields is specified.

field.name: UnderlyingEventType
field.comment: Required if NoUnderlyingEvents(1982) > 0.

field.name: UnderlyingEventDate
field.comment: Conditionally required when UnderlyingEventTime(1984) is specified.

field.name: UnderlyingEventTimeUnit
field.comment: Conditionally required when UnderlyingEventTimePeriod(1986) is specified.

field.name: UnderlyingEventTimePeriod
field.comment: Conditionally required when UnderlyingEventTimeUnit(1985) is specified.

field.name: EncodedUnderlyingEventTextLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedUnderlyingEventText(2073) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedUnderlyingEventText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the UnderlyingEventText(2071) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

descr.p: UnderlyingEventGrp is a repeating subcomponent of the UnderlyingInstrument component used to specify events associated with the instrument.

The UnderlyingEvntGrp contains three different methods to express a "time" associated with the event using the UnderlyingEventDate(1983) and UnderlyingEventTime(1984) pair of fields or the UnderlyingEventTimeUnit(1985) and UnderlyingEventTimePeriod(1986) pair of fields or UnderlyingEventMonthYear(2342).

The UnderlyingEventDate(1983), and optional UnderlyingEventTime(1984), may be used to specify an exact date and optional time for the event. The UnderlyingEventTimeUnit(1985) and UnderlyingEventTimePeriod(1986) may be used to express a time period associated with the event, e.g. 3-month, 4-years, 2-weeks. The UnderlyingEventMonthYear(2342), and optional UnderlyingEventTime(1984), may be used to express the event as a month of year, with optional day of month or week of month.

Either UnderlyingEventDate(1983) or UnderlyingEventMonthYear(2342), and the optional UnderlyingEventTime(1984), must be specified or UnderlyingEventTimeUnit(1985) and UnderlyingEventTimePeriod(1986) must be specified.
The UnderlyingEventMonthYear(2342) may be used instead of UnderlyingEventDate(1983) when month-year, with optional day of month or week of month, is required instead of a date.

blockdef.name: ProvisionPtysSubGrp

field.name: ProvisionPartySubID
field.comment: Required if NoProvisionPartySubIDs(40178) > 0.

field.name: ProvisionPartySubIDType
field.comment: Required if NoProvisionPartySubIDs(40178) > 0.

blockdef.descr: ProvisionPtysSubGrp is a repeating component within the ProvisionParties component used to extend information to be reported for the party.

blockdef.name: UnderlyingComplexEvents

field.name: UnderlyingComplexEventType
field.comment: Required if NoUnderlyingComplexEvents(2045) > 0.

field.name: UnderlyingComplexEventCondition
field.comment: Conditionally required when there are more than one UnderlyingComplexEvent occurrences. A chain of events must be linked together through use of the UnderlyingComplexEventCondition(2052) in which the relationship between any two events is described. For any two occurances of events the first occurrence will specify the UnderlyingComplexEventCondition(2052) which links it with the second event.

group.comment: Conditionally required when there are more than one UnderlyingComplexEvents occurrences. A chain of UnderlyingComplexEvents must be linked together through use of the UnderlyingComplexEventCondition(2052) in which the relationship between any two events is described. For any two UnderlyingComplexEvents the first occurrence will specify the UnderlyingComplexEventCondition(2052) which links it with the second event.

blockdef.descr: UnderlyingComplexEvents is a repeating subcomponent of the UnderlyingInstrument component used to specify an unlimited number and types of events in the lifetime of an option.

blockdef.name: ProtectionTermGrp

field.name: ProtectionTermNotional
field.comment: Required if NoProtectionTerms(40181) > 0.

blockdef.descr: The ProtectionTermGrp is a repeating component within the Instrument component used to report protection term details referenced from UnderlyingInstrument component.

field.name: ProtectionTermEventUnit
field.comment: Conditionally required when ProtectionTermEventPeriod(40195) is specified.

blockdef.name: UnderlyingComplexEventTimes

field.name: UnderlyingComplexEventStartTime
field.comment: Required if NoUnderlyingComplexEventTimes(2056) > 0.

field.name: UnderlyingComplexEventEndTime
field.comment: Required if NoUnderlyingComplexEventTimes(2056) > 0.

blockdef.descr: UnderlyingComplexEventTimes is a repeating subcomponent of the UnderlyingComplexEventDates component used to specify the time ranges when a complex event is in effect.

field.name: LegEventType
field.comment: Required if NoLegEvents(2059) > 0.

field.name: LegEventDate
field.comment: Conditionally required when LegEventTime(2062) is specified.

field.name: LegEventTimeUnit
field.comment: Conditionally required when LegEventTimePeriod(2064) is specified.

field.name: LegEventTimePeriod
field.comment: Conditionally required when LegEventTimeUnit(2063) is specified.

field.name: EncodedLegEventTextLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedLegEventText(2075) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedLegEventText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the LegEventText(2066) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

descr.p: The LegEvntGrp is a repeating subcomponent of the InstrumentLeg component used to specify events associated with the instrument.

The LegEvntGrp contains three different methods to express a "time" associated with the event using the LegEventDate(2061) and LegEventTime(2062) pair of fields or the LegEventTimeUnit(2063) and LegEventTimePeriod(2064) pair of fields or LegEventMonthYear(2341).

The LegEventDate(2061), and optional LegEventTime(2062), may be used to express an exact date and optional time for the event. The LegEventTimeUnit(2063) and LegEventTimePeriod(2064) may be used to express a time period associated with the event, e.g. 3-month, 4-years, 2-weeks. The LegEventMonthYear(2341), and optional LegEventTime(2062), may be used to express the event as a month of year, with optional day of month or week of month.
Either LegEventDate(2061) or LegEventMonthYear(2341), and the optional LegEventTime(2062), must be specified or LegEventTimeUnit(2063) and LegEventTimePeriod(2064) must be specified.
The LegEventMonthYear(2341) may be used instead of LegEventDate(2061) when month-year, with optional day of month or week of month, is required instead of a date.

blockdef.name: ProtectionTermEventQualifierGrp

field.name: ProtectionTermEventQualifier
field.comment: Required if NoProtectionTermEventQualifiers(40199) > 0.

blockdef.descr: The ProtectionTermEventQualifierGrp is a repeating component within the ProtectionTermEventGrp component used to specify qualifying attributes to the event.

field.comment: Required if NoLegSecondaryAssetClasses(2076) > 0.

field.name: LegSecondaryAssetType

blockdef.name: PaymentGrp

field.name: PaymentType
field.comment: Required if NoPayments(40212) > 0

field.name: PaymentAmount
field.comment: Either PaymentAmount(40217), PaymentFixedRate(43097) or PaymentRFloatingRateIndex(43098) must be specified.

field.name: PaymentBusinessDayConvention
field.comment: When specified, this overrides the business day convention defined in the DateAdjustment component in Instrument. The specified value would be specific to this instance of the payment information.

block.comment: When specified, this overrides the business centers defined in the DateAdjustment component in Instrument. The specified values would be specific to this instance of the payment information.

field.name: EncodedPaymentTextLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedPaymentText(40985) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedPaymentText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the PaymentText(40229) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

field.name: PaymentDateOffsetPeriod
field.comment: Conditionally required when PaymentDateOffsetUnit(41158) is specified.

field.name: PaymentDateOffsetUnit
field.comment: Conditionally required when PaymentDateOffsetPeriod(41157) is specified.

field.name: PaymentLegRefID
field.comment: Used to link a payment back to its parent InstrumentLeg by using the same value as the parent's LegID(1788).

field.name: PaymentFixedRate
field.comment: Either PaymentAmount(40217), PaymentFixedRate(43097) or PaymentFloatingRateIndex(43098) must be specified.

field.name: PaymentFloatingRateIndex
field.comment: Either PaymentAmount(40217), PaymentFixedRate(43097) or PaymentFloatingRateIndex(43098) must be specified.

field.comment: Conditionally required when PaymentFloatingRateIndexCurvePeriod(43099) is specified.

field.name: PaymentFloatingRateSpread
field.comment: Conditionally required when PaymentFloatingRateIndex(43098) is specified and the spread to the index is not "zero". When the spread to the index is "zero" this may be omitted.

field.name: PaymentRateResetFrequencyUnit
field.comment: Conditionally required when PaymentRateResetFrequencyPeriod(43104) is specified.

field.name: PaymentRateResetFrequencyPeriod
field.comment: Conditionally required when PaymentRateResetFrequencyUnit(43105) is specified.

field.name: PaymentFrequencyUnit
field.comment: Conditionally required when PaymentFrequencyPeriod(43102) is specified.

field.name: PaymentFrequencyPeriod
field.comment: Conditionally required when PaymentFrequencyUnitPeriod(43103) is specified.

blockdef.descr: The PaymentGrp is a repeating component used to report additional payments or bullet payments.

descr.p: PaymentSettlParties is a repeating subcomponent of the PaymentSettlGrp component used to report payment settlement routing.
The fields PaymentSettlPartyID(40233), PaymentSettlPartyIDSource(40234) and PaymentSettlPartyIDRole(40235) are conditionally required when any one these fields is specified.

blockdef.descr: PaymentSettlSubParties is a repeating component within the PaymentSettlParties component used to extend information to be reported for the party.

field.name: LegStreamType
field.comment: Required if NoLegStreams(40241) > 0.

field.name: EncodedLegStreamTextLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedLegStreamText(40979) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedLegStreamText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the LegStreamText(40248) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

field.name: LegStreamNotionalFrequencyPeriod
field.comment: Conditionally required when LegStreamNotionalFrequencyUnit(41704) is specified.

field.name: LegStreamNotionalFrequencyUnit
field.comment: Conditionally required when LegStreamNotionalFrequencyPeriod(41703) is specified.

descr.p: The LegStreamGrp is a repeating subcomponent of the InstrumentLeg component used to detail the swap streams associated with the instrument.

A swap will ordinarily have one or two streams. Each one may contain a LegStreamDescr(4024) with a descriptive string such as "Float" or "Fixed". However the choice of description should have no effect on the stream's purpose.

LegStreamPaySide(40244) and LegStreamReceiveSide(40245) link the appropriate swap parties to their role in the stream. In pre-trade messages the side value (e.g. Side(54) field) of the request or order should arbitrarily be "1" (Buy) or "2" (Sell), and LegStreamPaySide(40244) and LegStreamReceiveSide(40245) should be set to the same side value indicating the aggressor's desired role. On fills and post-trade messages, the executing firm takes the opposite side and indicates its role by setting LegStreamPaySide(40244) and LegStreamReceiveSide(40245) to the opposite side of the aggressor's role.

blockdef.descr: LegPaymentStreamFloatingRate is a subcomponent of the LegPaymentStream component used to report the floating rate attributes of the payment stream.
blockdef.comment: Note that if the floating rate index or the rate calculation goes negative for a calculation period and LegPaymentStreamNegativeRateTreatment(40349)=1 (Negative interest rate method) the Receiver pays the Payer the absolute floating rate, i.e. the Receiver pays the cash flow amount to the Payer. The Calculation Lag Interval (LegPaymentStreamCalculationLagPeriod(41578) and LegPaymentStreamCalculationLagUnit(41579)) and the First Observation Offset Duration (LegPaymentStreamFirstObservationDateOffsetPeriod(41580) and LegPaymentStreamFirstObservationDateOffsetUnit(41581)) are used together. If the First Observation Offset Duration is specified, the observation starts the Fixing Lag Interval prior to each calculation. If the First Observation Offset Duration is not specified, the observation starts immediately preceeding each calculation.

field.name: UnderlyingStreamType
field.comment: Required if NoUnderlyingStreams(40540) > 0.

field.name: EncodedUnderlyingStreamTextLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedUnderlyingStreamText(40989) field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedUnderlyingStreamText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the UnderlyingStreamText(40547) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding(347) field.

field.name: UnderlyingStreamNotionalFrequencyPeriod
field.comment: Conditionally required when UnderlyingStreamNotionalFrequencyUnit(42020) is specified.

field.name: UnderlyingStreamNotionalFrequencyUnit
field.comment: Conditionally required when UnderlyingStreamNotionalFrequencyPeriod(42019) is specified.

descr.p: The UnderlyingStreamGrp is a repeating subcomponent of the UnderlyingInstrument component used to detail the swap streams associated with the instrument.

A swap will ordinarily have one or two payment streams. Each one may contain an UnderlyingStreamDescr(40542) with a descriptive string such as "Float" or "Fixed". However the choice of description should have no effect on the stream's purpose.

UnderlyingStreamPaySide(40543) and UnderlyingStreamReceiveSide(40544) link the appropriate swap parties to their role in the stream. In pre-trade messages the Sside value (e.g. Side(54) field) of the request or order should arbitrarily be "1" (Buy) or "2" (Sell), and UnderlyingStreamPaySide(40543) and UnderlyingStreamReceiveSide(40544) should be set to the same side value indicating the aggressor's desired role. On fills and post-trade messages, the executing firm takes the opposite side and indicates its role by setting UnderlyingStreamPaySide(40543) and UnderlyingStreamReceiveSide(40544) to the opposite side of the aggressor's role.

blockdef.descr: UnderlyingPaymentStreamFloatingRate is a subcomponent of the UnderlyingPaymentStream component used to report the floating rate attributes of the stream.
blockdef.comment: Note that if the floating rate index or the rate calculation goes negative for a calculation period and UnderlyingPaymentStreamNegativeRateTreatment(40638)=1 (Negative interest rate method) the Receiver pays the Payer the absolute floating rate, i.e. the Receiver pays the cash flow amount to the Payer. The Calculation Lag Interval (UnderlyingPaymentStreamCalculationLagPeriod(41926) and UnderlyingPaymentStreamCalculationLagUnit(41927)) and the First Observation Offset Duration (UnderlyingPaymentStreamFirstObservationDateOffsetPeriod(41928) and UnderlyingPaymentStreamFirstObservationDateOffsetUnit(41929)) are used together. If the First Observation Offset Duration is specified, the observation starts the Fixing Lag Interval prior to each calculation. If the First Observation Offset Duration is not specified, the observation starts immediately preceeding each calculation.

descr.p: UnderlyingPaymentStreamNonDeliverableFixingDate is a subcomponent of the UnderlyingPaymentStreamNonDeliverableSettlTerms component used to specify predetermined fixing dates.

For the purpose of optimization, the UnderlyingNonDeliverableFixingDateType(40658) field may optionally be omitted after the first instance provided the instance(s) which immediately follow is of the same date type. When the next instance requires a different date type from the prior instance, the UnderlyingNonDeliverableFixingDateType(40658) is required to specify the date type.
